Surely, though, suet is the best -- I think you can get it for free at grocery stores.", 'If you decide to use white sugar instead, put in a spoonful of molasses or sorghum.', "Surely if you don't want to use so much brandy, you may use half brandy and half cider, or some other fruit juice (or even water, really). You could also use only juice, of course, but it's especially nice with brandy or rum."]
Review_0: This is very close to what I recall my grandmother making. I did cut the allspice back to 1/4 tsp. The next time I will use 6 apples since I thought there could me more filling in a 9" pie and I may cut the sugar back to 3/4 cup, but those are personal choices and no reflection on the recipe. Thanks, Rosa!

Recipe_Name: St. Paddy's Day Leftover Corned Beef Casserole
Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 25 mins', 'Cook Time: 1 hr', 'Total Time: 1 hr 25 mins', 'Servings: 8', 'Yield: 8 servings']
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '¬Ω onion, chopped', '1 pound cooked corned beef, cut into bite-size pieces', '¬Ω cup chili sauce', '¬Ω cup mayonnaise', '1 (14 ounce) can sauerkraut, drained', '1 ¬Ω cups shredded Swiss cheese, divided', '1 (12 ounce) can refrigerated biscuit dough']
Directions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 2-quart casserole dish.', 'Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat until bubbly. Cook and stir onion in the melted butter until browned, about 8 minutes. Set onion aside.', 'Stir corned beef, chili sauce, and mayonnaise together in a bowl.', 'Spread sauerkraut in the bottom of the prepared casserole dish.', 'Spoon corned beef mixture on top of sauerkraut. Sprinkle cooked onions on top of corned beef mixture. Top onions with 1/2 cup Swiss cheese.', 'Cover casserole dish with aluminum foil and place in preheated oven. Bake 30 minutes.', 'Cut individual biscuits in half. Remove casserole from oven and place halved biscuits on top of casserole. Bake until biscuits are lightly golden brown, about 18 minutes.', 'Sprinkle remaining 1 cup Swiss cheese on top of casserole. Return to oven and bake until cheese is melted, 3 to 5 minutes.']
MHPR_Review: Wonderful dish with leftovers and additions in this recipe!!!! I am Irish and German...so the corned beef and sauerkraut is PERFECTLY yummy. My husband enjoyed it very much too. Made the recipe as is with only a bit more swiss cheese to our tastes. Will be making this often!

Review_2: Wonderful dish with leftovers and additions in this recipe!!!! I am Irish and German...so the corned beef and sauerkraut is PERFECTLY yummy. My husband enjoyed it very much too. Made the recipe as is with only a bit more swiss cheese to our tastes. Will be making this often!
Review_3: Everyone at my party loved it, and requested it again this year.
Review_4: This was awsome!!!! it does not have a strong saurekraut taste which I was happy about. A good comfort food for those long winter nights

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 25 mins', 'Total Time: 30 mins', 'Servings: 5', 'Yield: 4 to 6 servings']
Ingredients: ['8 eggs, beaten', '1 cup thinly sliced celery', '1 cup finely chopped onion', '1 cup bean sprouts', '¬Ω cup diced fresh mushrooms', '‚Öì cup chopped cooked chicken breast', '‚Öì cup cooked and crumbled ground beef', '‚Öì cup chopped cooked pork', '1 teaspoon salt', '¬º teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 cubes chicken bouillon', '1 ¬Ω cups hot water', '1 ¬Ω teaspoons white sugar', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '6 tablespoons cold water', '1 ¬Ω tablespoons cornstarch']
Directions: ['Beat eggs in a large bowl. Add the celery, onion, bean sprouts, mushrooms, chicken, beef, pork, salt and pepper. Mix together.', 'Heat oil in a medium skillet or wok and brown egg mixture 1/2 cup at a time. When all of the mixture is browned, set aside.', 'To Make Sauce: Dissolve the bouillon in the hot water in a small saucepan; add sugar and soy sauce and blend well over medium heat. Add cold water and cornstarch and stir until thick and smooth. Serve with Egg Foo Yung.']
MHPR_Review: Fabulous! We loved it. Was quick, easy and delicious. I didn't have any leftover meat, so I bought some "wafer-thin" (1/4 inch) boneless center cut pork chops. Marinated them for a little while in soy sauce, then seared them with a bit of oil. Took only minutes to cook. Chopped them up and proceeded with the egg foo yung recipe. I used an omelet pan with just a splash of oil, cooking one serving at a time. Cooked til golden brown, turned, browned the other side, and then kept them warm on in the oven while I cooked the rest. The patties cook very quickly so it didn't take long. The sauce is simple and perfect for this dish. Was a bit thin, so I added a little more cornstarch to thicken. Sprinkle a bit of chopped green onion on top for garnish. I served this dish with steamed rice, store-bought spring rolls, and Chinese Cabbage Salad II (recipe on this website). A wonderful, satisfying and healthy meal!
Review_0: I love all your recipes! Your site I recommend to everyone!
Review_1: If I chopped all of the veggies up, I'm sure it would have been five stars but I cheated. Shout out to Sarafusa and Rosemary for your great tips. I used a can of La Choy Chop Suey veggies, drained to replace the chopped veggies. I followed Rosemary's advice on how to make the sauce and salt secret. Both were spot on! Since I'm so lazy, this is the way for my hubby and I to enjoy Chinese food at home.
Review_2: Not the best I've had, and it was a lot of work. Don't know how they came up with such a short prep time, but it took me an hour--start to finish--and it's all standing at the counter or at the stove. It was good, but I'm going to stick to carry out for my egg foo yung.
Review_3: Great recipe! Will make again.
Review_4: Super easy and oh so good ,Husband says best he‚Äôs ever had
Review_5: I did make it. My husband really like but said I needed to work on the gravy. Said it was not sweet enough. Really liked I will just keep playing with that. I would totally say to try the recipe. really good. I will definitely make again.
Review_6: I have been hungry for egg foo yung for a couple of months and knew it was easy to make. I made two plain for me and the rest I added pork for my dh. The only thing I will do different is double the recipe for sauce. Soooooo Good!
Review_7: The only change to this delicious recipe was reducing the amount of sugar. This recipe is easy to make and a family favorite!
Review_8: This was fantastic! I would thicken the sauce a little more next time.

Directions: ['In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over high heat. Stir in the steak and season with salt and pepper. Cook to desired doneness.']
MHPR_Review: I have made this several times but never reviewed. This is SO good! The one and only thing that I change is that I add minced garlic to the beef when cooking it. I also omit the onions (picky kids) but add onion powder. As for the meat being tough, since I have cooked this many times, I have also ended up with tough meat. I found the answer. I saw on several cooking shows that if you cut against the grain of the meat (in the opposite direction)..it makes it almost fall apart. I let mine simmer for 30 mins. This is one of our favorites and even my picky non vegetable eaters love this meal!!
Review_0: Very good!!
Review_1: I didn't have the broccoli soup, but I 'finagled' the recipe to include instead some garlic, green peppers, some sweet & hot chili sauce, and a bit of cornstarch to make a sauce. Turned out great! :-D (and great if you're on keto!)
Review_2: I questioned it with the soup in it but I used cream of mushroom S it's what I had and added some onion and pea pods. It was the best I ever tried!!!!
Review_3: It was rather yummy for the simplicity of it. Which to be far is the reason I choose it. My family enjoyed and I will likely make it again.
Review_4: I‚Äôm used to take out and the soup made it thicker . I just read the suggestion to pound the meat out to make it more tinder. After my recipe was almost complete, I realized this needs something to go with it. I threw on my rice pot to finish it off.
Review_5: I used leftover roast to make this. My family loved it! I made no changes and served it over rice. Definitely a keeper!
Review_6: My husband and I really liked this meal! It was actually quite tasty. The grocery store did not have cream of broccoli soup, so I used cream of mushroom soup. I did not add any salt since I used regular soy sauce; I knew the soy sauce and the canned soup would provide enough salt. Thank you for this recipe! I will cook it again.
Review_7: This was an easy, delicious recipe that I was able to make very quickly. It‚Äôs a keeper.??
Review_8: This was a hit at my house but I did use broccoli cheese soup because my kids are cheese lovers!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 30 mins', 'Cook Time: 6 hrs', 'Total Time: 6 hrs 30 mins', 'Servings: 8', 'Yield: 8 servings']

MHPR_Review: I made one change and that was to replace the ketchup with tomato sauce. It might not have been but I was afraid of it being too sweet. This turned out good and is one I would make again.
