Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 10 mins', 'Additional Time: 2 hrs', 'Total Time: 2 hrs 25 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['¬Ω cup olive oil', '¬Ω cup red wine vinegar', '1 ¬Ω teaspoons garlic powder', '1 ¬Ω teaspoons dried basil', '1 ¬Ω teaspoons dried oregano', '¬æ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¬æ teaspoon white sugar', '2 ¬Ω cups cooked elbow macaroni', '3 cups fresh sliced mushrooms', '15 cherry tomatoes, halved', '1 cup sliced red bell peppers', '¬æ cup crumbled feta cheese', '¬Ω cup chopped green onions', '1 (4 ounce) can whole black olives', '¬æ cup sliced pepperoni sausage, cut into strips']
Directions: ['In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, vinegar, garlic powder, basil, oregano, black pepper, and sugar. Add cooked pasta, mushrooms, tomatoes, red peppers, feta cheese, green onions, olives, and pepperoni. Toss until evenly coated. Cover, and chill 2 hours or overnight.']
MHPR_Review: I'm so glad I waited to review this until the day after I made it. I tried it after chilling it for a couple of hours and wasn't too thrilled with it. I just made a bowl now, after it being in the fridge overnight and wow! It isn't dry at all and the flavors have really mingled and developed! I followed other's suggestions and used half balsamic vinegar instead of all red wine vinegar. I also used rotini pasta, regular tomatoes, portobello mushrooms, red and green bell peppers, and a small purple onion. I left out the pepperoni just because I didn't have any, but next time I'll definately add it. As good as it tastes, if you do use balsamic, be warned that the pasta and feta will look brownish. I think someone else mentioned this, but if you're making for company, you might want to use white balsamic vinegar. This is soooo good, thank you for the great recipe!
Review_0: The recipe is okay. Many ways to improveVinegrette: I kept the olive oil and red wine vinegar, substituted 3 clovees of roasted garlic that I had, used Italian dried herbs (crush before adding) added 1 tsp of miso that I had. put in the blender to emulsify.Cook pasta al dente then add the vinegrette while still warm-adds so much more flavorNo need for sausage. Add artichoke hearts, slivered peppers, soaked red onions (help to take out bittenerness), diced cucumbers without seeds. Keep the feta. Bueno appetitio
Review_1: Check the nutrition! This is more than 700 calories and is 75% of your daily allowance of fat. It's more than 50% of your daily allowance for sodium, too! There's got to be a healthier version. I bet if you dump the pepperoni, the numbers may improve. Or, perhaps use turkey pepperoni. But as written, it's a chilled coronary.
Review_2: Less sugarNo mushroomsAdded cucumbersFresh basil finely choppedHalf White balsamic vinegar/half red wine vinegarSalt, cracked pepperYum!Yum!
Review_3: I read the reviews and they were very helpful. One review that was my favorite somehow disappeared. I followed her recommendations to halve the oil and vinegar retaining the herb amounts. I followed someone else's suggestion and added not only crimini mushrooms, but also a few marinated artichoke hearts. I used 2 oz of olives and next time I think I will try the kalamata oluves. Instead of salami I used a new thing from Trader Joe's, Turkey summer sausage. I took this to a 3rd of July picnic at a winery and the ladies went wild!
Review_4: Great recipe!! I added pimento, kalamata olives perfect!!
Review_5: Very easy recipe. The only thing I added was a can of low sodium kidney beans. I would definately make this again!!!Perfect for a hot night...like today
Review_6: After reading all of the comments, I adjusted recipe before making it. Used half white balsamic vinegar and half apple cider vinegar, no mushrooms and added a few slivered carrot slices. It was excellent. Made it for a neighbourhood party and then made it again a couple of days later for myself. I definitely recommend this and will make it time and time again.
Review_7: Very good summer salad. I added 1 tsp lemon juice to the dressing and substituted chicken apple sausage for the pepperoni because that's what I had in the house. Will def make again!
Review_8: Everyone loved this salad! Made it the night before. Added salt, 1/2 fresh minced garlic, and 1/2 powder to the dressing. Based on other reviews used both red and green onions, red, yellow, and orange bell peppers. No mushrooms or pepperoni, instead added Persian cucumbers. Also squeezed the juice of a fresh lemon.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 30 mins', 'Total Time: 45 mins', 'Servings: 6', 'Yield: 6 servings']
Ingredients: ['2 (14.5 ounce) cans chicken broth', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chopped stewed tomatoes', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can tomato-vegetable juice cocktail', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed tomato soup', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach', '1 pinch ground nutmeg', 'salt to taste', 'ground black pepper to taste', '¬Ω cup cooked macaroni']
Directions: ['Combine broth, tomatoes, juice, and soup in a saucepan with a wire whisk over medium heat. Add sugar, spinach, nutmeg, and salt and pepper to taste, without thawing spinach. Allow to heat gently 20 minutes on medium-low until spinach is tender. Keep hot without letting it boil.', 'Add cooked pasta and cook for 10 minutes longer.']
MHPR_Review: Make sure to use a small pasta if possible.
Review_0: This was very good but next time, I think I will cut the sugar back to 1-1/2 - 2 tsp. instead of the full Tbsp. It seemed overly sweet to me and I felt I had to compensate that by using more salt than I would like. I will also use fresh spinach instead of frozen. (If using fresh, add it at the end when you put the pasta in). It is heavy on the spinach so if you aren‚Äôt a fan, you may want to use less. Also, cooking it on med.-low seemed to take forever so after nearly 45 min., I put the heat up to medium until it was hot enough to eat. I sprinkled each bowl with some Parmesan cheese at the end. This one‚Äôs a keeper. Thanks!
Review_1: No changes. Yes, will make again
Review_2: If you like reviews dead on to the recipe, skip this one. I followed the intent of the recipe, but took some big liberties with the tomatoes. I did not use canned tomatoes or tomato soup, instead I used garden fresh tomatoes. I put some EVOO on a half sheet, then loaded that full with tomatoes, cut in half, cut side down. I put in the oven at 350 until the tops had browned slightly. I then put them in the pot along with the other ingredients and cooked until the spinach was a little tender. FANTASTIC. I will make again.
Review_3: First time I made it was a little off for us, I made a few little changes, omitted the nutmeg and I used plan tomato juice
Review_4: Great soup. Only thing I added was shredded Parmesan cheese on top each bowl of hot soup. Really kicks it up a notch
Review_5: This is quick 'n easy, yet it tastes and feels like it's homemade from scratch. Not wanting to cook my pasta separately, I brought the tomato broth mixture to a boil, added 1/4c dry pasta and cooked until al dente. Then I reduced the heat to low, added about 8 oz of fresh baby spinach, torn, and cooked until wilted. Will definitely be making this one again.
Review_6: I used half the spinach, and this was the perfect amount for us! Really good with grilled cheese sandwiches!
Review_7: I used fresh spinach instead of frozen, tomato sauce instead of tomato soup, added thin sliced carrots, and doubled the cooking time for a thicker consistency. Very good! I will likely make again.
Review_8: I have been making this soup for years and it has never failed to impress my guests or myself. Sometimes when I am making meatballs I will make a pan of marble sized balls, freeze them up, bag them and throw a hand full into the soup as I am reheating it. Also sometimes instead of pasta I use rice. Great with Parmesan cheese sprinkled of top. It's all good!!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 30 mins', 'Cook Time: 15 mins', 'Total Time: 45 mins', 'Servings: 2', 'Yield: 2 servings']
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 cup milk', '¬Ω cup cooked, cubed chicken breast meat', '¬Ω cup cooked and cubed ham', '¬Ω cup cooked wide egg noodles', '¬º cup chopped celery', '¬º teaspoon salt', '¬º teaspoon ground black pepper', '3 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 teaspoon paprika']
Directions: ['Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).', 'Melt butter in a large saucepan over low heat. Stir in the flour and heat until bubbly. Slowly add the milk, stirring constantly, until mixture is thickened and smooth.', 'Remove from heat and stir in the chicken, ham, noodles, celery, salt and ground black pepper. Transfer this mixture to a 1 1/2 quart casserole dish.', 'Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 15 minutes. Remove from oven, sprinkle with the cheese and top with paprika, as desired. Return to oven and bake for 5 to 10 minutes, or until cheese is bubbly.']
MHPR_Review: Took the advice from other reviewers and doubled up on this yummy recipe plus added a can of "healthy" cream of mushroom soup. Didn't use the celery but used green pepper and asparagus. Some garlic and onion powder added to the flavor. Once assembled I shredded cheddar cheese on top and sprinkled with bread crumbs and dotted with butter. The whole family loved it!
Review_0: Very good simple casserole. Please note that this recipe is for two servings. And it‚Äôs a perfect size for two.
Review_1: Oh my goodness...this was the best and easiest casserole I've had in ages. Made the recipe exactly as stated and have saved it in my own personal recipe book as I plan to make this many, many more times. Maybe next time I just may add a few more veggies to the mix just to experiment but this recipe totally stands on it's own for sure. Love!
Review_2: I added mushrooms and used arborio rice and gouda cheese. It was great. This recipe can be amended and changed in many ways. Cheese can vary, meats can change, a dash of white wine or broth would work. Red or green peppers could be added for some color. I also used an iron skillet for saut√©ing and for baking--cuts down on pots needed. I made rice but this would be a good use for rice left over from Chinese carry-out.
Review_3: I thought this was much better than I was expecting. I cooked an onion and garlic in a pan with no oil and did add it into the mixture. I also added dry mustard, oregano and cayenne pepper. I had to use spaghetti noodles because that's all I had. And I did add the can of mushroom soup like many suggested. The only ham I had was sliced deli ham but I used some of it and I liked it.
Review_4: It wasn't bad. It needs more "spice" in my opinion. I added a can of Cream of Mushroom soup, from the advice of a previous reviewer, and also added some mixed vegetables. I may make this again but add more things here and there to add more taste to it.
Review_5: This was good but not great. I felt that the recipe had 3 flaws - too much ham, too much sauce and not enough noodles. Thankfully I had cooked extra noodles so I added them in but it still wasn't enough. And the ham overpowered the dish...it's all I could taste. I might make again but will modify accordingly. Couldn't eat it again as written.
Review_6: This is a good casserole to use up leftovers. In my case, I used all ham in the recipe. I increased the ingredients to make servings for 6 as I wanted to freeze a small casserole dish. This dish came together easily and was enjoyed by my family. I would make this again if I had ham and or chicken to use up. I served this with lettuce salad and green beans.
Review_7: Thought I would try this, as I needed to use up some leftover ham and chicken. It turned out ok although very creamy which didn't appeal and also it lacked something, but not sure what. My husband loved it however but I told him to enjoy, as he won't be seeing it on the table again. ;-)
Review_8: This turned out very good. I used about 2 cups of cooked noodles, 1 cup chicken, and 1 cup ham. I also added 1 cup of frozen mixed vegetables. With those changes, it's a good meal for two people. I lowered the calorie count by using skim milk and fat free cheese. Still tasted great! The paprika adds a nice flavor.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 1 hr', 'Total Time: 1 hr 10 mins', 'Servings: 8', 'Yield: 8 servings']
Ingredients: ['1 cup leftover cooked pinto beans', '1 cup leftover cooked macaroni', '1 cup leftover ground sausage', '1 large onion, chopped and sauteed', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 teaspoon chopped fresh parsley', '1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '1 tablespoon chopped garlic', 'salt and pepper to taste']
Directions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'In a large bowl combine the beans, macaroni, sausage, onion, tomatoes, parsley, cayenne pepper, garlic, salt and pepper. Mix well and spread mixture in a lightly greased 9x13 inch baking dish.', 'Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 1 hour.']
MHPR_Review: This was soooo good and soooo easy. I love the ease of preparation.
Review_0: I made it from mostly fresh ingredients, (store) canned pinto beans, tomatoes & onion from garden. Added 1/2 pint pickled bell peppers I canned, 1/8 cup-ish dash of panko breadcrumbs before oven. Also added sharp cheddar & a dash of parmesan at the 15 min oven point. Served mine with sour cream, he dumped ketchup on before he even tasted it...great use of fresh ground sausage from our butcher, I'll make it again. Really easy filling dinner on a cold day.
Review_1: Really delicious. Economical, simple, ingredients on-hand. Used red kidney beans in place of the pinto, just because it's what I had. Tossed some shredded cheddar on top of half and let it melt before serving. We all liked it even better with the melted cheddar.
Review_2: Was good. added 1/4 cup ground sausage, 1/2 lb carne asada, 2 cans tomatos with green chilis and 2 cans beans. one pinto, one chipotle chili bean. came out so yummy...i made it again 2 days later. definately add cheese on top, and nothing better than garden fresh cut cilantro to add a kick. i also added vlasic sliced jalapenos to the top, under the cheese during last 10 minutes cooking.
Review_3: Great comfort food.
Review_4: This was a very good casserole. It was a nice change from the obvious casserole recipes that are out there!
Review_5: this was good! i doubled the recipe..only using one can of KIDNEY beans..used italian sweet sausage..1 Tbsp. of DRIED parsley instead of the fresh..red pepper flakes instead of the cayenne..and lots of fresh garlic! no salt needed..only baked for 30 minutes...topped with light sour cream per serving..goes a long way! did not use an onion...thank you Pauline!
Review_6: This was very good. I made it in a 9x9 pan, and used ground Italian sausage, since I had it on hand. It came out very spicy, next time I'll reduce the cayenne pepper by half
Review_7: This recipe is easy, the flavors are right on, and has the potential to be delicious. I learned 4 things: (1) do check your diced tomatoes to be sure they aren't canned in balsamic vinegar - ew (2) large pasta, like penne, sticks out of the "sauce" and hardens (3) this would fit in a 9x9 and keep everything moist and (4) everything is already cooked, so the 1 hour cooking time dried it out. Next time I'll use smaller pasta, put it in a 9x9, and only cook for 30 minutes, topping it with cheese in the last few minutes.
Review_8: This was very tasty. Worth buying the ingredients if you don't happen to have the leftovers. I added cubed provolone cheese halfway through baking and sprinkled with shredded mozzeralla in the last few minutes. It was great.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 1 hr 15 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr 30 mins', 'Servings: 20', 'Yield: 1 9x13 inch baking dish']
Ingredients: ['¬Ω pound thin egg noodles, cooked', '¬Ω cup butter', '1 ¬Ω cups white sugar', '1 quart milk', '1 pint heavy cream', '1 ounce anise extract', '3 tablespoons vanilla extract', '12 eggs', '8 ounces ricotta cheese']
Directions: ['Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).', 'In large mixing bowl, combine noodles, butter, sugar, milk, cream, anise, vanilla, eggs and ricotta. Spoon into 9x13 inch baking dish and bake for 1 1/4 hours, until golden and knife inserted in center comes out clean. Cool and serve.']
MHPR_Review: Traditionally served at Easter and my favorite Italian dessert! This recipe is a wonderful custard like pie with no crust. To make it easier I boil the noodles (break them up into pieces about 1 inch in length before cooking), drain and put them back in the hot pot with 1/4 c. butter (I cut back from the noted 1/2 c.) and stir till the butter is melted and has coated all the noodles. Then I turn the noodles into the baking pan. I mix the ricotta (which is 1 cup) with the sugar, eggs and vanilla till mixed well then add the milk and cream. I do not use the anise. Pour the liquid over the noodles and bake. I always have some liquid left. The pan is filled to the top making it impossible to fill on the counter and carry to the oven so fill the pan (use a sturdy pan) enough then place in oven on rack and finish filling there. Chill well (overnight is best) before serving. Delicious cold with a sprinkle of cinnamon!!!
Review_0: I loved this recipe
Review_1: We called this spaghetti cake. Our version is a little different. 3/4 pound of capellini #15 broken up 12 whole eggs 2 Oz. Lemon extract 1 1/2 cups sugar 1 pound ricotta Optional small container citron chopped Boil spaghetti and drain well. Mix all other ingredients well , add to spaghetti, and mix well. Pour into greased tube pan. Bake at 325 for 1:30 While hot, loosen around edges and center edge with spatula. Shake. Cool 15 min. Invert on dinner plate, then invert again. Very similar but no butter , milk, or cream.
Review_2: Traditionally served at Easter and my favorite Italian dessert! This recipe is a wonderful custard like pie with no crust. To make it easier I boil the noodles (break them up into pieces about 1 inch in length before cooking), drain and put them back in the hot pot with 1/4 c. butter (I cut back from the noted 1/2 c.) and stir till the butter is melted and has coated all the noodles. Then I turn the noodles into the baking pan. I mix the ricotta (which is 1 cup) with the sugar, eggs and vanilla till mixed well then add the milk and cream. I do not use the anise. Pour the liquid over the noodles and bake. I always have some liquid left. The pan is filled to the top making it impossible to fill on the counter and carry to the oven so fill the pan (use a sturdy pan) enough then place in oven on rack and finish filling there. Chill well (overnight is best) before serving. Delicious cold with a sprinkle of cinnamon!!!
Review_3: Good, but it needed a whole extra hour to cook and I have a brand new chefs oven.
Review_4: instead of holiday cookies my mother would always make Pastia for Christmas. she has been gone now for almost 15 years and her last Christmas with us we had talked about passing down the recipe but she would say "there is no recipe I throw a little bit of this and a little bit of that in there". this is the ONLY recipe I was able to find online and because my mother only called it noodle cake I never even knew the proper name of the recipe to do a better search. I don't care for the anise and I doubt that my mother has ever used it as well because this recipe taste just like she used to make minus the anise. It brought back many tears and great memories the first time I duplicated this recipe. THANK YOU !
Review_5: Made this with almond milk cause my son is allergic to milk. Turned out great. Be sure to mix all the other ingredients before adding the noodles. Had to bake it an extra hour to get it to firm up, possibly because I baked it in a stoneware dish. But it turned out awesome.
Review_6: I made this today. I used my pampered chef pan. It took well over 2 hours to bake. I think next time the oven will be in 325 degrees. Hubby said it tastes delicious.
Review_7: This recipe was easy to make and tasted great! The only problem was that it did not cook in the time suggested by the recipe. It was still completely raw and jiggly. I had to add another 20 minutes of cooking time. I don't know if it was my oven or not. I made sure it was preheated, but it still took nearly two hours.
Review_8: Traditionally served at Easter and my favorite Italian dessert! This recipe is a wonderful custard like pie with no crust. To make it easier I boil the noodles (break them up into pieces about 1 inch in length before cooking), drain and put them back in the hot pot with 1/4 c. butter (I cut back from the noted 1/2 c.) and stir till the butter is melted and has coated all the noodles. Then I turn the noodles into the baking pan. I mix the ricotta (which is 1 cup) with the sugar, eggs and vanilla till mixed well then add the milk and cream. I do not use the anise. Pour the liquid over the noodles and bake. I always have some liquid left. The pan is filled to the top making it impossible to fill on the counter and carry to the oven so fill the pan (use a sturdy pan) enough then place in oven on rack and finish filling there. Chill well (overnight is best) before serving. Delicious cold with a sprinkle of cinnamon!!!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 35 mins', 'Total Time: 40 mins', 'Servings: 3', 'Yield: 2 to 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['3 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cooked and cubed', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup', '¬Ω cup mayonnaise', '1 cup cooked macaroni']
Directions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'In a medium bowl combine the chicken, soup, mayonnaise and macaroni; mix well and spread mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.', 'Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 35 to 45 minutes, or until cooked through.']
MHPR_Review: The Whole Family loved it,Wife couldn't believe how good it was and both of my kids had seconds. Did make some changes after reading up on some other users reviews 1. Used the sour cream instead of the mayo 2. Added Broccoli 3. I also added 1 can of cream of celery. To finish shreeded on a bit of cheddar cheese. P.S. 1 cup of noodles was not enough
Review_0: Been making this for years. We add Parmesan cheese on top at the table. The Parmesan cheese makes this so much better.
Review_1: I didn't have the condensed cream of chicken soup. So I used can of cream of mushroom soup instead. I added 4 oz. can mushrooms to it,also a 15 oz. can of can of sweet peas. I added one cup of chicken broth to the bowl and one tablespoon of basil. My family loved it.
Review_2: Will definitely make this dish again, added seasoning &topped with cheese....DELICIOUS!!!!!!!
Review_3: I had some chicken breast w/ peppers and onion frozen. I cooked the 1/2 box of elbow noodles . Meanwhile in a frying pan w 1 tbs butter,cooked the frozen chicken ,peppers,and onion on low heat with I stalk broccoli crowns in smaller pieces covered. Cubed up chicken breast ,back into pan. Drained noodles and added into same frying pan. Added the sour cream and 2 cans cream chicken soup ,and about 1/2 cup milk to thin out sauce a little . Stir and simmer on low till all ingredients blend together. Simmer on low. Since all ingredients are cooked already you are done. Add some shredded cheese on top and let melt on top if desired.
Review_4: This is a great base recipe for beginners, and easily allows for substitutions and additions. I made it with a group of 9 & 10 year old girls for our church "Activity Days" (they each made their own to take home and serve their family) They had a great time and their mommies were happy not to have to make dinner that night. It needs a little more seasonings and I doubled it to serve a family, plus at least double the macaroni in the original.
Review_5: My family really liked this recipe! I was actually surprised by how much I liked it. I chose it because it was simple and these days I need simple. I made very few changes. First, I doubled the recipe. Next, due to cost, I used chicken thighs rather than chicken breasts. I also seasoned the chicken with garlic salt and pepper while it was cooking. I used 98% fat free soup and lite mayo. Baked it for 40 minutes, then topped with reduced fat cheese. It was very yummy, and resulted in no leftovers.
Review_6: Five stars for a great starting point for chicken noodle casserole. I added 1 can of condensed cream of mushroom soup. One jar 12 oz. turkey gravy. I used 18oz. Of egg noodles and increased the mayo to 1 cup, using 4 large boneless chicken breasts. I also mixed in one can of peas. Yes, for all those who are saying I changed the recipe entirely.. Yes I did. You see, I didn't have a starting point when I ran across this one and I had to make a meal out of the chicken breast I had out thawing already and had no clue what to do with it. So this recipe ( the posters) gave me just the start I needed so hands down a 5 star rating! Thank you!
Review_7: My kids Loved it!! I did tweak it a bit, I added a jar of alfredo sauce along with a handful of fresh grated parmesan cheese to amp it up, my kids eat a lot and there are 5 people in my family. I tossed sliced fresh broccoli n baby carrots to the pasta right before the pasta was done. It was getting late so I used packaged cooked chicken strips. Super good n Fast!! So sorry Gloria that its taken SO LONG to give this yummy dinner a face:) Keeper!! MMMMMMMM
Review_8: great foundation be creative after that

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 30 mins', 'Additional Time: 30 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr 5 mins', 'Servings: 6', 'Yield: 1 2-quart casserole']
Ingredients: ['¬Ω pound extra lean ground beef', '¬Ω cup chopped onions', '¬Ω cup chopped green peppers', '1 (24 ounce) jar spaghetti sauce', '1 (10 ounce) tub PHILADELPHIA Italian Cheese and Herb Cooking Creme, divided', '1 cup KRAFT Shredded Mozzarella Cheese, divided', '3 cups hot cooked penne pasta']
Directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef, onions, and peppers in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.', 'Stir in spaghetti sauce, 3/4 cup cooking creme, and 1/2 cup mozzarella: cook and stir until mozzarella is melted, 2 to 3 minutes. Mix in cooked pasta until evenly coated.', 'Spoon pasta mixture into a 2-quart casserole dish. Top with remaining cooking creme and mozzarella. Cover the dish with aluminum foil.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove the foil and continue baking until heated through, about 5 more minutes.', 'You can substitute Italian sausage for ground beef.', 'Prepare using your favorite flavor spaghetti sauce, such as mushroom or garden vegetable.']
MHPR_Review: This is a great recipe! I made some changes like I used 1 pound of beef, 1 whole green pepper, 1 whole onion, 1 clove of garlic, half a tub of the cooking creme, and 2 cups of mozzarella cheese. It turns out great I am going to use this recipe a lot Thanks!
Review_0: I was trying to replicate a baked penne dish from a local restaurant and this came very close. I didn't realize what cooking creme was and misread it as cream cheese. I ended up using neufchatel, and I would do that again but reduce it to 4-6 ounces only. I also made it vegetarian and did not use any meat. Everyone in my family enjoyed it!
Review_1: My family took 2nd and 3rd helpings! I did make some alterations, like substituting mushrooms for ground beef (made this on Ash Wednesday) and added fresh basil to the mix just before putting it into the casserole dish. I also was unable to find the Italian spread, so I used some Garlic Herb flavor instead along with regular cream cheese. I only put mozzarella cheese to the top and baked it uncovered the entire time. Served it with an Italian salad and garlic bread. Excellent!
Review_2: Wonderful recipe and the cr√©me addition ups the game of the sauce. The one called for in the recipe was not available at the market so I substituted Philadelphia whipped Garden Cream cheese and added Italian seasoning. All who dined said that this recipe was restaurant quality. Many thanks!
Review_3: This was fast, easy, and delicious! I didn‚Äôt have the cooking cream so I just doubled the mozzarella cheese and it turned out great! I used thyme, oregano, basil, and garlic salt for the seasonings and it was very flavorful! My husband isn‚Äôt a big pasta fan and he loved it! Will definitely keep this recipe and look forward to pasta night now!
Review_4: I added more mozzarella cheese to the recipe. I will be making it again. My family loved it, including my picky husband.
Review_5: This has been a favorite in my house since I first made it.
Review_6: I used bison instead of beef and added some spicey sausages with green bell pepper. Turned out great. My family loves it
Review_7: love this! family favorite for years!! i use lots of spices and garlic. sub hamburger for sweet italian sausage. i cant find the cooking creme anymore so i make my own with spices , garlic, italian seasoning. my hubby's favorite pasta dish :)
Review_8: Being Canadian, we don't have access to some delicacies that our neighbours down south have. Since we don't have Italian Cheese and Herb cooking cream, I just used a small container of regular Philly Cream Cheese and seasoned the out of this with Italian spices. My whole family loved it! My 18 month old kept vigorously signing "more"! Cant wait to try it next time with Herb and Garlic cream cheese and some freshly grated parmesan.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 20 mins', 'Cook Time: 6 hrs', 'Total Time: 6 hrs 20 mins', 'Servings: 6', 'Yield: 6 servings']
Ingredients: ['2 pounds boneless skinless chicken thighs', '2 large carrots, cut into 1/2-inch slices', '1 medium red bell pepper, chopped', '1 cup sliced fresh mushrooms', '4 garlic cloves, minced', '2 tablespoons Italian seasoning', 'Salt and black pepper to taste', '1 (14.5 ounce) can RED GOLD¬Æ Diced Tomatoes', '1 (28 ounce) can RED GOLD¬Æ Crushed Tomatoes', '3 cups penne pasta, cooked and drained']
Directions: ['Spray slow cooker with cooking spray. Place chicken in slow cooker and top with remaining ingredients, except pasta and garnish.', 'Cover and cook on LOW for 6 to 8 hours. Serve chicken over pasta and garnish with cheese and parsley.', 'Garnish Options: Parmesan cheese and chopped fresh Italian parsley.']
MHPR_Review: This recipe was very good and really a snap to put together. I did make a number of changes since I was scaling this down to just two servings. I used one large boneless skinless chicken breast, pounded slightly and cut in half. I used more carrot, peppers (red and yellow) and mushrooms than called for and a large clove of garlic. I used one can of diced tomatoes already flavored with oregano, garlic and basil, so I cut the Italian seasoning to 1 teaspoon. I first browned the chicken in a skillet with a little olive oil and placed it in the bottom of the slow cooker. I then deglazed the skillet with the tomatoes and their juice. I combined all the other ingredients (except the pasta) with the tomatoes and poured everything on top of the chicken in the slow cooker. My chicken was done in just four hours. The only problem was the carrots weren‚Äôt quite as tender as I‚Äôd have liked, so next time I will substitute orange bell peppers and leave the carrots out all together. I did thicken this up a bit with a corn starch/water slurry. Rather than pasta, I served this over rice. I will do this one again. Hubs will be happy, because he loved it.
Review_0: Just okay.
Review_1: simple but very flavorful. I added a spoonful of sugar and a sprinkle of crushed red pepper. came out more like a stew or soup.
Review_2: made it last night my husband loved it..he came home and made me a small plate(my choice) ate it all and guess what...even did the dishes for me..oh and bye the way I used dry red wine with my recipe! excellent!
Review_3: This is the first recipe that I‚Äôve made from AllRecipes that I sis not like! I definitely will not be making this again. So, so bland. My husband tried to dress it up to no avail, and he‚Äôs a rockstar in the kitchen. The chicken shredded and was bland as well. So not worth the money way I spent on the ingredients.
Review_4: Simple to make and my family loved it!
Review_5: Me husband and I are both military and slow cookers are life savers and this recipe was truly delicious!! Didn‚Äôt add too much Italian seasoning but still yummy!!
Review_6: Followed the recipe exactly and it came out really good.
Review_7: Made it as stated... it was ok, not bad at all.. but not great either...
Review_8: Added red pepper flakes, would add more tomato paste next time. Quite Tasty! Also I would cut up into strips.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 10 mins', 'Total Time: 20 mins', 'Servings: 8']
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons butter', '1 clove garlic, minced', '2 teaspoons all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon mustard powder', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '3 cups half-and-half', '8 ounces processed cheese (such as Velveeta)', '¬Ω cup shredded Parmesan cheese', '¬Ω cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 pound cooked elbow macaroni']
Directions: ['Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add garlic; cook and stir in hot butter until fragrant. Stir in flour, mustard powder, garlic powder, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper until well combined. Whisk in half-and-half. Simmer, stirring constantly, until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.', 'Add processed cheese, Parmesan cheese, and Cheddar cheese; stir until melted.', 'Pour cheese sauce over cooked macaroni in a large serving bowl; stir well to combine.']
MHPR_Review: This turned out perfectly. The only change I made was to exclude the Worcestershire and mustard powder (my kids can detect even small traces of these) and increase the flour to tablespoons instead of teaspoons.
Review_0: Perfection!! I just added Monterey jack cheese with the other cheeses and excluded the flour
Review_1: My family adores this recipe! Tonight I added ham.. yum!!
Review_2: Too soupy, I had to add cornstarch to thicken it up. However, I used all the ingredients it called for so the taste wasn't changed. We all really liked the taste. If your kids are not used to different flavors, they may not appreciate it.
Review_3: Way too much garlic, and I had to add more cheese to thicken it up a bit.
Review_4: I made this and it was liked by all‚Äîespecially the kids. I used Cavatappi noodles. It seems the kids always prefer the Mac and cheese with processed cheese over the fancier recipes. I used heavy whipping cream because I didn‚Äôt have half and half in the house. It was very creamy and gooey. I read some of the other reviews about it being too garlicky, but that wasn‚Äôt an issue. One clove for an entire box of pasta is not a lot. I did distinctly taste the mustard powder, though. Some may not like that distinct tang. I‚Äôll try making this again and will use only half of the mustard powder that is in this recipe. Overall, this was super easy and quick to make and all six who I made it for gave it a thumbs up.
Review_5: Amazing! My husband and Kids loved it! Couldn't stop eating it. They asked me to please make it again next week. The only thing I changed was more flour. The recipe is incorrect with TSP, it should be tablespoons of flour. And I added my own breadcrumb topping.
Review_6: Very creamy, cheesy goodness!! Love Mac and cheese this way so much better than baked and the dry mustard and garlic give it great flavor.
Review_7: WAY TOO MUCH GARLIC! The consistency was exactly what I was looking for but the garlic was overbearing and we couldn‚Äôt enjoy the cheesy part because of it.
Review_8: Delicious

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 4 hrs', 'Total Time: 4 hrs 10 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['1 (14 ounce) can chicken broth', '4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts', '1 (14 ounce) jar spaghetti sauce', '12 slices sandwich pepperoni', '6 slices jalapeno', '¬Ω (16 ounce) package cooked spaghetti', '4 slices mozzarella cheese']
Directions: ['Pour broth into the bottom of a slow cooker. Add chicken breasts. Pour spaghetti sauce over chicken. Layer pepperoni and jalapeno slices on top.', 'Cook on Low until chicken is cooked through, 4 to 5 hours.', 'Divide spaghetti among 4 serving plates. Lay mozzarella cheese slices over spaghetti. Divide chicken mixture among plates.']
MHPR_Review: I will make this again for sure! I did, and will make changes. I seasoned the chicken breasts with powdered ranch dressing mix, just because I thought there needed to be a multi-level seasoning on the chicken. It worked. 14 oz. is way too much broth, it was rather soupy. The only way I would use that much broth in the future, is to try putting dry pasta in, then to extend the slow cooker time to cook the pasta. I did as another reviewer suggested, and used pepper flakes instead of jalapenos. Over all VERY tasty.
Review_0: The chicken turned out dry, despite cooking on low in the bath of chicken broth. The broth watered down the spaghetti sauce to the point it wasn‚Äôt sauce anymore. Had very little flavor overall. Just a big disappointment on all fronts
Review_1: Delicious and amazing
Review_2: I amped up the seasoning and added a LOT of pepperoni and I enjoyed this a lot! I will make again and tweak seasoning more and maybe make my own tomato sauce. For convenience, using a store bought sauce is awesome though!
Review_3: I put it over rotini instead of spaghetti and it was delicious
Review_4: I like it as a spicy change of pace for spaghetti. Plus the house smells nice the last hour or so.
Review_5: Cut up 4 of my leftover garden tomatoes and a whole small onion and placed them on the bottom rather than the broth. Added 4 cloves of garlic and 2 teaspoons of basil and oregano and 1/2 teaspoon of cayenne rather than using jalapeno. Cut up the chicken and coated it in Italian breadcrumbs. Still topped with sauce and pepperoni. Cooking now and smells great.
Review_6: Pretty bland and soupy. I suppose I should have read the reviews and added some seasoning and used less broth.
Review_7: Delicious and easy!
Review_8: As almost all of the reviews said, I used MUCH less broth than required. I also used powder ranch on the chicken. Didn't feel like heading to the store when I had all but one ingredient, so I used pizza topping pepperoni instead of sandwich pepperoni. I'm definitely printing this one out! Parents really enjoyed it. =D

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 30 mins', 'Total Time: 35 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '1 (15 ounce) can sweet corn, drained', '1 cup mild, chunky salsa', '¬º cup sliced black olives', '3 ¬Ω cups cooked egg noodles', '1 (15.25 ounce) can kidney beans, drained and rinsed', '¬º cup taco sauce', '1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix', '¬Ω cup tomato sauce']
Directions: ['Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).', 'In a skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef until evenly brown; drain.', 'In a 9x13 inch baking dish combine the beef, corn, salsa, olives, cooked noodles, beans, taco sauce, seasoning mix and tomato sauce.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 1/2 hour, or until cooked through.']
MHPR_Review: This is good. I sauteed some onions, used black beans instead of kidney, added a 4 oz can of chopped chiles, a can of rotel tomatoes with chiles instead of the taco sauce and tomato sauce and 1 14 oz can of diced tomatoes. Also topped with some crushed tortilla chips and shredded mexican blend cheese. This will feed a bunch!
Review_0: My 15 yr old made this for dinner and we all enjoyed it. I put a dollop of sour cream on my portion and I think adding shredded cheddar before baking would be nice. He used rotini pasta instead of egg noodles.
Review_1: I used peas instead of corn and it was fantastic!!
Review_2: We loved it! We had family over for dinner and they all asked for the recipe. I'm going to put this into our meal rotation.
Review_3: This is the perfect recipe for a throw it together meal. Most of the ingredients if not all you will already have on hand. It is beginner friendly, and you can personalize it to suit your tastes. I added refried beans and rotel, along with crumbled corn chips lining the bottom of the dish, then I topped with shredded cheddar cheese and served with sour cream. I didn't understand the noodles in the recipe, but I made it with the noodles and guess what? It works, rather will. This recipe also makes plenty, would make a great pot luck dish, or great for the larger family and doesn't break the bank. I failed to mention, this recipe is not only tasty, it's filling.
Review_4: So far, I have made this twice and its been a favorite in my family both times. Before doing it the first time, I read through the reviews and saw that many people subbed the noodles for something else like rice. I did this both times that I have fixed this recipe, and its worked well. This second time, I tweaked the recipe to try something different. Instead of ground beef, I added shredded chicken. I took about 6 boneless breasts, placed them in a crock pot, cooking them on high for 3 hours to help give them a shredded consistency which worked out perfectly. Then I subbed them for the beef and followed the recipe the rest of the way, adding the rice that I cooked beforehand instead of the noodles. Both times, I added 3 cups of rice, which came out a little much. Next time, I not only will reduce it to 2 cups, but I may tweak it again and try it with carne asada or steak strips.
Review_5: I used rice not eggnoddles ,IT WAS GREAT!!! Will make again!!!!
Review_6: I tweaked it a little based on my better half not liking olives. I used Spicy Black Beans, Zest Chili Tomatoes, Taco Seasoning, fresh from the garden diced green peppers and red serranos. I made a crushed tortilla chip crust on the bottom and it was totally delicious!
Review_7: Followed the recipe exactly except for the kidney beans and noodles. (I hate them). I do not feel it messes with the overall flavor anyway. It was pretty good but it was lacking something. It needed some zing. I was surprised too since it seemed to have enough elements to add a lot of flavor. I am guessing the baking melds some of the flavors and tones it down. I would make it again but would add some more spices and heat.
Review_8: This recipe was great . I made two changes added cheese on top the last few minutes of cooking, and left out the beans because they did not sound appealing to me .My family loved it !!!!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 1 hr', 'Total Time: 1 hr 15 mins', 'Servings: 6']
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '2 jalapeno peppers', '8 slices bacon', '1 cup chopped onion', '¬Ω cup chopped jalapeno pepper', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 cup milk', '1 cup chicken broth', '6 ounces Neufchatel cheese, softened', '1 teaspoon salt, or to taste', '¬Ω teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste', '1 cup grated pepper Jack cheese, divided', '1 cup grated sharp Cheddar cheese, divided', '4 cups cooked farfalle pasta', '2 cups shredded rotisserie chicken']
Directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8x8-inch baking dish with cooking spray.', 'Slice 1 jalape√±o lengthwise into slivers; slice remaining jalape√±o into rounds. Set aside.', 'Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Crumble and set aside.', 'Heat bacon grease in the same skillet over medium-high heat. Saut√© onion and 1/2 cup chopped jalape√±o in hot grease until onion is soft and translucent, 5 to 6 minutes. Add flour and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in milk and chicken broth until well combined. Stir in Neufch√¢tel cheese until completely melted. Season with salt and pepper. Turn off heat and stir in 1/2 cup pepper Jack cheese and 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese until melted. Add cooked pasta, chicken, and 1/2 of the bacon.', 'Pour 1/2 of the pasta mixture into the prepared dish and top with jalape√±o slivers. Cover with remaining pasta mixture and top with remaining pepper Jack and Cheddar cheese. Cover the dish with aluminum foil.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Remove aluminum foil and add jalape√±o slices and remaining bacon on top. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes more.', 'You may substitute regular cream cheese for Neufch√¢tel cheese.']
Review_0: I made exact recipe except I substituted gluten free penne pasta. My new favorite pasta recipe!!
Review_1: I added garlic and a bit of fresh ground cumin. For even more heat, some Frank‚Äôs Red Hot!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 10 mins', 'Total Time: 20 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 cup sliced fresh mushrooms', '1 cup snow peas', '¬æ cup shredded carrot', '4 green onions, sliced', '1 clove garlic, minced', '¬º cup reduced-sodium soy sauce', '1 teaspoon white sugar', '¬º teaspoon cayenne pepper', '8 ounces cooked spaghetti', '1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds']
Directions: ['Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms, snow peas, carrot, and green onions. Cook, stirring, until crisp-tender, about 4 minutes. Add garlic; cook 1 minute more.', 'Stir together soy sauce, sugar, and cayenne in a small bowl; pour into skillet. Add cooked spaghetti and toss to coat. Cook until heated through, about 1 minute. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds.']
MHPR_Review: Awesomeness! Talk about a quick and healthy and delish way to satisfy that noodle-bowl craving a lot of us can get! No need to go searching for a particular noodle--spaghetti did it in a pinch just fine! The peas add delightful crunch; the garlic absorbs into all. I added some red cabbage I had in the frig and ... some rotisserie chicken! the sauce permeated every bite. OK, I did give it a wee bit of extra spice with crushed red pepper flakes and cilantro on top.
Review_0: Delicious I will add it to my recipes
Review_1: This is a great recipe to add to my quick and easy List.I use a package of ramen noodles and added broccoli and edamame.
Review_2: It was delicious. I tried it both ways and it was excellant both ways. The only thing I changed was the soya sauce. I used the unsalted soya sauce.Mary Anne
Review_3: Delicious Monday meal. I added a teaspoon of sesame oil , a teaspoon of ginger and about an 1/8 cup of brown sugar. Easy. Inexpensive. Perfect
Review_4: Loved it. Very light, not filling. I used some olive oil and sesame oil in place of the veg oil. I also added some crushed ginger to the soy sauce. Because I had so much on hand, I used 2 pkg of Ramen noodles and the powder in place of the the speg. I might even used more green onion because I love onion. It was great and next time I may add a protein.
Review_5: We loved it! I added shredded chicken and used red pepper flakes instead of cayenne. Such a clean and flavorful dish.
Review_6: This was a delicious dish...my brothers and I loved it. It was really easy to make with all the Ingredients on hand...I also added shrimp...so it was not vegetarian üòÄ
Review_7: My family enjoyed it and it will be added to our list of recipes.
Review_8: Great GF meal that my wife and I enjoyed. I doubled the recipe. Substituted Tamari ( GF version of Soy sauce) for Soy sauce. Used a 12 oz box of GF spagetti. Used the snap peas and mushrooms. Added a stir fry veggie package with carrots, cabbage etc. the doubling of the sauce mixture gave it good flavor which complimented the veggies. I would have added meat but wife is a vegetarian and I wanted to eat lighter this evening. It it the spot!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 20 mins', 'Cook Time: 15 mins', 'Total Time: 35 mins', 'Servings: 8', 'Yield: 8 servings']
Ingredients: ['2 cups all-purpose flour', '¬Ω cup cornmeal', '‚Öì cup white sugar', '1 tablespoon baking powder', '¬Ω teaspoon salt', '‚Öì cup butter, chilled', '¬æ cup craisins (sweetened, dried cranberries)', '‚Öî cup eggnog']
Directions: ['Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking sheet.', 'Stir the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a mixing bowl until blended. Cut in the butter using a pastry cutter or two knives until coarse crumbs form. Mix in the craisins. Use a fork to stir in the eggnog and make a sticky dough.', 'Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface; dip hands in flour and knead the dough about 10 times. Pat the dough out into a disk about 1/2 inch thick. Dip a 2 inch diameter biscuit cutter into some flour, and cut out 8 to 10 rounds. Place rounds about 2 inches apart on prepared baking sheet. Use up remaining dough by patting it into a smaller disk and cutting again.', 'Bake in preheated oven until risen and golden brown, about 15 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.']
MHPR_Review: Very nice. I had some eggnog that was getting over the hill and wanted to use it up. This looked like a wonderfully different and elegant recipe. I added 1/4 tsp. ground nutmeg to help bring out the eggnog flavor (and because I love nutmeg). I ended up adding more eggnog to make the dough stick together. I made an eggnog-rum glaze to drizzle on top: I combined 1 1/2 Tbsp. melted butter, 1 tsp. corn syrup, 1/2 tsp. rum flavoring, 3/4 cup confectioners' sugar and 2 Tbsp. eggnog (add more or less eggnog to get the correct drizzling consistency). I then just put the glaze in a baggie, snipped off the corner and drizzled in a zig-zag pattern, letting the glaze run over the edges of the scones. Delish! Especially served warm with a nice cup of tea.
Review_0: I made a few changes to this. The first being I used 3/4 of a cup of chopped fresh, uncooked cranberries. Comparing it to my other scone recipes, I knew right away that that wasn‚Äôt going to be enough liquid so I upped the eggnog to one cup and it was perfect. I also know that you don‚Äôt want to mess around with ‚Äúkneading‚Äú scone dough as it will make them tough. At the most, I will fold it two or three times just to make sure it‚Äôs all together. I rolled it out slightly more than 1/2 inch and then cut with my small triangle cutter. Then I put them on a parchment lined cookie sheet and stuck them in the freezer for 15 minutes. I do this for all my scones to keep them from spreading out too much. These took 22 minutes to bake and that gave them a just golden bottom with a hint of brown on the top. Based on comments that there wasn‚Äôt much of an eggnog flavor, I made a glaze with 3/4 of a cup powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons of the eggnog and then just brushed it on top of the cooled scones. All I had was a medium grind cornmeal, and I don‚Äôt like the grit that I get in the bites. Perhaps next time I‚Äôll try it with a fine ground cornmeal. It does have an interesting texture but it‚Äôs not too far off British scones. If you‚Äôre used to American scones, however, you may not like this. I call American scones cookie cakes. In the fresh chopped cranberries are a phenomenal improvement over dried cranberries. A little bit of tart in every bite offsets the sweetness perfectly.
Review_1: I added 1 tbsp of Mexican vanilla and increased cranberry amount to 1 cup. Use a good brand of eggnog. Have made this recipe 5 times and everyone loves them... they don't last long.
Review_2: Best scone ever. I had no cornmeal so I just replaced with flour. I needed more eggnog to hold the dough together.
Review_3: I use frozen butter, added a TBSP of honey and used vanilla oat milk creamer instead of eggnog. I skipped the kneading as I know from prior scone recipes this step isn't necessary. I grated frozen butter into the dry mix and then mixed the creamer and honey until everything stuck together. Then I put the dough into the fridge for 5 mins. After this I patted the dough into a ball and lightly rolled it in a flour/corn meal mixture, then patted the ball down a little (about 1.5-2" high) and cut it into serving sized scones. Put these on baking pan that was buttered and had a small amount of corn meal scattered across it. Most excellent!!
Review_4: I added a tsp of nutmeg. I left out the cornmeal. I used whole wheat flour. I increased the craisins to one cup. They were delicious!
Review_5: The scones are great! But would recommend that for smaller scones, divide the dough in half and oat into an 8‚Äù circle, cut into 8 pieces and bake per the directions. I top with turbinado sugar.
Review_6: I agree with other reviewers: the eggnog flavor was very light. I dusted a tiny bit on top before baking and next time I‚Äôll add a full teaspoon straight in to bring out the eggnog flavor. I also used a vegan eggnog I had purchased for my daughter who is DF. I used a DF ‚Äúbutter‚Äù (Earth Balance) and a GF flour blend (Bob‚Äôs in the blue bag), making these GF, DF and egg-free!
Review_7: Very nice. Melted in my mouth
Review_8: I made this recipe New Year's morning and I hope my New Year is like these scones: delicious, not complicated, and fun to make! Seriously, the eggnog makes these scones extra tasty! I looked at the photos of others and saw that they glazed them so I did too. A definite repeat recipe! Happy New Year's!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 40 mins', 'Cook Time: 1 hr', 'Total Time: 1 hr 40 mins', 'Servings: 24', 'Yield: 3 loaves']
Ingredients: ['¬æ cup butter, room temperature', '3 cups white sugar', '3 eggs, room temperature', '3 tablespoons orange zest', '6 cups all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon salt', '4 ¬Ω teaspoons baking powder', '1 ¬Ω teaspoons baking soda', '2 ¬º cups orange juice', '3 cups whole cranberries', '1 ¬Ω cups chopped walnuts']
Directions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease three 8x4-inch loaf pans. Line bottoms with parchment paper, if desired.', 'Beat the butter and sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Add the room-temperature eggs one at a time, allowing each egg to blend into the butter mixture before adding the next. Stir in the orange zest.', 'Sift together the flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda. Add to the egg mixture, alternating with orange juice.', 'Coarsely chop the cranberries.', 'Pour the flour mixture into the mixing bowl alternately with the orange juice, mixing until just incorporated. Fold in the chopped cranberries and walnuts, mixing just enough to evenly combine. Divide the batter evenly among prepared pans.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Check for browning: cover the tops with aluminum foil to prevent them from becoming too dark. Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of the loaves comes out clean, about 30 minutes more. Cool on wire racks.']
MHPR_Review: This was a great recipe! I love cranberry-nut bread and have tried several versions over the years, but this is hands down the best. I have to comment on the cooking time however...I was skeptical when I saw the 30 to 35 minutes since I've never cooked a quick bread for that short a time before. I left it in for an extra 10 minutes, and the middle was still very gooey. Possibly a typo? I made a "note to self" to increase it to 50 to 55 the next time I make it, which I definitely will. My husband loved it as well.
Review_0: First time I made it. Gave them away for Christmas gifts. So many people lived it. Will make again & again!
Review_1: This is a great recipe. All family loved it. The directions say to bake for 30 minutes, check the browning and then bake for an additional 30 minutes.
Review_2: It made 3 loaves, and my family really liked it.
Review_3: I halved the recipe because I didn't need three loaves and it made one short loaf and 36 mini-muffins--all delicious! The loaf baked for about 40 minutes, the mini-muffins for 15. It was very flavorful and I'd likely make this recipe again!
Review_4: For those thinking the recipe only calls for 30 minutes cooking time. Please read the last paragraph again and it tells you to cook it an additional 30 minutes and that you may need to cover the pans to keep the bread from getting too dark/overdone on top. My Bread,( I am a Diabetic). So, I used Erythritol granulated sweetener in place of the sugar, cup for cup and it turned out GREAT. This was the only change I made. Thank you so much for sharing this great recipe with us ????
Review_5: This recipe is wonderful! I used it to make 2 loaves and a tin of muffins. I did have to adjust the cooking time a bit, longer for loaves and shorter for the muffins. I used fresh squeezed orange juice and the flavor was outstanding!
Review_6: This bread was great. I followed the recipe exactly and I had nice moist bread. I saw a lot of reviews that 30 minutes was not enough cook time. The recipe says cook for 30 minutes and then cover and cook for about 30 minutes more. This kept the bread from drying out. It was great and all of my coworkers were very happy it made 3 loaves!
Review_7: This is a very tasty recipe. It combines the tangy and the sweet and was great just as soon as it cooled. I got 3 loaves and a few muffins from this recipe.
Review_8: Very good. Followed the recipe to a "T" . Made it for a New Years Day breakfast. Everyone loved it. Warm or cold. It's not too sweet and the cranberries give it a good tartness.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 20 mins', 'Cook Time: 1 hr', 'Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins', 'Servings: 12', 'Yield: 1 9x5-inch loaf']
Ingredients: ['1 ¬Ω cups all-purpose flour', '1 ¬º teaspoons baking soda', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¬Ω teaspoon ground nutmeg', '1 tablespoon butter, softened', '1 cup packed brown sugar', '1 cup solid pack pumpkin puree', '¬Ω cup whole cranberry sauce', '1 egg', '1 banana, mashed']
Directions: ['Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sift flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg into a large bowl.', 'Beat the butter, brown sugar, pumpkin, cranberry sauce, egg, and banana with an electric mixer in a bowl until smooth. Gradually stir in the flour mixture, mixing until just combined. Pour batter into a 9x5-inch loaf pan.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack.']
MHPR_Review: This is a very easy recipe and a great way to use up 1/2 cans of pumpkin and cranberry sauce. Very low fat compared to other quick bread recipes. Great for the holidays.
Review_0: the flavors do not work well together and while the bread is moist overall it was horrible
Review_1: You definitely need to make some changes. It has potential, but it's really just meh as is.
Review_2: The only thing that I did different was sprinkled raw oat meal on top before baking. Adds a wonderful contrast My family really likes this bread. I make small loaves, eat one while warm, freeze the others.
Review_3: Easy to make. Moist. Not too sweet. I thought they were bland and uninteresting but if you have someone who likes something that is lightly sweet this may be a great option. I doubled the batch and made muffins (I didn't have a loaf pan). A double batch yielded 41 muffins. I baked them at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes. Use liners if you have them - I ran out and the ones without liners are burnt on the outside but just cooked on the inside. Good way to get rid of extra pumpkin and cranberry but I won't be jumping to make these again.
Review_4: This recipe is lovely. I tripled the recipe and added some ground ginger and toasted pecans. The gang loved it! It's a keeper.
Review_5: Beautifully dense and moist. Love that it had no oil. I had no cranberry sauce so I used "pear sauce" (mashed overripe pears, but will use applesauce next time) and dried cranberries, about a cup. I also added ginger and cloves, based on another reviewer. This one's a keeper-thank you so much. p.s. I used Splenda brown sugar and egg substitute, still great, less guilt.
Review_6: amazing recipe loved it
Review_7: I took some suggestions and added a little more spices, cloves, pumpkin pie spice and a teaspoon vanilla flavoring. Also, added walnuts and cranraisins. Made the recipe into mini muffins for a church bake sale. Tasted delicious. A keeper.
Review_8: This recipe may sound a bit different, but it is wonderful, full of flavor and moist. It is a must try!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 45 mins', 'Additional Time: 1 hr', 'Total Time: 2 hrs', 'Servings: 10', 'Yield: 1 loaf']
Ingredients: ['1 ¬º cups all-purpose flour', '1 cup quick cooking oats', '1 tablespoon baking powder', '¬Ω teaspoon salt', '2 large eggs', '1 ¬º cups mashed ripe bananas', '2 tablespoons sour cream', '‚Öì cup melted butter', '¬Ω cup white sugar', '¬æ cup dried cranberries', '¬Ω teaspoon lemon juice']
Directions: ['Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 2 1/2 x 8 1/2-inch loaf pan with butter. Whisk the flour, oats, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl; set aside.', 'Whisk the eggs in a mixing bowl until smooth. Beat in the bananas, sour cream, and melted butter. Add the sugar, cranberries, and lemon juice; beat until evenly blended. Fold into the oat mixture until no dry lumps remain. Pour into the prepared loaf pan.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 45 to 50 minutes. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack.']
MHPR_Review: i used whole wheat white flour, added just a touch of vanilla extract and used almost all organic ingredients. I took a previous reviewers advice and added in about a half cup (maybe more) of chopped pecans. I thought this was perfect. All the ingredient measurements were spot on, which I really appreciate. I actually made muffins out of this recipe (we're more of a muffin family than a loaf family) and I got twelve muffins that were a little on the bigger side. Right before baking, I pushed in a couple extra cranberries into the top of each muffin and sprinkled just a little extra chopped pecans on top. These baked up wonderfully and both kids and husband really enjoyed these.
Review_0: I agree with other reviewers who say it's a bit bland. It's also heavy. I added vanilla, as well as pecans, but it needs a little more something. Using brown sugar would make it a bit better, I think.
Review_1: I wanted a banana walnut cranberry bread. I followed the directions pretty much. But I didn't have sour cream nor yogurt nor apple sauce. So I added Fruit cocktail. And I used frozen/thawed whole cranberries.That was the only change. With my stove I had to increase cook time by 10 minutes. Just kind of watched it. It was really good. Thank you for this recipe! I will save it to my favorites and use again! TerriB
Review_2: This was an easy recipe to put together. I did add about 1/4 cup of brown sugar due to some reviews stating it was not quite sweet enough. I added golden raisins because I was out of cranberries. The taste of the bread is really nice. Next time I am going to be sure to have cranberries on hand! Thanks for sharing this recipe
Review_3: Worked out pretty well. I ended up using sour cream instead of the yogurt and added a cup of cranberries and raisins mixed together.
Review_4: I found this recipe years ago and still use it, it is great every time! I now make the batter and make muffins out of them. It makes more than a dozen, around 15. Check them after 20 min and then a few minutes after if it needs more time. Thanks for this!
Review_5: To die for. I put extra bananas , a bit more anyway. It‚Äôs really good.
Review_6: This has become our family's go-to banana bread recipe. The dried cranberries really do pair well with the sweetness of the bananas. I've experimented with the recipe over time, and the only changes I consistently make are to substitute whole wheat for all-purpose flour and coconut oil for butter. Enjoy!
Review_7: The only change I made was to add walnuts, otherwise, the recipe was perfect.
Review_8: This is a tasty breakfast bread. I was skeptical of the large amount of baking powder, but it worked. Followed the instructions pretty closely, only switched lemon juice for grated orange peel. The oats make it more substantial, than regular flour. I would make it again.

Recipe_Name: Thanksgiving Leftover Wontons with Cranberry Salsa
Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 30 mins', 'Cook Time: 15 mins', 'Additional Time: 5 mins', 'Total Time: 50 mins', 'Servings: 10', 'Yield: 40 wontons']
Ingredients: ['¬æ cup lemon juice', '1 cup dried cranberries', '1 ¬Ω cups shredded cooked turkey', '1 cup prepared stuffing', '4 ounces cream cheese, softened', '¬º cup thick turkey gravy', '1 (14 ounce) package wonton wrappers', 'salt to taste', '3 cups canola oil for frying', '2 tablespoons minced onion', '1 tablespoon lime juice', '1 teaspoon seeded and minced jalapeno pepper - or to taste', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '1 teaspoon water']
Directions: ['Pour the lemon juice over the dried cranberries in a bowl; set aside. Mix the turkey, stuffing, cream cheese, and turkey gravy in a separate bowl until thoroughly combined.', 'Place a wonton wrapper on a work surface; spoon about 1 tablespoon of the filling in the center of the wrapper. Moisten two opposite edges of the wrapper with a finger dipped in water, fold the wrapper in half the long way, and press the edges together with a fork. Sprinkle the wrapper with salt. Repeat with remaining filling and wrappers.', 'Heat the canola oil in a large, deep skillet over medium heat; pan-fry the filled wontons in batches until crisp and golden brown, about 2 minutes per side. Drain the fried wontons on paper towels; allow to cool for about 5 minutes to set the filling.', 'Drain the lemon juice from the dried cranberries. Place cranberries into a food processor; pulse several times until the cranberries are finely chopped. Transfer to a bowl and mix in the onion, lime juice, jalapeno pepper, garlic, and water. Serve with the hot fried wontons.', 'We have determined the nutritional value of oil for frying based on a retention value of 10% after cooking. The exact amount will vary depending on cooking time and temperature, ingredient density, and the specific type of oil used.']
MHPR_Review: to the previous reviewer, the 2 recipes are the same in that they are both "thanksgiving leftover" recipes that both use thanksgiving leftovers lol. did you even make the recipe before you reviewed it??? not good for the community! i made this and it was amazing. can't wait to make them again next year, or maybe after christmas if we have the leftover ingredients!
Review_0: Yesterday was the last day that my sister and good-for-nothing brother-in-law, James, were in town for the holiday. Since we had SOMEHOW still not managed to finish the leftovers from Thursday, James ‚Äúsuggested‚Äù that we do something ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù with the remaining turkey, stuffing, and potatoes. As if he hadn‚Äôt imposed enough this weekend...I‚Äôm sure some people can relate! Thankfully we found this recipe thanksgiving leftover solution. It was fun exploring cooking with a foreign vessel while staying comfortable with traditional thanksgiving ingredients for the innards. They tasted good enough to keep James from providing any snide commentary for the remainder of the night. For that, I‚Äôm truly thankful!
Review_1: I made these the day after Thanksgiving and my kids loved them. they are easy to make. instead of the cranberry salsa, I used the cranberry sauce I made for Thanksgiving and it worked perfectly.
Review_2: This was great. Wish there was 6 stars.
Review_3: Big hit! I couldn't find won ton rappers, so I used philo dough (which worked!) I omitted the jalapenos & it was still really delicious.
Review_4: We made this last Thanksgiving as a way to not waste our leftovers... IT WAS AWESOME ... we also made ham and dressing eggrolls and loved it just as much... thanks for the recipe!
Review_5: Delicious! Made exactly as written. I did do a few in my actifryer and those were delicious also. They are the ones in my picture that don't have the same golden brown. The salsa makes them extra special !!
Review_6: This recipe was quite good, I will definitely make them again. A couple tips though, chop up all your ingredients to small pieces so the flavors all blend nicely in each wonton. The same goes for chopping up the dried cranberries in the salsa. Also, if you have the forethought, let the salsa sit for a day, and it will really blend the flavors together.
Review_7: This was a fantastic and different idea for my leftover turkey! Served up to rave reviews.
Review_8: Not bad. Different. But I don't think I'd do again.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 20 mins', 'Cook Time: 45 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr 5 mins', 'Servings: 12', 'Yield: 4 mini loaves']
Ingredients: ['1 cup cranberry sauce, or more to taste', '1 cup cooked and mashed sweet potatoes', '3 eggs', '¬æ cup white sugar', '¬Ω cup vegetable oil', '¬Ω cup brown sugar', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '3 cups all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon ground nutmeg', '1 teaspoon ground allspice', '1 teaspoon baking soda', '¬Ω teaspoon baking powder', '1 cup raisins, or more to taste']
Directions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 4 mini loaf pans.', 'Combine cranberry sauce, sweet potatoes, eggs, white sugar, oil, brown sugar, and vanilla extract in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Add flour, nutmeg, allspice, baking soda, and baking powder; mix well. Fold raisins into the batter.', 'Divide batter evenly among the loaf pans.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Place loaf pans on a wire rack to cool completely.', 'You can also add nuts or cranberries if desired and use more mashed sweet potatoes (up to 2 cups), depending how much you have left over. Substitute leftover sweet potato casserole for the mashed potatoes if desired.', 'Baking time is longer for a large loaf pan and shorter for muffin pans. Just check with a toothpick to make sure it is done.']
MHPR_Review: I had a little more than a cup of cranberry sauce so i matched that in sweet potatoes. I also used flax eggs instead of eggs. Mixed those first 3 together and let sit for 5 minutes. I used coconut oil instead of vegetable oil. I also cut back on the sugars and added the flour by 1/2c. increments. I think i used about 2 1/2c. of flour, which was whole wheat. I made this recipes as muffins. I filled my muffin pan and almost forgot the raisins so i added them on top and pushed them in lol! Baked at 375 for 24 minutes, they were fantastic!!
Review_0: I had left over sweet potatoes and cranberry sauce and am so glad I stumbled across this recipe. The white and brown sugars help to offset the tartness of the cranberries and result in a beautiful mellowed flavor. But, I learned the hard way, NOT TO MAKE THIS IN A SINGLE LOAF PAN. I don't own small loaf pans so I tried to make one large oaf. The toothpick came out clean after 75 mintues but when I flipped it out of the pan the center caved in (it was not fully cooked). I tried to continue to bake and ended up over baking the ends and the middle still somewhat under backed but still edible. I may try with muffins next time, since I don't want to invest in new pans and this is a delicious way to use up those holiday leftovers.
Review_1: I followed the recipe verbatim and used a single regular size loaf pan, thinking that qualified as "large" as opposed to mini loaf pans. I gave it 60 minutes and a toothpick was still coming up with fragments, then re-tried again after 70 and 75 minutes total. It was still fragmenty, and it had leavened a HECK of a lot, so at that point I just took it out.I wasn't using convection baking, so maybe that plays a factor, but it had very little structural integrity towards the top-middle part. It was super moist and fluffy but couldn't hold up like a denser bread or pound cake. Next time I'll probably divide it into two regular size pans - that would at least ensure it doesn't get as tall as it did.The finished product was very tasty! It wasn't super duper sweet, but it has a very nice moderate sweetness. The cranberry sauce didn't quite register as tart as it was when it was standing alone, so maybe if you're using a homemade or whole-berry sauce, err towards 1.5 cups or more.It toasts up wonderfully for breakfast with a sweet spread and it makes AMAZING croutons if you cut it up and crumb it. Heck, I bet it'd make amazing stuffing if you want to have a recursive Thanksgiving leftover experience.
Review_2: I had a little more than a cup of cranberry sauce so i matched that in sweet potatoes. I also used flax eggs instead of eggs. Mixed those first 3 together and let sit for 5 minutes. I used coconut oil instead of vegetable oil. I also cut back on the sugars and added the flour by 1/2c. increments. I think i used about 2 1/2c. of flour, which was whole wheat. I made this recipes as muffins. I filled my muffin pan and almost forgot the raisins so i added them on top and pushed them in lol! Baked at 375 for 24 minutes, they were fantastic!!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 30 mins', 'Cook Time: 35 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr 5 mins', 'Servings: 12', 'Yield: 1 9x5-inch loaf']
Ingredients: ['2 cups peeled, cored and chopped apple', '¬æ cup white sugar', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 egg', '1 ¬Ω cups all-purpose flour', '1 ¬Ω teaspoons baking powder', '¬Ω teaspoon baking soda', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 cup fresh or frozen cranberries', '¬Ω cup chopped walnuts']
Directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan.', 'Stir together apples, sugar, and oil in a large bowl. Add egg; mix well. Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and cinnamon in a separate bowl. Stir flour mixture into wet ingredients until dry ingredients are moist. Stir in cranberries and walnuts. Spread batter into the prepared pan.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of loaf comes out clean, 35 to 45 minutes.']
MHPR_Review: I had an overabundance of apples and was also so pleased to see that there were cranberries in this, as I also had a package of cranberries in the crisper from thanksgiving that needed to be used. I made both bread and muffins(doubled the recipe) and they were sooo moist!!! After reading other reviews, I read the proportions of ingredients and was quite perplexed as to how this was going to turn out. There did seem to be a bigger proportion of dry ingredients to the liquid. The adjustments I made were: I added the sugar and salt to the apples first to leech out the juice. I also added just a splash of orange juice (maybe two tbsp) and grated some orange rind. I immediately wrapped the bread when it cooled and put in fridge and put the muffins in a plastic container with lid. I couldn't resist the muffins so tried them about an hour later; the bread in the fridge until the next day. Both were so moist and there was no crumbling at all. I think alot depends on the type of apple. When I started slicing into what I had(red delicious) they were quite juicy so I am sure that helped. I also added a bit more cinnamon and a half tsp of nutmeg to the DOUBLE batch I made; would use a quarter tsp. to the single recipe. I also added a tsp of vanilla. I have this bookmarked as I will be using this one again. Presentation is also beautiful with the whole cranberries and chunks of apple.
Review_0: The batter was incredibly scarce and dry- but I trusted the process and baked it. It came out pretty good. However next time I will let the apples sit in the sugar and I will chop the cranberries as well and add to sugar too so they can add moisture more evenly
Review_1: Mine was super dry didn‚Äôt look like batter so I added another egg and water. It turned out good. I also cooked mine about 50 minutes instead. The top wasn‚Äôt very brown at 40 minutes
Review_2: It was so delicious !!I added extra cinnamon and added applesauce and my family really loved it. I doubled the recipe, one loaf isn't enough.Thanks again for this recipe!
Review_3: Notice the batter is thick spread it into pan flatten top with slightly wet fingers also chop apples üçè put the cinnamon sugar on them and let them sit till time to mix of these factors add extra wetness to help mix the better once my batter was crumbly and I did add a teaspoon of water once it was really really wet but every time the bread rose and tasted fantastic the other thing that I had to do was bake it for one hour and a 4 x 8 Bread, pan and I always use glass to cook my bread and a slightly reduced temperature . I‚Äôve cooked this more than 15 times. Every time it is come out perfectly. Just sometimes it can look dry as long as all powders are wet always backed just perfectly!
Review_4: I've made this recipe at least 8 times now, and it is THE BEST!!! Thank you for such great instruction!
Review_5: This bread came out so good! I made a few adjustments: I didn't measure out the apples, just used 2 McIntosh and didn't peel them first. I added an extra 1/2 tsp of cinnamon and 2 splashes of vanilla extract. I rough chopped about half of the cranberries before mixing them in as well as putting a handful of them on top of the bread. And I put half the mixture in, sprinkled brown sugar on top, then repeated.
Review_6: I can't recommend this recipe as the end result was nothing like I had imagined it would be. It had a funny after-taste.
Review_7: Let the chopped apples sit in the sugar for a couple hours to generate more liquid, otherwise add apple juice or it will be too dry. My second round I added a little lemon juice which was good. Overall great flavor but a bit crumbly, next time I might make it into muffins for easier eating.
Review_8: This is a great base recipe for a delicious quick bread! I had fresh cranberries and a giant apple to use up. I was concerned about all the reviews saying it was dry, so I substituted 1/4 cup applesauce for the 2 Tb oil, and I weighed my flour (120 g = 1 cup). It actually ended up a little bit too moist! I also added a dash of vanilla and zest from one orange to punch up the holiday flavor. Excellent!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 1 hr 10 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr 25 mins', 'Servings: 10', 'Yield: 1 - loaf']
Ingredients: ['2 cups all-purpose flour', '1 cup white sugar', '1 ¬Ω teaspoons baking powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '¬Ω teaspoon baking soda', '¬º cup butter', '1 egg', '¬æ cup orange juice', '1 tablespoon grated orange zest', '1 ¬Ω cups fresh or frozen cranberries', '¬Ω cup chopped walnuts']
Directions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8x4 inch loaf pan.', 'In a medium bowl, mix together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and baking soda. MHPR_Review: Excellent. I doubled the recipe and it turned out great. When doubling, I used the entire bag of fresh cranberries (12 oz.) This is the recipe that comes off of the the Ocean Spray bag. Great bread for the holidays. TIP - Be sure to cover the bread tightly with foil once it comes out of the oven for about 10-15 min. It will steam and keep the bread super moist - a trick for all loaf quick breads.

Review_1: Yummy

Review_3: The bread came out moist and very tasty! It had just enough cranberries and walnuts. I baked a regular loaf and 3 mini-loaves for about 35 minutes. I'll definitely make this again!

Review_5: perfect
