The actual amount consumed will vary.']
MHPR_Review: I've never had chicken shawarma, so I really don't have anything to compare this to, but we liked it! You definitely need some kind of sauce to serve this with though, or it will be quite dry. I made a quick sauce with plain yogurt, tahini, garlic, a bit of lemon juice and some chopped herbs, salt & pepper. We served this, sandwich style, with pita bread, sliced cucumber, tomato, red onion and the sauce. Really similar to a gyros, but with chicken. Thanks for sharing the recipe.
Review_0: Yer missing the PICKLES! Authentic Lebanese/MiddleEastern/Arab shawarma ...almost all of them have some kind of very tangy pickle in the pita, with the chicken and yoghurt sauce, if you make a sandwich of this... and I live in the town in our USA that has *more* middleeastern people (and restaurants) than anywhere else *in the world* (excepting the Middle East itself.)
Review_1: Yuuuuummmmmy!
Review_2: I followed the recipe as is and liked it. Normally I read the reviews and make the adjustment recommend, but this time I did not. I marinated the chicken over night and found that it was full of flavor and very juicy and tender. I did take the marinated and simmered it hoping that it would thicken up, but it just separated from the oil. I used it in my rice which made it tangy. over all I will cook this again.
Review_3: This was an easy recipe to make and tasted delicious. I would make again.
Review_4: Nice recipe
Review_5: Really good
Review_6: Served with homemade pita bread, tzatziki, and Greek tomatoes.
Review_7: Delicious!
Review_8: Mine turned out wonderful!!

Basic_Info: ['Servings: 2', 'Yield: 2 servings']
Ingredients: ['2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - pounded thin', '¬º cup all-purpose flour', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 teaspoons butter', '2 teaspoons vegetable oil', '1 (4.5 ounce) can mushrooms, drained', '1 cup water', '1 packet chicken bouillon granules', '1 teaspoon cornstarch', '¬Ω teaspoon dried parsley', '¬º teaspoon garlic powder', 'ground black pepper to taste']
Directions: ['Season flour with salt and pepper. Dredge chicken in seasoned flour onto a sheet of wax paper. In a nonstick skillet, combine the vegetable oil and butter or margarine and heat over medium high heat until bubbly and hot. Add chicken and cook until lightly browned on both sides and cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove chicken and set aside.', 'To the same skillet, add the mushrooms and saute for about 5 minutes. Combine the water, broth mix, cornstarch, parsley, garlic powder, salt and pepper and add to the skillet. Cook, stirring frequently, until liquid is thickened, 1 to 2 minutes.', 'Return chicken to the skillet and cook until chicken is heated through, 1 to 2 minutes. Serve.']
MHPR_Review: This is a regular in our house! I use cream of mushroom soup and chicken broth to give the sauce some oomph and to make extra. You can also add green or white sauteed onions if you desire. Adding some dry italian salad dressing mix to your flour will really help kick the flavor up a notch. Don't forget to add cold water to your cornstarch! The perfect partner for this is egg noodles. A great recipe for weeknight or for company. Always a winner.
Review_0: This was so amazingly good and easy and it's a great base recipe so I did make a couple of changes. I used skinless and boneless thighs and I added salt, pepper and garlic powder to the flour as well as to the sauce. I used Better than Bullion Chicken broth. While sauteing the mushrooms I added some red pepper flakes and a Tuscan spice blend for a bit of a kick. Used fresh mushrooms and fresh parsley because I had them and a spritz of fresh lemon juice at the end. This had so much flavor and definitely making this again.
Review_1: I pounded the chicken to an inch and it still came out pink. I cooked them more than the 4 minutes, and, again, it was pink. Cooking time needs adjustments!
Review_2: Absolutely delicious.
Review_3: This was amazing! I used fresh sliced mushrooms and added 1/3 c sour cream to the sauce just before I put the chicken back in. Even the hubby was reaching about his good it was!
Review_4: Turned out so much better than I expected. My family raved about it.
Review_5: This was delicious. I‚Äôm incapable of making a recipe as stated, so I did make a few tweaks. Used homemade chicken broth mixed with cornstarch, saut√©ed onions and garlic with fresh portabella mushrooms, added dried Italian herbs to the flour. Finished the dish with a splash of good white wine after the chicken was removed, scraping up the browned bits. Served with mushroom ravioli and broccoli. My husband and I both loved it.
Review_6: This was a great recipe. It was quick and easy. My family really enjoyed it. I will make it again.
Review_7: It came out perfectly delicious !
Review_8: I made this but made a bit healthier and more fresh. No vegetable oil, sub avocado oil, used fresh mushrooms not canned (GROSS!), fresh garlic not powdered and added onion powder to the flour dredge. Turned out great!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 25 mins', 'Total Time: 40 mins', 'Servings: 4']
Ingredients: ['¬Ω cup butter, melted', '‚Öî cup crushed saltine crackers', '¬º cup grated Parmesan cheese', '¬Ω teaspoon dried basil', '¬Ω teaspoon dried oregano', '¬Ω teaspoon salt', '¬º teaspoon garlic powder', '1 pound yellow perch fillets']

MHPR_Review: We aim for low carb meals with a diabetic in the family so I used 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese and didn't use any cracker crumbs. It came out great. Obviously the recipe is changed quite a lot without adding the cracker crumbs...but the seasonings, the butter, the tenderness of the filets after about 25 minutes...these make this recipe a 5 star recipe!
Review_0: It was so easy, and so-o-o good! Baking the perch fillets swaddled in cracker crumbs and parmesan flakes with a touch of basil, oregano, and a hint of garlic powder was so easy‚Äîand inspired. The only adjustment I made was trading water crackers for saltines. The half teaspoon of salt was sufficient.
Review_1: Loved it!
Review_2: Add üçã garlic salt. üëçGood
Review_3: I did not have crackers so just baked this with the butter and seasoning and it was delicious. I could have just eliminated the salt entirely.
Review_4: Followed the directions with no substitutions. DELICIOUS, FLAVORFUL. I will be making it again.
Review_5: I would give this more stars if I could!! It was simple, easy to follow, quick and ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! I did substitute the saltine crackers for my favorite Club crackers. The buttery cracker def compliment this recipe. I did add a lemon wedge which added more sparks to the deliciousness! It‚Äôs a def keeper!!
Review_6: It turned out delicious.. for my taste next time I will decrease the Parmesan and see about substituting something for the melted butter. But definitely will be making it again and again .
Review_7: Family loved it! Easy and so good I had seconds!! I used whole wheat Panko bread crumps instead of the saltine crackers. Parmesan cheese made a nice crispy texture to the butter and garlic...it‚Äôs a keeper. This was the first time that I cooked perch, so I needed a little help. Not disappointed at all.
Review_8: This was quick and easy. Loved it as it was.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 1 hr 20 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr 30 mins', 'Servings: 4']
Ingredients: ['1 pound smoked pork butt', 'water to cover', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 pounds red potatoes, peeled', '1 head cabbage, cored and quartered']
Directions: ['Place smoked pork butt in a 6-quart pot with enough water to cover; season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 1 hour.', 'Stir in potatoes and cabbage. Simmer until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.', 'Remove pork from soup and cut into quarters; return pork to pot until ready to serve. Season with more salt and pepper, if needed.']
MHPR_Review: This is a good basic recipe and was a favorite of mine as a child. Over the years, I've experimented with and now I add two quartered onions and use chicken broth instead of water....Incredible!
Review_0: Solid recipe. Tasty. Red potatoes a must and quality chicken broth. Did not have a smoked butt, so I used ham bone. Added cubed ham and cannelli beans. A little garlic herb seasoning with salt and pepper. Great winter recipe with a nice French, crusty baguette
Review_1: I used a bone-in ham, simmered for an hour in about 2" of water. I removed it from the pot, added the cored and quartered cabbage, the potatoes, a bit of black pepper, and simmered that until the cabbage was soft and had released it's natural liquid. Then I replaced the ham which I had cut into large chunks, heated everything up again and served with crusty rye bread. Wonderful, hearty meal at any time of year. It's even better the next day! (Save the bone for your next batch of ham and bean soup!)
Review_2: This probably is a good basic recipe. I used some of the comments in other reviews. I cooked the butt in 32 oz of low sodium chicken broth and at least another 32oz of ‚Äú low sodium better than bouillon‚Äù chicken base dissolved in boiling water. I added two quartered onions, fresh string beans and fresh carrots. The flavor of the chicken broth was good for everything except the cabbage... I wasn‚Äôt fond of that flavor. Of course my husband was fine with it?? Also, my smoked butt was very salty so I am glad I only used the pepper that was recommended in the recipe. My husband loves ham and cabbage and he loved this recipe. Honestly, I am not fond of ham and cabbage so it was just ok for me (not anything to do with the recipe!!) thanks for the recipe! It made my husband happy and he doesn‚Äôt mind eating it a second time tomorrow. I may try frying the ham and cabbage for a change, as mentioned in one of the reviews!
Review_3: Being of Irish heritage I‚Äôve always had a ton of cabbage soup... typically beef or kielbasa ... I really like this with the smoked pork gave it a nice Smokey twist
Review_4: I always use smoked butt on St. Patrick's Day too. The only change I made was I used vegetable broth instead of the water and I threw in some carrots.
Review_5: I put mine in the Crock Pot with some bacon grease and 2 chicken bouillon cubes. It's awesome! I'll definitely make it again! :)
Review_6: As others suggested, I used chicken broth (& about a cup or so of beef broth, for flavor). I also added carrots, half an onion, & celery. Cooked these vegetables in butter, salt (~tbsp), & pepper (at LEAST a tbsp) for maybe 5 min then added chicken broth & ~1c beef broth. I covered for at least 20 minutes to have them soft, but not mushy, stirring & adding chicken broth as necessary. In a separate pot, simultaneously: I heated my ham in chicken broth and water (~10 min), then pulled it out to cut it up. I then cooked the potatoes in the same water (~15 min). I then scooped out the potatoes and cooked the cabbage in the same water (~15/20 min). I put it all together for the final product. AMAZING.
Review_7: Simple and delicious. I use two pork butts or one big one. I boil them for about a half hour and then toss the water out and add fresh, bringing it to a new boil for awhile before adding the potatoes and cabbage. You get rid of a lot of the pork fat that way.
Review_8: Loved this soup. Whole family did, grandkids too! I replaced pork butt with ham bone from Christmas. Also added 32 oz chicken broth, Then chopped leftover ham & added it. Mmmm sooo good. Thank you for this simple recipe.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 25 mins', 'Cook Time: 55 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins', 'Servings: 4']
Ingredients: ['‚Öì cup olive oil', '4 carrots, sliced', '1 onion, thinly sliced', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon salt', '¬Ω teaspoon ground black pepper', '¬Ω teaspoon ground ginger', '1 small head cabbage, sliced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '4 small yellow potatoes, cut into bite-sized cubes', '¬º cup water']
Directions: ['Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add carrots and saut√© until slightly softened, about 5 minutes. Add onion; saut√© until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add turmeric, cumin, salt, pepper, and ginger; let seasonings toast until fragrant, about 1 minute.', 'Stir cabbage and garlic into the pot; cook, stirring occasionally, until cabbage wilts, about 10 minutes. Stir in potatoes and water; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring every 10 minutes, until potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes.', 'You can reduce the final 30-minute cook time if you cut the potatoes smaller.']
MHPR_Review: I love this recipe and have made it quite a few times now. A few tips... 1. The amount of water sounds small, but it's genuinely all you need for this stew-y dish; if you like a more soupy texture I recommend waiting until the end of cooking since the cabbage will sneakily release a lot of liquid. 2. It seems a little under spiced to me as written so I tend to add a bit extra of everything. 3. The recipe can easily handle less oil--it worked great recently with just a tbsp (it's not QUITE as deliciously rich that way, but it does work). 4. It tastes better the longer the leftovers mingle in the fridge, so I always make a big batch!
Review_0: Wanted to be sure that the carrots were cooked, so I did saute a couple minutes longer right at the beginning. I had a box of vegetable stock in the fridge, so I used that instead of water. Keep your eye on it at the end when simmering, because I found it was starting to dry out and stick a little, so I added more veg stock. I also covered the pot while simmering which I think helped in cooking the potatoes faster. The combo of spices is what makes this a unique side dish. Haven‚Äôt ever had anything that tastes like this, but we really enjoyed it, and it‚Äôll be made again. Takes a while to make, so maybe not a good choice for a weeknight dinner, but this is worth your effort. Served with air fried fish, marinated asparagus, and baked tomato slices.
Review_1: I have made this several times, typically when I am doing the Daniel Fast. It is delicious! I do use vegetable broth in place of the water, but other than that, I followed the recipe.
Review_2: Very bland and needed a lot more liquid to fully cook the potatoes. To avoid over-saturating, I just kept an eye on it and added a couple of tablespoons whenever it got too dry.
Review_3: Delicious! Added more spice and chicken broth instead of water. Turned out great
Review_4: Not a huge fan. It was mostly just meh.
Review_5: This is delicious. Served as a side to Doro Wat. So yummy
Review_6: I think it would be a 5 star recipe if the seasoning wasn't so bland. Perhaps my spices are old, but I had to add more to punch up the flavor. The combination of spices is tasty and it's a very healthy dish that doesn't TASTE healthy. I will definitely add this to the recipe book with some changes. Great way to get those veggies in and change things up.
Review_7: Loved this recipe. It took longer than indicated and I didn't have all the ingredients. Instead of carrots I used beet root. I used fresh baby ginger and garlic, both cut into small pieces. I used 2 russet potatoes and a purple yam. The amount of water indicated worked great but I kept a lid on the pot.
Review_8: Amazing recipe! But I didn't cut the potatoes small enough. Make sure to cut them into small dices. I give this a 5!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 25 mins', 'Cook Time: 1 hr 25 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr 50 mins', 'Servings: 10', 'Yield: 1 (9x13-inch) casserole']
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '8 potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced', '¬Ω cup butter', '1 onion, finely chopped', '¬Ω cup all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons Dijon mustard', '1 teaspoon salt', '¬º teaspoon ground black pepper', '3 cups milk', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese', '3 cups diced ham']
Directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.', 'Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add potatoes and cook until almost tender, 5 to 10 minutes. Transfer to a colander and rinse with cold water until cool enough to handle. Drain well and set aside.', 'Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in flour, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper; cook for 1 minute. Gradually pour in milk, stirring constantly until sauce is thickened, about 5 minutes. Stir in Cheddar cheese until melted.', 'Layer ¬Ω of the potatoes in the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Top with 1 ¬Ω cups diced ham and ¬Ω of the Cheddar cheese sauce. Repeat another layer with remaining potatoes, ham, and sauce.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until the top is lightly browned, about 1 hour.']
MHPR_Review: 1.8.17 I should have followed my gut on this, but I hate to change a recipe, particularly when I‚Äôm the first to review it. I see absolutely no reason to parboil the potatoes in this recipe. If you just slightly overcook the potato slices, you end up with a dish of broken and mashed-up potatoes...yeah, that‚Äôs what happened to me. I felt certain I‚Äôd like the taste, and I certainly did, but the potato consistency was not ‚Äúscalloped potatoes.‚Äù Have made a good number of scalloped and au gratin potato recipes over the years, and I‚Äôve never pre-cooked the potatoes, particularly sliced potatoes, and I never will again. You won‚Äôt be disappointed in the cheese sauce or the taste of this recipe, but I‚Äôd recommend you NOT parboil the potatoes, and adjust your cooking time, if necessary (and save yourself a dirty pan to wash).
Review_0: I added sweet Mesquite seasoning and granulated garlic, and cracked black peppers and you just wouldn‚Äôt believe it!
Review_1: I did it the lazy cooks way - a can of cheese soup with heavy cream and some onion powder instead of making a sauce, leftover cubed ham and 2 potatoes (getting ready to sprout)! After peeling I sliced the potatoes super thin with a wide peeler. I buttered a 9x9‚Äù casserole and layered just as the recipe, but sprinkled on some co-jack cheese into each layer, and then on top. I left it in the oven at 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Probably could have gone the full hour but I don‚Äôt like my cheese too brown. I did let it set for 6 minutes before serving. It made 4 good sized servings. Hubby suggests a crunchy topping would make it perfect, and he doesn‚Äôt like scalloped ham and potatoes!
Review_3: I'm going to make it now, but having seen a few other recipes, all told me what potato to get, but not this one! Don't you think someone should have mentioned the potato they are using? I have red, Yukon and a few Russert!
Review_4: Quite a task, but the result is well worth the effort. Excellent. Don't screw around with this recipe. It does not need improving. No shortcuts.
Review_5: Wow. This came out better than I expected. I had some leftovers from Christmas Eve and I didn't know what to do! So, I found this recipe and I did make some changes because of what I had on hand. I didn't pre cook the potatoes, but they were cooked first. My mother in law had brought over "baked potatoes" but they were not really good baked, so I sliced them then used the sauce to create this magnificent dish. I used cream in place of my milk because it was sparse. I used more than one type of cheese because the cheese platter we had set out for Christmas Eve did not get eaten up, I did not want to waste good gouda! So, it went on with cheddar! I also used very small cut honey baked ham! OH! I may have to use this again next year without having to use the what to do with these leftovers excuse! Great recipe!
Review_6: Absolutely delicious! I soaked my mandolin sliced potatoes in water for a good hour then rinsed and dried well. The only addition I made was to add a pinch of nutmeg. Using a good quality cheese is a must. The potatoes were not par boiled and I cooked an extra 10 minutes and broiled for a few minutes at the end. The potatoes were tender but not at all mushy.
Review_7: Turned out great. Did not par boil potatoes. Baked for 100 minutes at 350. Added a layer of broccoli in the middle. Will try bacon next time. Used just a tad less flour as others recommended. Added flour after milk and reduced slightly, then cheese. Perfect consistency. Definitely a keeper.
Review_8: Great recipe. Needs 2x salt and 3x pepper.

MHPR_Review: Delicious! This was such a hit for dinner on a cold evening. I made as written with the exception of using prosciutto instead of ham. It made several thinner rolls. I served on top of mashed potatoes. When I make this again, I will double the amount of mushrooms and onions. It really was a satisfying meal and a great way to use less meat for dinner. Thanks, Chef John!
Review_1: Delicious! This was such a hit for dinner on a cold evening. I made as written with the exception of using prosciutto instead of ham. It made several thinner rolls. I served on top of mashed potatoes. When I make this again, I will double the amount of mushrooms and onions. It really was a satisfying meal and a great way to use less meat for dinner. Thanks, Chef John!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 20 mins', 'Additional Time: 5 mins', 'Total Time: 30 mins', 'Servings: 4']
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '4 bone-in chicken breast halves with skin', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', '1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper']
Directions: ["Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Rub olive oil over each chicken breast, then season both sides with salt and black pepper. Place the chicken skin-side down on a broiling pan.", 'Broil in the preheated oven for 10 minutes, then flip the chicken breast skin-side up. Continue broiling until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 10 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove from the oven and allow to rest for 5 minutes before serving.', 'If desired, add 1/4 cup of water to the bottom of the broiling pan and stir to dissolve the browned bits from the chicken juices. Then use it as a light sauce on the chicken.']
MHPR_Review: This is one of those recipes you might read and pass by because, hey, what could olive oil, salt, and pepper do for some pieces of chicken. Well, here's what they can do: they'll jet-pack you back to when your mom made chicken for a weekday night (even though it's flavorful and divine enough to serve to guests). It will also let the cooked chicken speak pretty much for itself, without smothering it in a sauce. I confess I was leery. I wanted to add rosemary, or oregano, or (good grief) even Lawry's Seasoned Salt. But I resisted and, I must say, it was worth it. The ingredients are simple, and that makes it an easy dish to make. If you use organic chicken breasts, it's going to be moist in any case. But adding the olive oil, salt, and pepper, blend in a way that might make you swoon in the way I swooned when I ate it. Simple, homey, cozy, and (in so many ways) perfect. Next time you're in a hurry for a knock-'em-dead meal, serve this up as the main player. I'm pretty sure you'll wow whoever's eating. This is one fine recipe.
Review_0: Easy and elegant. I happen yo be one of those rare creatures who think that chicken tastes great without being marinated, coated, dusted and otherwise tortured to serve as a vehicle for spices and rubs. This recipe lets the chicken stand alone. I did have to adjust the timing a bit. My oven runs a bit hot. Using an instant read thermometer helps.
Review_1: This recipe is simple to make and ridiculously good. The only thing I did differently is, I did it in my air fryer.
Review_2: Not sure how this could be so simple and still so good but it was. Family loved it, will be cooking chicken this way from now on. I used quite big boneless skinless breasts and broiled for about 14 minutes, they were done perfectly, tender and juicy.
Review_3: I did make the recipe and it was so easy and I did make a change I marinated in honey teriyaki marinade my husband said it was the best chicken he‚Äôs ever had.
Review_4: I made this for my daughter and I and it was absolutely fabulous. She is mostly a vegetarian so is very picky about what meat dishes she will eat. I used organic chicken breasts. It was so simple and so tasty.
Review_5: cut the salt because, you know.. heart health. but SUPER useful. Thank YOU.
Review_6: I made it plain to use for a chicken sandwich. Turned out great. You'll want to lower the cooking time if you're using thin sliced chicken breasts
Review_7: This was a great, easy to use recipe. I added lemon garlic seasoning for added flavor.
Review_8: I added some thyme, rosemary, parsley, & garlic. Nice & Simple Recipe :)

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 35 mins', 'Total Time: 45 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['¬Ω cup all-purpose flour', '¬º cup seasoned bread crumbs', '2 teaspoons garlic salt', '1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '4 (6 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, pounded thin', '8 bacon strips', '1 onion, sliced', '¬º teaspoon lemon-pepper seasoning', '¬º teaspoon Italian seasoning', '¬º teaspoon salt', '‚Öõ teaspoon red pepper flakes, or more to taste', '¬º cup packed brown sugar', '¬Ω cup shredded Colby-Monterey Jack cheese']
Directions: ['Mix flour, bread crumbs, garlic salt, and black pepper together in a bowl. Coat each chicken breast with flour mixture.', 'Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Remove bacon with a slotted spoon, reserving bacon drippings; drain bacon on paper towels.', 'Cook and stir coated chicken breasts in the bacon drippings until chicken is no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, about 5 minutes per side; remove and keep warm.', 'Cook and stir onion, lemon-pepper seasoning, Italian seasoning, salt, red pepper flakes, and brown sugar in the same skillet until onion is golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes.', "Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.", 'Arrange chicken breasts on a baking sheet; top each breast with 2 bacon slices. Top with caramelized onion and Colby-Monterey Jack cheese.', 'Broil chicken breasts until cheese is melted and bubbling, 1 to 3 minutes.', 'The nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of the breading ingredients. The actual amount of the breading consumed will vary.']
MHPR_Review: I made this recipe for Sunday dinner,AWESOME! Used boneless chicken tenders instead of full breast. followed the recipe made no changes,served it with steamed brussel sprouts, and fettuccine alfredo
Review_0: Was looking for something flavorful using chicken breasts and this caught my attention. I've made smoothered chicken before and there are many different recipes with different ingredients but this one was by far the most flavorful and was quite easy to prepare. It has many layers of flavor including sweet, hot, salty, and of course, bacon. I thought two slices of bacon was a bit excessive and half of 1 thick slice on each breast was just right, at least for my husband and I. It was quite tasty, and my picky husband loved it. I made up extra breading for the chicken also. It's the perfect blend of spices and flavor.
Review_1: This is a very time consuming recipe for one that has "easy" in the name. All turned out except for the sauteed onions with the spices - after 10 minutes of sauteeing on medium and then medium-low heat, the spices clumped together in a black mess and the onions were also mostly black/burned. They may do better if cooked without the seasoning and then adding the spices at the end of that part of the recipe.
Review_2: My husband said this is 5 star chicken! So easy and very tasty.
Review_3: This recipe was delicious! I followed the recipe exactly and wouldn‚Äôt change a thing. I butterflied my chicken breasts as they were a bit thick and used precooked bacon to save time. The flavor combinations were so tasty and I plan to make this again! Great for entertaining!
Review_4: Awesome‚ÄîCan‚Äôt go wrong with cheese, bacon, and caramelized onions!
Review_5: I made this recipe the other day, and my husband is already asking for it again. Insists it‚Äôs one of the tastiest dishes he‚Äôs ever had. Was manning to make it for his birthday this weekend, but he wants it NOW.
Review_6: DELICIOUS!! My family now requests this dish regularly. How can you go wrong with this combo of ingredients?! Don't skimp on the carmelized onions, either - they are the perfect compliment to the salty bacon & the sharper the cheese (I used pepperjack) the better. WE LOVE THIS RECIPE.
Review_7: left off the cheese and added red peppers, great way to cook a breast. still very juicy and incredibly flavorful
Review_8: Just ok... Good favor, but the chicken itself turned out very rubbery for some reason.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 30 mins', 'Cook Time: 30 mins', 'Additional Time: 30 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr 30 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['1 quart water', '¬º cup salt', '¬º cup white sugar', '¬º cup hot sauce', '4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into strips', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '¬Ω teaspoon cayenne pepper', '¬Ω teaspoon paprika', '¬Ω teaspoon salt', '¬º teaspoon garlic powder', '¬º teaspoon ground black pepper', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', '¬Ω teaspoon paprika', '¬Ω teaspoon salt', '¬Ω teaspoon white sugar', '¬º teaspoon garlic powder', 'cooking spray']
Directions: ['Mix water, 1/4 cup salt, 1/4 cup sugar, and hot sauce together in a large bowl until sugar and salt are dissolved into the brine. Place chicken pieces in the brine and refrigerate, 30 minutes to 1 hour. Pour brine from the bowl.', 'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place a baking rack onto a baking sheet and coat rack with cooking spray.', 'Combine flour, 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, and black pepper in a shallow bowl until coating is well mixed. Press chicken pieces into the coating until both sides are evenly coated; place on the prepared rack.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Spray each chicken piece with cooking spray; flip and spray the other side. Continue baking until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 10 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).', 'Heat oil in a small pan over medium heat until shimmering. Mix 1 tablespoon cayenne pepper, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon sugar, and 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder together in a bowl; add to oil and cook for 30 seconds. Brush oil mixture onto cooked chicken, adding more layers for extra heat.', 'Nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of brine ingredients. The actual amount consumed will vary.']
MHPR_Review: These turned out really good. I'll admit it would have been much easier just to drop them in a deep fryer but this was a nice healthier alternative. Keep a close eye on your sauce. I got distracted and let mine go 45 seconds and it had started to burn. These were not bland or too spicy but had just the right amount of heat to them. Thanks for sharing!
Review_0: I didn't make the sauce but other than that I made as directed - I thought it was spicy enough for me and just topped a salad with it and my husband dipped it in sauce. I liked that it wasn't as greasy as fried chicken.
Review_1: I made it exactly like the recipe but did cut down the cayenne pepper in the sauce only from 1 tablespoon to 1 teaspoon, because I don't like a lot of spice. My family LOVED it! I made another Nashville chicken recipe before and it doesn't even come close to how good this one was! This is a keeper and is definitely being added to my recipe repertoire!!
Review_2: Ok l, I love to cook, I always tweak a recipe, and I made a few changes First off, I used a family pack of drumsticks (15-16) pieces. I cut the volume of the brine and made it with 2C milk, 1/4 cup sugar, salt, and Hot sauce. Marinated drumsticks in fridge for 3 hours. The coating I made as directed, and the dredge was more than enough to coat all the drumsticks with excess. I had to cook the legs longer than recommended, since I didn‚Äôt use breasts. I coated (sprayed) the legs as indicated with the olive oil cooking spray, and I baked the legs 30 min per side, flipping once, due to the amount of legs I cooked and the fact that it‚Äôs dark meat. I wanted no blood near the bone. Total cooking time was 1 hour at 350. For the sauce, I made that exactly as the directions, but the sugar seized and clumped in the mixture due to the heat, so I added 2 Tbsp of water and that allowed the seized sugar to unclump, and I was able to use a basting brush to lightly coat the cooked drumsticks as they came out of the oven. This recipe has some heat to it, but it‚Äôs a quick heat, a bit of delayed onset after the initial bite, but it did not linger. It was not a saucy heat that sticks to the inside of your mouth and continues to burn like napalm, but this heat was a spice-heat that develops after you start to chew, then peaks, then decays. I liked it a lot, and knew what to expect as I cooked it myself and tried the sauce before I basted the drumsticks. But my husband was slightly surp
Review_3: chicken was good, didn't use the sauce instead used Franks with a little butter. worth having again
Review_4: My family and I thought this was really good. It wasn‚Äôt as crispy as we normally like, but the flavor was definitely there. I will make it again!
Review_5: I followed the recipe word for word and it was 2 stars as it's written. 1. It tastes nothing like Nashville hot chicken. 2. It was way too salty. The salt needs to be cut by half and maybe even left out of the oil. 3. The breading was soggy. It would better fried. I may try making it again, but I honestly didn't think it was worth the effort.
Review_6: We did not like it at all. It was salty and tasted like flour. I used a convection oven so I thought it would be crispy but it was not.
Review_7: The chicken itself before the sauce was OK. That's why I gave it 2 stars. There was so much excess flour on the chicken, presumably to get the sauce to stick it it? However, I found the sauce to be unappealing. It tasted like oil with added spices and an overwhelming amount of cayenne.
Review_8: This was delicious and easy to make! It was WAY too salty though. I'd probably cut out the salt in the breading and sauce next time bc with the brine, the chicken is salty enough!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 30 mins', 'Total Time: 40 mins', 'Servings: 2']
Ingredients: ['2 skinless, boneless chicken breasts', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '¬º teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon butter', '1 (8 ounce) package chopped white mushrooms', '¬º cup chopped white onion', '1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 splash red wine', '1 pinch salt and cracked black pepper to taste', '¬Ω cup shredded mozzarella cheese']
Directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Coat both sides of chicken with oregano and cayenne pepper and place on a baking sheet. Season with salt and black pepper.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, melt butter in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms, onion, Worcestershire sauce, and red wine. Cook and stir until vegetables shrink down a bit, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and black pepper. Reduce heat to medium-low to low; cook until tender, 10 to 15 minutes.', 'Pour mushroom mixture on top of chicken. Continue baking until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 8 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).', 'Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top of the chicken and cook until cheese is bubbly, about 5 minutes more.']
MHPR_Review: Similar to my Mothers Smothered Chicken recipe, except we throw the raw onions and mushrooms, a mix of white and portabella or exotic blend into the dish with the raw chicken, you add chicken broth 1/2, Worcestershire sauce about 1/3 a cup, white wine (a sprinkle) and soy sauce into the glass baking dish with the boneless skinless chicken thighs. Bake at 375 for 35-45 minutes pull it put and put either mozorella or provolone cheese slices over the chicken and let it melt. Spoon chicken/mushrooms and sauce from dish over white rice and serve.
Review_0: Delicious! It takes longer to bake to doneness (165¬∞)than indicated in the recipe for most chicken breasts. I will make it again!
Review_1: Great recipe! Given that he enjoys mushrooms, my fiancee loved this dish! I will put this one in my weekly rotation. A definite "make again" that was easy to make. I didnt have whorsteshire sauce so i replaced it with a tablespoon of A1 Steak Sauce and it was right on! I used 1/4 cup of red wine, the "splash" didnt seem like enough. I normally follow all measurements in recipes down to the teaspoon but I free handed the seasoning of the chicken on this dish. I am so happy I did; it came out amazing. I used some garlic salt to season the chicken instead of regular kosher salt. It was a nice addition. I also used 2 tablespoons of butter instead of 1. I used a shredded cheddar instead of mozzarella. Not only did I lack mozzarella, but i like the taste of cheddar with mushrooms instead. Again GREAT RECIPE, I cant say that enough.
Review_2: I want the brussel sprout recipe.
Review_3: Not to get too picky, but the photo doesn't seem to show any sauteed white onion amongst the mushrooms but does show chopped green scallion sprinkled on top (not listed in the recipe).
Review_4: This is really good. I added garlic (of course) and it was a huge hit.
Review_5: Delicious!
Review_6: Definitely a keeper!
Review_7: I love to try new chicken dishes that are low carb and this recipe fit that bill nicely. I only made one change in that I used thyme instead of oregano as I think,ended up being a better choice with the list of ingredients of mushrooms,wine,and cayenne pepper. Really moist chicken! I don't understand why another reviewer thought it was a bit of a hassle to make because ither then the chopping of mushrooms and onions, I thought it was easy .I did sauteed chicken thighs instead of chicken breasts,then took the thighs out and sauteed the onions and mushrooms with the wine and other ingredients in the same pan for a few minutes then added them to the chicken thighs and baked it all together. I thought it was a downright tasty well put together dish!
Review_8: Similar to my Mothers Smothered Chicken recipe, except we throw the raw onions and mushrooms, a mix of white and portabella or exotic blend into the dish with the raw chicken, you add chicken broth 1/2, Worcestershire sauce about 1/3 a cup, white wine (a sprinkle) and soy sauce into the glass baking dish with the boneless skinless chicken thighs. Bake at 375 for 35-45 minutes pull it put and put either mozorella or provolone cheese slices over the chicken and let it melt. Spoon chicken/mushrooms and sauce from dish over white rice and serve.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 30 mins', 'Cook Time: 20 mins', 'Total Time: 50 mins', 'Servings: 2', 'Yield: 2 airline chicken breasts']
Ingredients: ['1 whole chicken', '1 drizzle olive oil', 'kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 pinches herbes de Provence, or to taste', '¬º teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '3 tablespoons butter, divided', '2 sprigs fresh thyme', '1 sprig fresh rosemary', '¬Ω cup chicken stock, or to taste']
Directions: ['Slice off 1/2 of each chicken wing by cutting through the joint where wing meets drumette. Slice through skin between thighs and breasts. Make a shallow cut along breast bone and 2 deep cuts on either side, separating breasts.', 'Slice each breast off the carcass using the tip of the knife, keeping the blade pressed against bone. Cut through cartilage to remove breast with wing attached. Reserve remaining chicken and carcass for another use.', 'Remove tenders from breasts and trim as needed. Season tenders with a drizzle of olive oil, kosher salt, black pepper, herbes de Provence, and cayenne pepper.', 'Push your finger gently under skin of each breast, right next to wing bone, to separate it from meat. Slide 1 tender under skin, center it, and smooth over skin. Sprinkle kosher salt over breasts.', 'Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken breasts, skin-side down. Cook until the bottom is browned, 6 to 7 minutes. Flip, reduce heat to medium, and cook until no longer pink on the inside and the juices run clear, 7 to 10 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).', 'Add 1 tablespoon butter, thyme, and rosemary to the skillet. Baste chicken with butter-herb mixture. Remove chicken from the skillet.', 'Pour stock into the skillet; increase heat to high. Boil until reduced to desired thickness, about 2 minutes. Turn off heat and whisk remaining 2 tablespoons butter into sauce.', 'Slice each chicken breast into thirds and spoon sauce on top.', 'Feel free to use whatever spices and seasoning you wish since that will not affect the technique.', 'To prep the chicken ahead of time, cover it in plastic wrap and refrigerate after seasoning.', "You're usually told to cook chicken to 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), but I often stop at 150 degrees F (66 degrees C) for more tender results.", 'Nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of chicken. The amount consumed will vary.']
MHPR_Review: Haven't made it but it looks wonderful! I remember flying in my "good" clothes and having actual knives and forks with actual plates and real food. I love this!
Review_0: Great receipt, easily made using the video.
Review_1: Made with skinless, boneless chicken breast and it was delicious!
Review_2: I didn't have whole chicken, just bone in breasts with skin that I bought on sale. I boned the breasts, followed the directions for inserting the tender and this turned out great! Very moist and not dry, just like it says. Highly recommend, especially if you can get a deal on chicken breast with the bone.
Review_3: It was amazing, thanks chef John, now I want to try and finish it in the oven.
Review_4: Definitely watch the video.... I watched after the fact and butchered my first chicken lol ! But the video makes it clear, simple and is VERY entertaining. Love this recipe as is .
Review_5: Literally the best chicken I've ever eaten! Not sure if it was due to the high quality chicken I bought from the butcher or due to Chef John's pan sauce method, but it was amazing. Give it a try!
Review_6: I used two bone in chicken breasts, removed the bones (didn't have the wing drumette part). EVOO, S&P and parsley flakes. After frying on both sides, had to put in 350 oven 'til it got to temp (maybe 10 minutes?). Very good, but I could not fry them until done, they would have been burnt. Made a pan sauce with chicken broth and butter.
Review_7: Absolutely delicious. Easy to make. Perfectly seasoned. Just loved. Will because a family standard. I , however, bought my chicken from a local chicken farm already cut up.
Review_8: Absolutely delicious. Easy to make. Perfectly seasoned. Just loved. Will because a family standard. I , however, bought my chicken from a local chicken farm already cut up.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 15 mins', 'Total Time: 20 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['olive oil cooking spray', '1 lemon, quartered', '4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '¬º teaspoon dried cilantro, or to taste', '¬º teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste', '¬º teaspoon onion salt, or to taste']
Directions: ['Spray a large cast iron skillet with cooking spray and heat over low heat.', 'Poke a fork into each chicken breast about 5 times and place in the hot skillet. Squeeze 1 lemon quarter onto each chicken breast, leaving a little juice in each quarter. Sprinkle each breast with some cilantro, onion salt, and pepper; cook until golden brown, about 7 minutes. Flip, poke holes and repeat the seasoning process again. Cook until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 5 to 7 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).']
Review_0: A simple recipe, however I suggest some changes. 1/4 teaspoon of each seasoning is nowhere near enough to coat 4 chicken breasts. I used that amount on EACH breast. I also found the poking with a fork to not only be unnecessary, but actually causes juices to escape from the chicken. I would also season BOTH sides of the chicken before putting it in the skillet. You will also need to cook this at a higher temp. Low is not really going to brown the chicken. I started mine at medium, then lowered it to medium-low for 7 minutes on the first side, and 5 on the second. I had pounded the chicken breasts down to an even 1" thickness before starting. The breasts came out juicy and I liked the added lemon flavor.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 30 mins', 'Cook Time: 20 mins', 'Total Time: 50 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['3 medium jalapeno peppers', '¬Ω cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', '¬Ω small onion, chopped', '2 ounces cream cheese, softened', '2 cloves garlic, crushed', '¬º teaspoon ground cumin', '4 (5 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', 'cooking spray', 'salt to taste']
Directions: ['Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.', 'Place jalapeno peppers on a microwave-safe plate. Microwave on high power until soft but still plump, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove and discard seeds. Dice peppers.', 'Mix diced peppers, Monterey Jack cheese, onion, cream cheese, garlic, and cumin together in a bowl.', 'Make a pocket in each chicken breast, being careful not to cut through the sides or bottom, as follows: Make a vertical slice in the top center of each breast, starting about 1/2 inch in from each edge. Starting inside the vertical slit, cut horizontally into the chicken breast in both directions; this should leave you with a nice pocket.', 'Press 1/4 of the pepper-cheese mixture into each breast. Close and secure with toothpicks. Spray chicken breasts with cooking spray and season with salt.', 'Place chicken on the preheated grill with toothpicks facing upwards. Grill for 12 minutes, then turn and cook until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 3 to 5 more minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove toothpicks before serving.', 'I find it easiest to cut the chicken pockets when the chicken is slightly frozen in the center.', 'Instead of grilling, you can coat the stuffed chicken breasts with bread crumbs and bake in a preheated 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven for 35 to 40 minutes.']
MHPR_Review: Maybe my jalape√±os were rather large, because this was a lot of jalape√±os. It was good though and spicy. I had to bake mine in the oven, but I didn't put breadcrumbs on them. They came out perfect in 35 minutes.
Review_0: Maybe my jalape√±os were rather large, because this was a lot of jalape√±os. It was good though and spicy. I had to bake mine in the oven, but I didn't put breadcrumbs on them. They came out perfect in 35 minutes.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 25 mins', 'Total Time: 40 mins', 'Servings: 6', 'Yield: 6 servings']
Ingredients: ['2 teaspoons olive oil', '3 jalapeno peppers, seeded and finely chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ¬º cups vegetable broth', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice', '1 cup quinoa', '1 cup frozen corn kernels', '¬Ω teaspoon kosher salt', '‚Öì cup chopped fresh cilantro', '¬º lime, juiced']
Directions: ['Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Saute jalapeno peppers and garlic in hot oil until fragrant, about 1 minute.', 'Pour vegetable broth into the saucepan. Stir black beans, tomatoes, quinoa, corn, and salt into the broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer, covered, until the liquid is fully absorbed into the quinoa, 20 to 25 minutes.', 'Fluff quinoa with a fork. Stir in cilantro and lime juice.']
Review_0: Really good! The whole family loved it.
Review_1: Healthy and delicious! I made a few changes. Instead of frozen corn, I used canned sweet corn. I used about half the juice from the diced tomatoes and half from the corn. I don't typically like spicy foods, so I was worried three jalapenos would be too hot, but without the seeds, it was perfect.
Review_2: Delicious! I used a 10 oz can of Rotel tomatoes instead of the large can of regular tomatoes so I added a few chopped cherry tomatoes to compensate. As written you get a nice side dish. Add an avocado and a hard boiled egg and it turns into a perfect meal even on-the-go. Thank you for the recipe.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 55 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr 10 mins', 'Servings: 8']
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '¬Ω pound lean ground beef', '¬Ω pound Mexican chorizo, casing removed and meat crumbled', '¬Ω cup chopped onion', '1 tablespoon chili powder', '1 ¬Ω teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 teaspoon salt', '¬Ω teaspoon ground coriander', '¬Ω teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 cup frozen corn', '¬Ω (8 ounce) package cream cheese', '1 tablespoon butter', '1 (2 pound) package hash brown potatoes', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese', 'shredded lettuce', '1 cup guacamole']
Directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef, chorizo, and onion until meat is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Season with chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, coriander, and black pepper. Add black beans, tomatoes, and corn; cook and stir until heated through, about 5 minutes. Transfer mixture to a 2-quart baking dish.', 'Combine cream cheese and butter in a microwave-safe bowl; heat on high until melted, about 1 minute. Stir cream cheese mixture until smooth; spread over meat mixture. Layer hash browns over cream cheese mixture and top with Cheddar cheese.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and potatoes are lightly brown, 30 to 40 minutes. Serve with shredded lettuce and guacamole.', 'For a more authentic Mexican dish, substitute queso panela for the cream cheese and queso blanco for Cheddar.']
MHPR_Review: I made this recipe last night. I made a few changes because it's what I had at hand. I used all chorizo, which made it a little spicer, added a plobano pepper from my garden, and microwaved a few potatoes and grated them for hash browns. I didn't change anything else. This was an awesome dish. My husband loved it. I will definitely make this again.
Review_0: I made this exactly as it was written, so 5 stars are for this recipe and not for a recipe I made using this one. Is now in my collection, have made more than once.
Review_1: Very tasty recipe. Although I generally prefer to reproduce the recipes as originally described, I had no chorizo so I used Andouille sausage. I added a tablespoon of Worcester sauce for more tang. Also, I had no hash browns so I chopped a potato into very small cubes. Finally, I sprinkled cilantro over the oven baked mixture. Everything worked great...You can increase/decrease the amount of heat according to your taste preference.
Review_2: Loved this.. tweaked with more spices. Needed to use up my chorizo, so I doubled the recipe for meat. Came out great! I drained some of the liquid so my son could make tacos and burritos from the leftovers. ????????
Review_3: Turned out perfectly and the family loved it..
Review_4: Wonderful! Used all chorizo and added some jalepeno & Serrano peppers (we love heat)! This is a keeper and something I will get into rotation. Also made in 9x13 pan
Review_5: This is fantastic. The only change I made was all chorizo. These dishes never fit in a 2 qt. dish, so I used an 9.5x 11 pan. I had to double the cream cheese and butter to get it to cover. We will definitely be making this again.
Review_6: Great flavor but takes more like 45 minutes to make and required a larger baking pan
Review_7: Didn't use chorizo, only ground beef. My biggest question was whether the hash browns were added thawed or frozen? I did frozen and it worked out but perhaps cooked a little longer to accommodate.

Review_2: Beautiful color and flavorul. The ratio of quinoa to dressing was off. I added almost another cup of Quinoa to balance the amount of dressing. Next time I would just add half the dressing to flavor.

Review_4: Really good. I added tomatoes and an avocado. Thank you for your recipe.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 25 mins', 'Total Time: 40 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion, diced', '¬Ω cup quinoa', '1 ounce taco seasoning mix', '1 cup water', '1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, drained', '¬Ω cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '¬º cup sour cream']
Directions: ['Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat; saute onion in hot oil until slightly softened, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in quinoa and taco seasoning; saute until fragrant, about 1 minute.', 'Pour water into quinoa mixture. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover the saucepan with a lid, and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir beans and tomatoes into quinoa mixture, cover the saucepan again with the lid, and simmer until quinoa is tender and water is absorbed, about 5 minutes more. Stir Cheddar cheese into quinoa, spoon into bowls, and top each with a dollop of sour cream.']
MHPR_Review: This tasted great! I think I would like to try black beans in it next time, and some corn, like the submitter suggested. Great vegetarian meal. The only thing was it took mine about 6 more minutes to cook so that it wasn't soupy. I sprinkled a little more cheese on top when serving. Also, I only got 3 servings, not 4, for this as a meal. Thanks for a great lunch.
Review_0: This recipe was great. I substituted black beans for kidney beans and rolled up in a tortilla. Husband liked it a lot too. Will be making again.
Review_1: I needed to use more Taco seasoning, and it may need some "crunch", like celery, or......?
Review_2: Really great served with tortilla chips!
Review_3: Great! I made a double recipe. I only had 1 packet of taco mix so I used some fresh garlic and individual spices for the second pack of taco mix. To make it very low fat, I just used olive oil spray initially, and used fat free sour cream and fat free shredded cheddar. I didn't mix the cheese and sour cream in, but instead served this on soft tortillas, spread each tortilla with sour cream first then topped the mixture with shredded cheese and folded/rolled burrito-style. My husband loved it and said he'd be glad to eat it plain also--no tortilla and no sour cream and cheese either. I liked that it was low salt and we could make it very low fat. I added a diced yellow pepper. Like another reviewed, I had to add extra water and extra time to the quinoa to get it to steam up fluffy. We will make this regularly! It was tasty and a nice choice for healthy "comfort food," and it was pretty quick and inexpensive, with mostly pantry staples on hand.
Review_4: It was good, but there wasn't enough liquid, for the quinoa to get tender, so I ended up adding some chicken broth & cooking it longer. I also substituted canned, diced tomatoes, for the fresh. Next time, I may pre cook the quinoa & simmer together
Review_5: This tasted great! I think I would like to try black beans in it next time, and some corn, like the submitter suggested. Great vegetarian meal. The only thing was it took mine about 6 more minutes to cook so that it wasn't soupy. I sprinkled a little more cheese on top when serving. Also, I only got 3 servings, not 4, for this as a meal. Thanks for a great lunch.

Recipe_Name: Vegan Mexican Quinoa Bowl with Green Chile Cilantro Sauce
Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 30 mins', 'Cook Time: 20 mins', 'Total Time: 50 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['1 cup unsalted raw cashews', '1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers', '¬º cup hemp milk', '¬Ω jalapeno pepper with seeds, or more to taste', '¬Ω teaspoon salt', '1 ¬º cups chopped fresh cilantro', '3 cups water', '1 ¬Ω cups quinoa', '2 romaine hearts, chopped', '2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained', '3 cups chopped red bell pepper', '¬Ω cup chopped red onion', '2 avocados, chopped']
Directions: ['Combine cashews, green chile peppers, hemp milk, jalapeno pepper, and salt in a blender; process until smooth.', 'Pour cashew mixture into a small bowl; stir in 1 cup cilantro.', 'Bring water and quinoa to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until quinoa is tender, 15 to 20 minutes.', 'Divide romaine lettuce among 4 bowls. Top with quinoa, black beans, red bell pepper, and onion. Drizzle cilantro sauce on top. Garnish with remaining 1/4 cup cilantro and chopped avocados.', 'The magazine version of this recipe halves all the ingredients, except for the diced green chiles, and adds radicchio leaves for serving.']
MHPR_Review: I substituted spinach in for the greens, coconut milk for the hemp milk. I omitted the cashews for the sake of calories; I'm sure they would have been delicious. I cut the quinoa down to 1 cup. Then I cut the whole recipe in half, so it made two servings. On the first night, I made it cold, following the recipe. It was zesty and filling. On the second night, I sauteed all of the vegetables, and heated up the beans and leftover quinoa. I layered it all together with the cold cilantro sauce, which warmed up nicely. I loved it both ways! Very tangy! If you don't like any heat at all, maybe leave out the jalapeno pepper, or at least the seeds. I'll make this again. Very easy!
Review_0: Very flavorful and filling!
Review_1: I made as written but used almond milk. This is was ok at best. I like the base but feel it needs a lot more flavor. Next time I will add lime juice to the sauce or perhaps salsa verde.
Review_2: I used lightly salted cashews and removed the cilantro. Next time I'll go with unsalted cashews because the sauce was a little too salty once finished. This recipe was so yummy! This is the first time I've used quinoa in a recipe and now I am hooked! The flavors were well balanced and the avocado was the perfect final touch. I will definitely be making this again!
Review_3: We made this as a family meal with 6 kids ranging from 3 to 18, and it was not a hit. Overall there were a few that liked it and a few that barely picked at it with one of mine opting to go to bed instead of eating another bite (we don't force them to eat but we don't offer to make anything else if they don't like what's for dinner). If we were to make it again, we'd skip the cilantro.
Review_4: The sauce may with out a doubt be the best part of this recipe!! we bought a chicken as a back up in case it wasn't good, we still haven't touched the chicken and have been fighting over the leftovers.
Review_5: I made mine without the red pepper, black beans and green chiles; instead I used Verde salsa, shredded carrots, tomato, chicken (opps, that's not vegan!!!)and mushrooms, which I had in my fridge the day I prepared this dish. I must say it is DEVINE!!! I also squeezed fresh lime juice over the salad ;-)
Review_6: I substituted spinach in for the greens, coconut milk for the hemp milk. I omitted the cashews for the sake of calories; I'm sure they would have been delicious. I cut the quinoa down to 1 cup. Then I cut the whole recipe in half, so it made two servings. On the first night, I made it cold, following the recipe. It was zesty and filling. On the second night, I sauteed all of the vegetables, and heated up the beans and leftover quinoa. I layered it all together with the cold cilantro sauce, which warmed up nicely. I loved it both ways! Very tangy! If you don't like any heat at all, maybe leave out the jalapeno pepper, or at least the seeds. I'll make this again. Very easy!
Review_7: Wonderful!!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 15 mins', 'Additional Time: 10 mins', 'Total Time: 40 mins', 'Servings: 4']
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 small onion, chopped', '1 jalapeno pepper, minced, or to taste', '3 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (14.5 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '¬æ cup corn kernels', '¬æ teaspoon salt, or to taste', '¬Ω teaspoon ground cumin', '¬Ω teaspoon smoked paprika', '¬º teaspoon chili powder', '‚Öõ teaspoon black pepper', '1 cup dry quinoa', '1 cup vegetable broth, or as needed', '2 tablespoons chopped cilantro, or to taste', '1 lime, juiced', '1 avocado, diced']
Directions: ['Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select Saute function. Add oil, onion, jalapeno pepper, and garlic. Saute until onion is softened, about 2 minutes. Add black beans, tomatoes, and corn; mix well. Season with salt, cumin, paprika, chili powder, and black pepper. Add quinoa and toss until well combined. Pour in broth and mix.', "Close and lock the lid; set valve to the sealing position. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 1 minute. MHPR_Review: This was a tasty and quick recipe. I used a dash of cayenne pepper for heat since I didn't have a jalapeno pepper. We ate it with some tortilla chips and a salad for dinner. Yum!
Review_0: Good recipe easy to make

I used Bush's Black Bean Fiesta and Rotel Mexican Style tomatoes because that's what I had on hand. I also substituted Greek yogurt for the sour cream. The one-pot nature of this helped and simply following the directions produced a really decent meal option for me. I've been into the power bowl type of meals, so it felt like an accomplishment to be able to produce something like this on my own.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 20 mins', 'Cook Time: 1 hr 5 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr 25 mins', 'Servings: 8', 'Yield: 1 9x13-inch casserole']
Ingredients: ['nonstick cooking spray', '1 pound ground beef', '1 yellow onion, diced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon taco seasoning', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained', '1 (14 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes', '1 bunch fresh spinach, trimmed and coarsely chopped', '2 cups low-sodium chicken broth', '2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided', '1 cup long-grain rice', '1 cup mild, medium, or hot red salsa']
Directions: ['Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch casserole dish with cooking spray.', 'Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and start to brown, then add onion, garlic, and taco seasoning. Cook until beef is no longer pink, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard any excess oil. Add beans, tomatoes, spinach, chicken broth, 1 cup Mexican blend cheese, rice, and salsa. Pour into the prepared casserole dish.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until rice is cooked, 45 to 50 minutes. Take out of the oven, sprinkle with remaining cheese, and bake until cheese is melted, about 10 minutes more.']
MHPR_Review: This was good. Used a combination of spices because I didn't have taco seasoning: garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne, cumin, chili powder, salt and pepper. Also used two cans of beans because we really like them and let people put their own cheese on top to taste. Took a long time to cook, not sure exactly but it was over an hour. Would also be good with cooked diced chicken I think. Did lack some heat, I added hot sauce to my plate. Maybe some hot peppers added with the onion next time.
Review_0: I make this for my son to take back to school. He really likes it and it's easy to reheat. I usually add corn and chilies, but the original recipe is good as is.
Review_1: Where to start? First, you need a REALLY big pan to get all those ingredients in. I measured everything as in the recipe and had a time getting it all in the pan. Next, with two cups of broth it was very soupy to start with. Everything was just floating in the broth so I wondered how the cheese was supposed to melt.The cooking time was just a suggestion as many folks cooked it much longer than in the recipe. It never really said what the desired affect was, so it made it hard to know when it was done. I cooked mine about an hour and it was just too dry. The directions should say how to tell when it is "done", not just suggesting how long to cook. And it makes a LOT! With all those ingredients I was expecting a flavor explosion, but just got a dud.Tried adding hot sauce and sour cream. Wasn't too bad. Just not what I was hoping for.
Review_2: Delicious and easy!
Review_3: Love it! Quick and easy! Will make with ground chicken next time for my daughter who does not eat red meat. Good for a pot luck as well. And can use to put in taco shells or burritos.
Review_4: Very good, I will make it again. Instead of 45 minutes to bake at 375 it took 1.5 hours to bake completely. Next time I will add some corn to the dish. And I added crushed fritos on top just before serving with a dollop of sour cream.
Review_5: I added lettuce, tomato, and Doritos. It was the perfect taco salad.
Review_6: Family loved this. 5 stars for sure. Easy to make and absolutely delicious
Review_7: I just have a question. Why do you use kidney or black beans in your Mexican recipes. Try using pinto beans and Colby Longhorn cheese. Cheddar cheese is greasy!
Review_8: I loved it! The flavours were SO good! Everyone had seconds, which speaks LOUDLY for the dish. I didn't have fire roasted diced tomatoes so I used regular diced.

Top with chicken.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'In a bowl combine tomatoes, beans, corn, peppers, seasonings and garlic; pour over chicken.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Top with cheese and optional jalape√±o.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Bake for 45 minutes.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios']
MHPR_Review: In my quest to find a healthy Cinco de Mayo dish, I found this one. I drained the tomatoes and used an enchilada sauce instead. I also added green onions. My boyfriend keeps going back for more!
Review_0: I made a couple substitutions for one I used left over christmas turkey. Don't forget the cilantro it makes all the difference.
Review_1: The rating takes into consideration that this is for a low-sodium, low-cholesterol, low-fat diet.This is the first recipe I tried for my partner's DASH diet, and I'm glad it worked out as well as it did. To compensate for the lack of salt, I added half a tbsp more of the chili powder and cumin, and also added 1tbsp of lime juice to the veggie mix. The tomatoes, corn and lime added varied flavours. Next time I will try making a no-salt taco seasoning and add that to the veggies, plus a bit of cayenne to spice it up!
Review_2: Used pork chops ,Wow just as good,Dad's not a fan of chicken!!D
Review_3: Followed this recipe almost exactly as written, and it was great. The family loved it. If your not use to a low sodium diet, then you may find it bland. I left the rice slightly undercooked, so that when cooked in the oven it would absorb some of the juice from the tomatoes. It's a good dish, you just need to use some basic cooking knowledge to tweek the recipe based on which tomato product you use to ensure its not too dry or soupy.
Review_4: Fantastic! Just as good as leftovers.
Review_5: Mine are vegetarian and I put them in my souffl√© bowls. Only change was so chicken! So yummy.
Review_6: Loved this
Review_7: Really loved this. I have never tried cooking a Mexican dish before. Impressed a few of my Mexican friends in the States ;-) I added some dry chili peppers (finely chopped), and a half teaspoon of pepper. We like things hot and spicy around here! I also lightly browned the chicken first in a skillet and strained off any water and juices first before adding it to the mix.
Review_8: I was trying to make something to provide leftovers for lunches and fast dinners through the week, so I added a green pepper, yellow pepper, and another can of beans. I also used about 1.5 pounds of chicken breast. I adjusted seasonings up a little to accommodate. Also based on other comments I did 30 minutes with no cheese then i put the cheese on the last 15 minutes and this was very good. The base recipe gave me a lot to work with as I like all the ingredients. My husband came in with all the veggies in the bowl and commented "that's a lot of veggies" :-) and yes it was...very tasty.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 30 mins', 'Cook Time: 5 hrs 50 mins', 'Additional Time: 10 hrs', 'Total Time: 16 hrs 20 mins', 'Servings: 2']
Ingredients: ['1 bunch green onions - white parts chopped, green parts cut into 3 1/2-inch lengths, divided', '10 ounces whole pork belly', 'salt to taste', '¬º cup packed brown sugar', '2 tablespoons rice vinegar', '2 tablespoons fish sauce', '1 tablespoon ginger juice', '¬Ω teaspoon soy sauce', '4 cloves garlic, sliced', '4 whole dried red chile peppers', '¬Ω cup water']
Directions: ['Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C).', 'Lay a large sheet of aluminum foil on a flat work surface. Lay 1/2 of the green parts of the green onions down in the center of the foil. Place pork belly, fattiest-side down, on top of the green onions. Top with remaining green parts of the green onions and sprinkle with salt. Fold aluminum foil tightly around pork and green onions. Wrap pork belly again in another sheet of aluminum foil. Place wrapped pork, seam-side up, into a loaf pan.', 'Cook pork belly in the preheated oven for 5 1/2 hours. Turn off the oven and let cool in the oven for 2 hours. Remove from the oven and chill in the refrigerator, 8 hours to overnight.', 'Remove pork from the foil and discard green onions. Cut pork into eight pieces.', 'Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp all over, 2 to 4 minutes per side.', 'Whisk brown sugar, rice vinegar, fish sauce, ginger juice, and soy sauce together in a bowl.', 'Remove most of the fat from the bacon skillet and discard. Add 1 tablespoon of the brown sugar glaze and increase the heat to medium-high. Add pork and cook until caramelized and glazed on all sides, about 10 minutes. Make a well in the center of the skillet and add white parts of the green onion, garlic, and peppers. Saut√© until fragrant, about 1 minute.', 'Pour water and remaining brown sugar glaze into the skillet; simmer until sauce thickens, 3 to 5 minutes.']
MHPR_Review: Most people dont understand what pork belly is! It is the slab of meat that butchers slice into bacon.
Review_0: Really tasty. I had 1 1/4 lbs of pork belly but it was just enough for 2 - or 3 depending on how hungry you are.
Review_1: Did it. Doing it again!‚Ä¶

Review_3: It is unctuous. A fun recipe to make. First time and will make again. Came out perfect. Do you prep work and be ready to cook. Helps to have a second pair of hand in the kitchen.

Review_6: This was truly delicious!!!

It was very tender and flavorful with the glaze. i will definitely try it again, but next time I'll plan on using one pound of meat per person and adjust the glaze accordingly.
Review_8: It was as good as it looked. Not hard to make.

MHPR_Review: Well received recipe. Read notes for helpful hints and to save a bit of time.
Review_0: I've made this at least 10 times and we love it. First few times I cooked it as per recipe but the last times I've cooked it on the grill. 2 outside burners on low and middle burner off and placed it in the middle. Comes out great and doesn't heat up my kitchen for 6 hours. It's a win, win here in AZ. Not only do I get several meals out of it I don't put any unwanted heat in my house. I don't fry it in a pan either. I just pop it in the airfryer and turn it until all sides are browned and crispy. I've served it with barbecue sauce, hosin sauce, over rice or couscous. I've even chopped it up and made pork belly gravy with biscuits and eggs for breakfast. Haven't found a way we didn't like it. It's a recipe I turn to a couple of times a year. It also freezes well for later use of it. It's a recipe you can do so many different things with.
Review_1: This is delicious, my whole family loved it! I did the initial cook in the slow cooker on low overnight, chilled during the day, and slice up and pan fry the next day. Simple, quick, and delicious despite the long cook time!
Review_2: Easy recipe with great results. Flavorful and tender.
Review_3: I‚Äôve made this recipe twice now, second time I didn‚Äôt cool it just fried it up after it came out of the oven. SO DELICIOUS! Pork belly is so tough and has so much fat and this method gets rid of the toughness completely and helps eliminate a lot of the extra fat.I fried mine up and put on rice with some Asian sauces, but the first time I drizzled mine with BBQ sauce and served it as an appetizer
Review_4: Fabulous.
Review_5: I've been wanting to try a pork belly recipe for quite a while. This is OUTSTANDINGLY delicious. (No photo we had to dig right in...maybe next time.)

Review_7: Overall turned out well, I would add more paprika right before searing on cast iron and salt pepper.
Review_8: Bland and greasy. I will not make this .
