MHPR_Review: Very tasty. Just the perfect lime taste. I particular like my rice white so next time I am going to use half chicken broth and half water.
Review_0: I‚Äôve made this recipe many times, both with fresh and bottled lime juice, and fresh and dried cilantro. Fresh is better but bottled and dried is also really good. Cut salt to 1/4 t and it‚Äôs perfect.
Review_1: Really easy and delicious. I didn't have any corn so left that out which I would prefer to do in the future as well. I used Argorio Rice instead of Basmati. I served this with beef tacos, steamed cauliflower, and fresh pared English cucumbers from the garden to my daughter and her family. She served peach cobbler for dessert, such a great meal. Everyone but my youngest grandson loved the rice. Thanks, Leanne
Review_2: I was confused; Basmati for Mexican?? I nearly substituted long grain but forced myself to follow the recipe. Which! I did and! This turned out very good! Guests loved! They agreed texture wasn‚Äôt exactly what they were used to but all agreed this was great for our fajita bowls! Thanks Leanne!
Review_3: This was delicious. I couldn't stop eating it!
Review_4: Great flavor and easy to make. The fam liked the addition of green onions & corn so I threw in some extra. Otherwise, followed the recipe as written and it was yummy!
Review_5: Big hit!
Review_6: Great flavor!
Review_7: Easy to make and delicious!
Review_8: Yep, 5 stars! Because I had all ingredients except corn, I jumped into this. WOW. Easy and majorly flavorful. Ate this with a nice glass of white wine and I am a happy girl. From another Leanne in Colorado, I lift my glass to you

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 25 mins', 'Cook Time: 30 mins', 'Total Time: 55 mins', 'Servings: 8']
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) package penne pasta, or to taste', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 onion, diced', '1 red bell pepper, diced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 cooked chicken breasts, shredded, or more to taste', '2 (10 ounce) cans green enchilada sauce', '‚Öî cup red enchilada sauce', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '¬Ω teaspoon salt', '2 cups shredded Colby-Monterey Jack cheese', '1 cup sour cream']
Directions: ['Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil; add penne and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes. Drain and return pasta to the pot.', 'Heat oil in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat. Saut√© onion in hot oil until slightly softened, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir red bell pepper and garlic into onion; saut√© until fragrant and softened, another 3 to 5 minutes.', 'Stir chicken, green enchilada sauce, red enchilada sauce, diced green chiles, chili powder, cumin, and salt into onion mixture; bring to a simmer, reduce heat to low, and simmer until flavors blend, 8 to 10 minutes. Add Colby-Jack cheese and stir until melted and heated through, 1 to 3 minutes.', 'Reduce heat to low and stir sour cream into enchilada mixture; cook and stir until heated through. Pour enchilada mixture over penne pasta and toss to coat completely.']
MHPR_Review: Great recipe, added black beans at the same time the chicken was added. Topped off with green onions and sliced avocado. Will be making again!
Review_0: My incredibly picky teenager asks me to make this pasta every week, fantastic!
Review_1: Not sure how it is getting such good reviews. I'm sure the enchilada sauce you choose must impact the flavor. I used the Old El Paso canned sauce. Perhaps that was the issue. Followed the recipe exactly other than using rotini pasta. My family found it tolerable. We're normally big pasta eaters but nobody cared for seconds of this. Definitely won't repeat.
Review_2: One of my favorite recipes! It is great as is, but I also use a full can of red enchilada sauce and have no shame and use the full container of sour cream. I'm actually making it again right now!
Review_3: Family meal perfection! Made as directed, except I might have been a little short on the red pepper as I only had a half in the fridge. I will be using this recipe again, and again.
Review_4: I made the is for a outdoor get together and everyone loved it. Interestingly I did not have enough green enchilada sauce, but it did not seem to make a difference. Enjoy this one and get ready to be asked for the recipe.
Review_5: delicious, I was worried at first while making it, but once I tasted it, it was so amazing! Made just as directed, will be making again, It was wonderful, thank you for the awesome recipe!
Review_6: Delicious! My daughter who is 16 now was diagnosed with Celiac disease when she was 7. We used to make enchiladas once a week. But we don‚Äôt anymore as we haven‚Äôt found a good gf tortilla alternative. But tonight she took one bite of this and smiled. And said Yes! This is what I remember from childhood! This will become a standard dinner selection for us. Thanks for the submission!
Review_7: Absolutely delicious even with edits to make a healthier version: 1 cup of cheese and 1/2 cup light sour cream. I also used 5 chicken breasts (seasoned, cooked, sliced into 1‚Äùx1/2‚Äù strips) vs 2 breasts shredded) and it was the perfect amt of protein to offset the amt of pasta. Once the sauce was prepared, we reserved 2 cups
Review_8: At first my fam was a little leary of it, because it's a new recipe that I'm trying out on them. Til they tasted it, my family loved it.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 20 mins', 'Total Time: 25 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '1 pound baby carrots', '1 shallot, chopped', '2 tablespoons vegetable stock', '¬Ω teaspoon thyme', '¬º teaspoon ground nutmeg', '¬º teaspoon ground sumac', '¬Ω teaspoon chopped fresh rosemary', '¬Ω teaspoon chopped fresh sage', 'salt and ground white pepper to taste']
Directions: ['Heat butter in a large pan over medium heat until completely melted. Add carrots and shallot to pan; cook and stir until the carrots are coated in butter and shallots are slightly soft, about 5 minutes.', 'Stir vegetable stock, thyme, ground nutmeg, and ground sumac into the carrots; cover pan, reduce heat to low, and cook and stir until most of the liquid has disappeared, about 15 minutes.', 'Remove pan from heat and garnish carrots with rosemary, sage, salt, and white pepper.']
MHPR_Review: 4.25.18 The one thing that I always buy organic is carrots, never buy baby carrots. That being said, I diagonally cut my carrots into chunks and with the small amount of liquid called for in this recipe, I had concerns about whether or not the carrots would cook before the vegetable stock cooked out. So I did give them a bit of a head start by steaming them in the microwave for a couple minutes. I did not have fresh sage (that‚Äôs one herb I don‚Äôt grow), so I used dried and stirred it into the carrots along with the salt and a fresh grind of pepper, rather than using those three ingredients as a garnish. Very flavorful and savory side dish to pork roast, mashed potatoes and gravy.
Review_0: I added my own touches - a chopped potato and curry, cayenne, cumin and turmeric instead of the spices in the original recipe. Very yummy!
Review_1: 4.25.18 The one thing that I always buy organic is carrots, never buy baby carrots. That being said, I diagonally cut my carrots into chunks and with the small amount of liquid called for in this recipe, I had concerns about whether or not the carrots would cook before the vegetable stock cooked out. So I did give them a bit of a head start by steaming them in the microwave for a couple minutes. I did not have fresh sage (that‚Äôs one herb I don‚Äôt grow), so I used dried and stirred it into the carrots along with the salt and a fresh grind of pepper, rather than using those three ingredients as a garnish. Very flavorful and savory side dish to pork roast, mashed potatoes and gravy.
Review_2: I did not have baby carrots so I just sliced some carrots up. I really like the tart flavor sumac adds but I don't think the nutmeg added anything to the recipe. Next time I will just leave it out. If you want a change from your everyday boring carrots try this one!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 3 mins', 'Total Time: 13 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 pancakes']
Ingredients: ['¬æ cup milk', '¬æ cup all-purpose flour', '1 egg', '¬Ω cup scallions', '2 tablespoons water', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '¬Ω teaspoon salt', '¬º teaspoon ground ginger', '2 teaspoons sesame oil']
Directions: ['Combine milk, flour, egg, scallions, water, baking powder, salt, and ground ginger in a bowl. Mix until batter is smooth.', 'Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. I really liked the addition of sesame oil in these. It made a world of difference in overall flavor. Great recipe!
Review_0: its not flaky, but it is delicious.
Review_1: nothing special
Review_2: The flavor is alright but it just isn't the same. It doesn't have the flaky layers that make it delicious. I'll be taking the time to learn The long, traditional way to make scallion pancakes.
Review_3: Super easy and tasty!
Review_4: Quick. Easy. Unexpectedly delicious. Thank you!
Review_5: my daughter loved this! and now i save lots of money because i dont have to get them from the market!
Review_6: These turned out really good. The batter seemed a little loose and I was worried but it worked like a champ. I used fresh ginger instead of powder but that is the only change I made. I really liked the addition of sesame oil in these. It made a world of difference in overall flavor. Great recipe!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 30 mins', 'Total Time: 45 mins', 'Servings: 9', 'Yield: 8 to 10 servings']
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground beef', '8 (6 inch) corn tortillas', '1 small onion, diced', '1 pound processed cheese food, shredded', '1 (4 ounce) can green chile peppers, chopped', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup', '¬Ω cup milk']
Directions: ['Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a medium sized casserole dish.', 'In a medium skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef until evenly browned; drain fat.', 'Place half of the tortillas on the bottom of the prepared casserole dish and spread with half of the onion, cheese, ground beef and chiles. Layer with the remaining tortillas, onion, half of the remaining cheese, ground beef and chiles.', 'In a medium bowl, dilute the soup with milk and pour over the top of the casserole. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese and bake for another 5 to 10 minutes, or until the cheese has melted.']
MHPR_Review: Really enjoyed! Just made changes based on others' suggestions and also for fat/calorie content: used nonstick cooking spray on a 9x13" pan, used only 4 taco-sized flour tortillas, added taco seasoning packet for beef & then mixed in onions and chilis, which saves time assembling, doubled the chilis (used two 4oz cans), used only about 3c sargento shredded reduced fat mexican cheese, used campbells healthy req cream of chicken soup, and also served w/LF sour cream, tomatoes, and lettuce- fantastic! :)
Review_0: loved it
Review_1: I would buy pre-cut onions and use shredded cheese, velvetta or the off brand is too messy when shredding!Other than that. Easy Peasy!Still using the old CorningWare!
Review_2: Really tasted so good. Family loved it. It‚Äôs a keeper!!
Review_3: I loved it! I used one can of mild green chiles, and one hot (mixed them together). Just salt and peppered the meat, and used colby/jack shredded cheese. Making it for a second time tomorrow night!! Top it with a dollop of sour cream and voila!!
Review_4: Made it twice, the first time it was VERY bland (do people not season their food anymore?). Made it a 2nd time & seasoned my meat with fresh garlic, ground cumin, & smoked paprika. Both times I also did not use Velveta cheese (gross), I used fresh grated extra sharp cheddar cheese.
Review_5: Fabulous tasting recipe! My husband kept taking tastes out of the serving pan after dinner was served. I followed the directions except for adding a bag of Trader Joe's frozen Mexican Corn. I spread one layer all over and finished it off with the cheese and cream of chicken soup. Will definitely make this again!!!
Review_6: It was a little bit dry, and I didn't add enough red pepper flakes. But we loved the casserole! The only thing I changed was the beans, I used Pinto beans instead of Kidney. Just a personal preference. I will make this again and add a packet of taco seasoning and a little water and tomato sauce.
Review_7: It was great. The only thing I did different was chicken rather than beef. Everyone loved it. So easy.
Review_8: I stuck to the recipe and just added some minced garlic and a little red cayenne pepper flakes for some extra heat...It turned out well üëçüòãüòé

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 2 mins', 'Cook Time: 35 mins', 'Total Time: 37 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['1 (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn, with liquid', '¬º cup white sugar']
Directions: ["Pour the corn and liquid into a medium saucepan, and stir in sugar. Bring to a boil, then cook over medium heat so that the mixture is only simmering, not boiling. Simmer, stirring often, until the liquid has dried up, and corn is coated, about 20 to 30 minutes. Be patient and don't let it get too hot, or the corn will have a harder texture. Serve this right away and enjoy!"]
MHPR_Review: Only took me about 20 minutes. The kids who don't usually care much for corn loved it. I will be making this a regular.
Review_0: As written I am giving this a 3. Read the reviews and if you cut the sugar in half you will have 4 stars. Add some herbs and butter and you have a 5 star.
Review_1: Only took me about 20 minutes. The kids who don't usually care much for corn loved it. I will be making this a regular.
Review_2: We always cook our corn this way.I do add butter and pepper also. I always bring it to a full boil and let it cook down till the other food is ready. I don't think my family would eat it any other way.LOL
Review_3: It took over an hour for the liquid to evaporate. The corn was very sweet, too sweet for a vegetable dish. A waste of time and a waste of electricity to simmer this for over an hour! Won't make it again!!
Review_4: Not worth the effort and a waste of sugar.
Review_5: I followed the directions exactly, and it was over an hour before the liquid evaporated. The finished result was just an extremely sweet-flavored corn.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 14 mins', 'Additional Time: 30 mins', 'Total Time: 54 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['1 lime, juiced', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can light colored beer', '1 teaspoon honey', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', 'Salt and pepper', '4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves']
Directions: ['In a bowl, mix the lime juice, beer, honey, garlic, cilantro, and salt and pepper until the honey dissolves. Pour the mixture over the chicken, cover and marinate for 30 minutes.', 'Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil grate.', 'Remove chicken from marinade and shake off excess; discard remaining marinade. Grill chicken until tender and juices run clear, about 7 minutes per side.']
MHPR_Review: After reading the reviews for this recipe and seeing some say it was bland I made a couple changes. I zested the lime then juiced it. added 1 Tablespoon honey,I added 1/2 teaspoon of ground coriander instead of the cilantro as it is the seed of the cilantro and has about the same taste and mixes into the marinade easier. Chicken breast would be fine but I used thighs. This was great !
Review_0: This was very good and super easy. I used 2 large chicken breasts cut in half to make 4 decent size servings. Added those to the same amounts of "marinade mix" that the recipe called for. I let them marinade for several hours up to over night when possible before grilling. Great flavor and the beer kept the meat tender and moist.
Review_1: Let it marinate for more than the 30 minutes called for, used twice the lime and garlic called for. We tasted...nothing. I'm glad I didn't waste a beer that I actually like.
Review_2: This one just didn‚Äôt do it for me. I used fresh ingredients, followed the recipe exactly, and it came out looking just like the picture. But it was bland‚Äîother than a hint of cilantro, the flavors didn‚Äôt come through.
Review_3: It was pretty bland and a bit too much lime flavor for us.
Review_4: This recipe definitely needs more than just ‚Äòa pinch‚Äô of salt and pepper, otherwise the rest of the ingredients are lost. Please salt and pepper your chicken as you regularly do! You should taste the salt in the marinade. I also added a tbsp of fresh coriander in addition to the cilantro.
Review_5: I usually slice up the chicken into 1-2 cm strips before marinating for a couple of hours, otherwise the inside of the chicken doesn't see the light of day or marinade. It then BBQ's faster, so you need higher heat (flash fry) if you want grill marks. And as others say, it is a very mild marinade. Adding lime zest would help (as someone mentioned).
Review_6: Did not make any changes. Will not make it again. The beer flavor was too overwhelming and I didn't even use a whole can.
Review_7: I loved this recipe. I don't have a grill so I baked the chicken in my oven at 350¬∞ for 30mins. It turned out great. Very juicy with lots of flavor.
Review_8: turned out great - tender, juicy and wonderful hint of lime flavor...

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 10 mins', 'Total Time: 15 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil', '1 tablespoon butter', '2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', '2 cups diagonally sliced fresh green beans', '1 teaspoon lemon zest', '1 pinch garlic salt to taste', '1 pinch ground black pepper to taste']
Directions: ['Heat the olive oil, butter and lemon juice in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the green beans, lemon zest, garlic salt and pepper. Cook and stir for about 10 minutes, or until beans are tender, but still a little crunchy.']
MHPR_Review: These are pretty good. I love lemon, but I still left out the zest. I used about six cups of green beans and they were still a little greasy for me. I make what we call green fries which is very similar to this. I use uncut long green beans, placed in a baking dish single layer then sprayed with olive oil cooking spray and sprinkled with course ground salt and fresh cracked black pepper. Then I bake them at 400 for about 20 min. As I remove them from the oven I squeeze fresh lemon over the green beans and toss. This is still a good recipe for a change up every now and then. Green beans are my favorite vege (I could eat them every day), so its great to have a bunch of recipes for them.
Review_0: Loved the flavor of this dish. I reduced the lemon juice a tad, and had no zest. This was perfect with za'atar chicken thighs also on AllRecipes. A nice alternative to bacon and green beans.
Review_1: Delicious and easy!
Review_2: It's a nice, easy, and fast side dish. Boyfriend gobbles this up anytime I make it. I don't normally like green beans but these were pretty tasty. C:
Review_3: Great receipes that got my veggie hating partner to eat veggies. I did not have lemons so I used freash limes and instead of garlic salt i used a few cloves of minced garlic at the olive oil step. I also followed the advice of a reviewer andtopped the green beans with toasted seasame seeds.
Review_4: Delicious! Made recipe as stated and loved them. Going to a family reunion soon and cant wait to introduce them to the family.
Review_5: Green beans can be so boring and this recipe gives them such a nice flavor. I sprinkled a liberal dose of sesame seeds over top when I was finished sauteeing them.
Review_6: I leave out all the lemon and ad fresh garlic. I also use about the same amount of butter as oil. Everyone loved it, the time is right. I also used fresh cracked black pepper.
Review_7: I wasnt wowed but my husband was. He cleaned up any trace, so I will make them again. Thank you for sharing.
Review_8: Left out the lemon zest and thought they were plenty "lemony". Also used fresh garlic in place of garlic salt. Cut down on the oil and butter a bit too. Will make again.

Basic_Info: ['Servings: 7', 'Yield: 6 to 8 - servings']
Ingredients: ['2 (15 ounce) cans green beans', '1 cube beef bouillon cube', '1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 teaspoon soy sauce', '1 tablespoon butter', '‚Öõ teaspoon garlic pepper seasoning']
Directions: ['Drain the green beans, reserving 1/2 of the liquid. Dissolve the bouillon cube in the reserved liquid.', 'Place green beans and liquid in a saucepan. Add Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, butter or margarine and garlic pepper seasoning to taste. Simmer gently for 15 minutes.', 'Remove to serving bowl leaving beans sitting in their liquid. Use a slotted spoon to serve.']
MHPR_Review: My husband and I love this recipe. We have had them many many times for dinner so far and they have been great and tasty. The second time I added Real Bacon Bits and it went very well with the recipe. Now we don't ever have regular green beans anymore and we've gotten so use to making the recipe that we make it without measuring anything. My husband made these for Thanksgivings and our guests also loved them. This recipe has become a regular in our house.
Review_0: Great change to a favorite dish.
Review_1: This is now my go-to recipe for green beans!! Love it!
Review_2: I have a small family so I only used 1 can. I did not drain any liquid, instead I used all liquid and added 1 tbsp of soy sauce rather than 1 tsp. This was absolutely delicious. My kids even loved it and they are picky eaters. Thanx for this recipe.
Review_3: So easy and really tasty. I love green beans and will certainly use this recipie again. May sound funny, but just like the cafeteria. Next time I'll add a little chopped onion.
Review_4: So good! I was really in need of a way to add flavor to canned green beans, and was burned out on the old bacon and onions stand by. Thanks for a great recipe!
Review_5: good and simple.
Review_6: I really did like this recipe. As other reviewers have said, it was a little subtle but still very delicious. I will add some bacon fat the next time I make this.
Review_7: I use this recipe when I‚Äôm low on groceries. It almost fools your buds into thinking there is either bacon somewhere, or, a little bit of smokiness. I don‚Äôt fix this often but when I do it will fit the veggie space.
Review_8: No beef bullion so subbed a few slices of bacon and left our the butter. Delicious! A good solid flavor that complements the main dish without overwhelming it.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 1 mins', 'Cook Time: 4 mins', 'Total Time: 5 mins', 'Servings: 1', 'Yield: 1 sandwich']
Ingredients: ['1 egg', '1 tablespoon milk', '2 slices white bread', '1 pinch salt and pepper to taste', '1 slice American cheese']
Directions: ['Crack the egg into a microwave-safe cereal bowl and whisk in the milk. Season with salt and pepper. Cook in the microwave on 100% power for 1 to 2 minutes, or until cooked through.', 'While the egg is cooking, toast the bread. Use a spoon to remove the cooked egg from the bowl and set it on one piece of toast. Top with a slice of cheese and the other piece of toast. Cook in the microwave until cheese is melted, about 15 seconds.']
MHPR_Review: Oh, the incredible edible egg! Don't be afraid to microwave the egg, it really is good. If you spray the bowl with some Pam first, the egg will slide right out and you won't have that cooked on egg that is impossible to scrub off your dishes. I only microwave one egg at about 45 seconds and then top it with cheese and microwave it for the last 15 seconds. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and viola. This is so versatile too. You can add bacon, sausage, ham, tomato, etc. And you can use any bread you have (sandwich, hamburger roll, English muffin, croissant, etc.) and it turns out great every time! So easy a man, I mean the kids could do it!
Review_0: Fast easy breakfast. Added green onion and bacon crumble to egg plus a slice of tomato after melting cheese
Review_1: So Good! I added bacon and ham, and it tasted like homeade Jack in The Box sandwiches! just wrap 2 pieces of bacon in 2 paper towels and microwave for 1 to 3 minutes. Highly recommended!
Review_2: It's very tasty. I really liked it. Used swirled rye bread for the toast. Super yummy!
Review_3: Delicious! Used white American cheese.
Review_4: Great but I made a few changes. I used liquid egg white from a carton and cooked them in a skillet. Then i added sauteed to the pepper, onion, and ham and folded them in. I skipped the cheese and the toast and served it on a plate. With Tabasco.
Review_5: This is the easiest and quickest way for a great meal. Love the ease and cleanup is a snap.
Review_6: Terrible. Microwaves are deadly with eggs. This one tasted like plastic,even with better cheese (cheddar). American cheese isn't even real cheese
Review_7: Here is a great variation - first, crack the egg into a small oiled bowl. Pierce the yolk one time with a fork. Place in microwave for 30 seconds at power 8 with a cover over the bowl. You will wind up with a microwave sunny side up egg! (Microwaves vary in power, so experiment with different cooking times and levels.)
Review_8: Add a few spices and any cheese except American and it will be delicious. I‚Äôd toast the bread, then put cheese on and lightly toast again. Then you don‚Äôt have to use the microwave on the bread.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 10 mins', 'Total Time: 20 mins', 'Servings: 6', 'Yield: 6 sandwiches']
Ingredients: ['3 cups prepared au jus sauce', '2 pounds thinly sliced roast beef', '6 Kaiser rolls, split', '2 teaspoons coarse kosher salt', '2 teaspoons caraway seeds', '¬º cup prepared horseradish']
Directions: ['Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).', 'Place rolls onto a baking sheet with the cut sides down. Brush roll tops lightly with water, then sprinkle salt and caraway seeds over top.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until toasted, about 10 minutes.', 'While the rolls are toasting, warm au jus sauce in a saucepan over medium heat, 3 to 5 minutes. Add roast beef and cook until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes.', 'Remove rolls from the oven and transfer to serving plates. Top with warm beef and au jus sauce. Serve horseradish on the side.']
MHPR_Review: Almost perfect! I worked in a restaurant known for their beef on weck and the trick is to dip the cut rolls in the au jus just a bit before serving so its not so messy.
Review_1: Delicious!! A Buffalo tradition. GO BILLS!
Review_2: Hubby is from B'flo and he loves this!
Review_3: DO NOT cook the wafer/thin sliced beef for 10 minutes on medium while the rolls are in the oven - this will overcook the meat. As others have stated, use tongs to dip the beef in the hot au jus for 15 seconds, plate it on the bottom half of the roll, dip the top half in the au jus, and set it on top of the beef. Guests can add their own horseradish.
Review_4: An excellent make at home recipe for a Buffalo tradition! I especially appreciated the hack for creating a kimmelweck roll since you just cannot get them here in the south. Delicious meal following a Bills win!!
Review_5: I lived just outside of Buffalo, NY for 20 years. This was always my favorite sandwich. This recipe was perfect. Since you can't find weck rolls in Seattle, this recipe showed me how to make them. And as for the roast beef, getting it thinly sliced is important. That contributes to its tenderness. I am so happy to have a taste of home! Yum!
Review_6: Looks pretty Good. My favorite restaurant in Western NY makes it with thinly sliced Prime rib and German potato salad on the side and I have substituted both here.
Review_7: like I remember Bay-Lo's Bar & Grill beef on weck ( Bailey @ Lovejoy in Buffalo , New York ) ... they would marinate the beef ribeye slices in their own juices, put 'em hot on a D & L Bakery kummelweck roll and add a dollop of horseradish on top !!! ... with a draft beer, some kinda good !!!
Review_8: I used cornstarch and water to brush on the hard roll and then sprinkle with Pretzel salt and caraway seeds. Then bake in the oven at 275 degrees F for maybe 10 minutes just until the egg white is dried and shiny or the cornstarch is dried. I dip the cut side of the top roll very slightly into the au jus and I am thinking that you want the beef pink so you do not want to cook it all in the au jus. I love that I can make this sandwich in my PA kitchen, even if the restaurants only offer Cheesesteaks. I takes me home with every bite. Thanks for posting!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 10 mins', 'Total Time: 15 mins', 'Servings: 4']
Ingredients: ['2 teaspoons butter', '4 large eggs', '4 slices processed American cheese', '8 slices toasted white bread', 'salt and pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons mayonnaise', '2 tablespoons ketchup']
Directions: ['Melt butter over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Crack eggs into the pan and cook to desired firmness. Just before eggs are cooked, place a slice of cheese over each egg; continue to cook until cheese has melted.', 'Transfer each egg to a toasted slice of bread. Season eggs with salt and pepper. Spread mayonnaise and ketchup on remaining slices of bread and cover eggs with bread to make 4 sandwiches. Serve warm.']
MHPR_Review: I changed this up a little. My ingredients are as follows: Fried egg Toasted rye bread Extra sharp white cheddar cheese Bacon (tasty addition) Mayo (no ketchup) I would have liked to add tomato and onion if I had it. Traditional is good too though the way I made them before was just with egg and mayo.
Review_0: First sandwich I ever cooked myself 30 years ago and still cook it routinely. I like to use Kraft singles preferably and I only use ketchup or sometimes hot sauce if I do a scrambled egg sammy
Review_1: How is a fried egg sandwich not fried? A proper fried egg sandwich has a broken yolk, fried on both sides & is not runny. It cooks faster too.
Review_2: It's very good! I used provolone cheese and sourdough bread because that's what I had, and I added bacon. I decided (like others) that I don't like the catsup on it - but I'll be making it again without catsup in the future.
Review_3: Well I like this recipe! When I used to make these I would make the eggs a little gooey in the center and I'd add bacon and sometimes tomato and lettuce. Making it the full meal deal! Yummy!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 10 mins', 'Total Time: 15 mins', 'Servings: 2', 'Yield: 2 servings']
Ingredients: ['3 ¬Ω cups vegetable broth', '1 (3.5 ounce) package ramen noodles with dried vegetables', '2 teaspoons soy sauce', '¬Ω teaspoon chili oil', '¬Ω teaspoon minced fresh ginger root', '1 teaspoon sesame oil', '2 green onions, sliced']
Directions: ['In a medium saucepan combine broth and noodles. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat; stir to break up noodles. Reduce heat to medium and add soy sauce, chili oil and ginger. Simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Stir in sesame oil and garnish with green onions.']
MHPR_Review: I loved this recipe - the only reason I did not give it five stars was the inconsistency with the ingredient list. The list names chili oil, but not sesame oil. The directions include the use of sesame oil, but do not specify how much. This dish could turn bad if you add too much. However, overall very east and fast for a weeknight dinner. It is just as delicious using a different flavor of ramen noodles also.
Review_0: I added a little cayenne pepper and use a little sugar to balance out the flavors. My husband loved it! Also, I marinated some soft-boiled eggs to top it off with and diced green onions delicious!
Review_1: it was okay i added salt and garlic to my taste because it did not have enough flavor
Review_2: I love this recipe! I did use homemade chicken broth instead of vegetable broth. Super easy and fun.
Review_3: delicious, quick and easy and simple!! and i know i'm saying this like, more than 15 years after it was made... but its still awesome! only con is that the flavouring from the broth is quite strong :/ quick and easy solution is to do less broth. but i dont do that lol ( haha )
Review_4: Delicious! Just the right amount of spice, could maybe use a smidge more soy sauce.
Review_5: 4.29.21 I thought I had some chili oil on hand, but didn‚Äôt, so I gave it a shot of sriracha. We like ramen, this is a nice way to style it up a bit, and enjoyed this for lunch today.
Review_6: We made it but added bokchoy and left over pork loin. also we put sweet chili sauce instead of chili oil.
Review_7: I used a combination of 3 different recipes for this one. I used this suggested recipe for the broth, but then also added 4oz of butter, about 1/8 cup of soy sauce, about 1tablespoon of tonkatsu sauce, and then chili oil and Da Bomb spice (1/8teaspoon). Added pork belly based off of 2 other recipes, which ended up with the following steps: boil pork belly for 15 minutes. Then saut√© the pork in a sauce pan with sesame oil, soy sauce, brown sugar, water, ginger, garlic, basil and sage. Finish with corn, green onions and an egg! Yummmm!!!
Review_8: Added chopped garlic.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 5 mins', 'Additional Time: 2 hrs', 'Total Time: 2 hrs 10 mins', 'Servings: 24', 'Yield: 24 squares']
Ingredients: ['1 (12 ounce) package semisweet chocolate chips', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '2 ¬Ω cups dry-roasted peanuts', '1 (16 ounce) package miniature marshmallows']
Directions: ['Line a 9x13-inch pan with waxed paper.', 'Heat chocolate chips and butter in a microwave-safe bowl in 30-second increments, stirring occasionally, until melted and smooth. Stir in condensed milk.', 'Mix peanuts and mini marshmallows together in a separate bowl; gradually stir into chocolate mixture until incorporated. Pour into the prepared pan.', 'Refrigerate until firm, about 2 hours. Cut into 24 squares.']
MHPR_Review: This recipe was fantastic. Everyone who tried it had said it was great. It is such a quick and easy recipe. I used a 10 1/2 ounce bag instead of a 16 ounce bag of marshmallows.
Review_0: This is a favorite in our house hold. Especially at the holidays. I make it for my oldest daughter even for a birthday present. One of the best and easiest recipes I've ever made.
Review_1: I love Rocky Road, but this was way too sweet. So I substituted 8 ounces of unsweetened Bakers chocolate and 4 ounces of semi-sweet chips instead of the 12 oz of chips. That cut the sweetness perfectly! I also used some fun pink and white marshmallows and almonds instead of peanuts. Delicious and very pretty!
Review_2: Too many marshmallows!
Review_3: I made exactly as the recipe called for but I held back about a cup of the Mini marshmallows. Only because my grandson is coming and he likes peanut butter and marshmallow sandwiches. I accidentally bought plain salted peanuts instead of dry roasted but I don‚Äôt think it made a difference. They are still great.
Review_4: Equals 1.5 cups of chocolate chips
Review_5: I haven't made fudge in a long time because I remember beating and beating and then not having it harden. Well this turned out perfect without all the beating. I used lightly salted roasted peanuts as I didn't find unsalted in the store. The salt was a nice counterpoint to the sweetness. I used fewer marshmallows - maybe a cup less because it was looking to marshmallowy. Highly recommend!!
Review_6: First, half the amount of marshmallows and i more peanuts (I used organic roasted). Also best to use a greased glass Pyrex instead the wax paper which sticks!
Review_7: I just made it. Haven't tried it yet, but sure it will taste good. I would probably use half of a 10oz bag of marshmallows. 16ox is way too much and found that even the 10oz bag is too much. Will maybe 8oz tops. Would prefer more chocolate then marshmallows. It's more like lightly coated chocolate marshmallows. Also didn't do the peanuts
Review_8: I have been making Rocky Road Fudge for over 30 years. It's the only fudge I make. I use 18oz of Hershey's Special Dark chocolate chips, one can sweetened condensed milk, 1 T. butter and 1 tsp vanilla extract. Along with 1/2 cup chopped pecans and 2+ cups mini marshmallows.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 15 mins', 'Total Time: 25 mins', 'Servings: 9']
Ingredients: ['18 slices bread', '4 tablespoons butter, or as needed', '9 slices Cheddar cheese']
Directions: ['Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).', 'Butter one side of 9 slices of bread, and place butter-side down on a baking sheet. Arrange cheese on each slice of bread. Spread butter on 9 remaining slices of bread, and place them buttered-side up on top of the cheese.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 6 to 8 minutes. Flip the sandwiches, and bake an additional 6 to 8 minutes, or until golden brown.']
MHPR_Review: Okay, I felt silly looking at a recipe for grilled cheese sandwiches, but I am glad I did. I also felt silly on how long it took me to get this right, LOL. I did not know that the sandwich would cook on the bottom first. So, the first time I cooked them, I kept waiting for the top to turn golden brown, so the bottom burnt. The second time I flipped them when the bottom was cooked, and cooked the other side for the same amount of time. So, the bottom burned. The third time was a charm :-) I flipped when the bottom was done and checked the sandwiches after 2-3 additional minutes. Perfect!! The total cooking time is 6-8 minutes. If you cook the total time that the recipe says, you might end up with burned bread as I did. These are great. Can make many many at a time and they are not greasy. So, I am slow at learning, but these are great!! Thanks for the recipe!! I will repeat many times!!!
Review_0: Fast and easy! A little on the crunchy side with the crust but it's good after all. I couldn't have had it turn out this good pan frying it lololol. Definitely my new way to make. I bet if you added ham or even bologna it would be great as well. Thanks for the recipe.
Review_1: I made a half sandwich with whole wheat bread and 1 slice of Swiss cheese for myself. I buttered it and toasted it in the toaster oven. I was able to watch it for browning and flip it over when toasted. It made a tasty toasted sandwich. I am not a fan of grilled cheese sandwiches because they just taste too greasy so this suited me. If I ever do it again, I may add some mustard on one half of the bread.
Review_2: Definitely shorten the time you keep them in. I only kept them in for 6 minutes each side and they are black
Review_3: I found this recipe years ago and have been using it ever since. I swap for sliced sourdough and havarti cheese. Perfect recipe to pair with soup!
Review_4: I followed the recipe exactly and I checked on the sandwiches after 5 minutes, they were starting to get too dark, so I turned them over and set the timer for another 3 minutes. The sandwiches were a nice golden brown, but very dry. I will try this recipe again but maybe not at 450 degrees.
Review_5: Amazing! The only easy I make grilled cheese sandwiches anymore.
Review_6: This is how college dining hall did it. So tasty and a less greasy feel, crunchier texture.
Review_7: Super easy way to make grilled cheese for a family. The kids think it‚Äôs gourmet cooking if I add cream of tomato soup. Never thought to put them in the oven!
Review_8: Awesome! Quick recipe to get multiple sandwiches made at one time. Can customize to your taste with different cheese or a tomato.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 10 mins', 'Total Time: 20 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 sandwiches']
Ingredients: ['2 green onions, chopped', '¬º cup mayonnaise', '2 tablespoons salsa', '8 slices sourdough bread', '¬Ω pound deli-sliced turkey', '4 slices pepper Jack cheese', '4 tablespoons butter']
Directions: ['Mix together green onions, mayonnaise, and salsa in a small bowl until well combined; spread over each bread slice. Layer turkey and pepper Jack cheese on 4 bread slices. Top with remaining bread slices to make 4 sandwiches.', 'Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry sandwiches in hot butter until bottoms are lightly toasted. Add remaining butter to the skillet, then flip sandwiches over. Cook until browned on the other side and cheese is melted.']
MHPR_Review: This sandwich was dinner for the kids with homemade tomato soup. I followed the recipe closely, only scaling the recipe back to two sandwiches, I used whole wheat bread and I cooked the sandwiches in my cast iron skillet. I was a little concerned that the kids wouldn't like them but they both thought this was the best sandwich EVER. They both asked for seconds.
Review_0: Excellent!! Nice twist to a standard turkey sandwich! The only thing I would change next time would be to slightly butter the bread that will be face down on the pan vs melting butter and trying to cook in that. I think you will get a more consistent grilled result. But! We devoured! Delicious! Perfect lunch or with a bowl of soup! Thanks Mom22GreatKids!!
Review_1: It's a keeper
Review_2: I made it nearly exactly as described (only subbed regular white sandwich bread instead of sourdough) and it was delicious. My mind started reeling with how you could amp up the mayo spread even more, adding chopped jalapeno or cilantro, hot sauce, etc. You can really tailor this one to you.
Review_3: I made these tonight for dinner and that's are the best sandwiches I've ever eaten. I would definitely make these again so easy to do.
Review_4: amazing
Review_5: I decided to do something different for dinner and this was PERFECT!! That sauce makes a huge difference!! Will definitely be making again!!
Review_6: I added thinly sliced tomatoes. Thanks for a simple, easy recipe that‚Äôs very good!
Review_7: This was a nice change. I used wheat bread and muenster cheese, cause that's what I had on hand.
Review_8: ON POINT!!!! that is all.

Recipe_Name: Rich Pasta for the Poor Kitchen
Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 15 mins', 'Total Time: 25 mins', 'Servings: 4']
Ingredients: ['1 (8 ounce) package dry spaghetti', '8 tablespoons butter', '2 tablespoons minced garlic', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste (optional)', '1 cup grated Parmesan cheese']
Directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until al dente, 8 to 10 minutes; drain.', 'Meanwhile, heat a skillet over medium-low heat. Melt butter with garlic very slowly to avoid burning the garlic. Season with parsley, salt, black pepper, and cayenne.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Add cooked pasta to the skillet and toss until well coated with butter. Increase the heat to medium and cook until pasta is heated through and has absorbed some of the butter. Adjust seasonings if necessary.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Serve with grated Parmesan cheese.', 'You can add summer vine-ripened tomatoes for an extra dash of flavor.']
MHPR_Review: This is a very good recipe I found after seeing something similar on tv. To simplify it further, you can cook your noodles, drain them and reserve a little bit of the noodle water in your final serving dish. To that water add your butter, spices, and the refrigerated garlic. Now mix in the still hot pasta and your leafy green thing of choice (I use either a little raw basil or a lot of raw spinach depending) into the buttery mix. The leaves wilt and the butter melts and you can toss it in its final serving dish. Cheese can go in now, or later on the side at the table (I use asiago, a little goes a long way and it keeps forever).
Review_0: I've made this before (prior to finding this recipe). It's good, tasty and filling but I recently discovered that pouring a little heavy cream in with the butter and parmesan helps to "de-clump" the parmesan and turn the sauce into a true Alfredo sauce. I made this several weeks ago "on-the-fly" with hot elbow macaroni, a lot of butter, garlic (powder) and a splash or three of heavy cream (all by eye/taste, no measuring), directly over the hot drained macaroni and then added salt & fresh ground black pepper for a filling flavorful dinner.
Review_1: It needed more cheese. We put 6 tbsp instead of 8 of butter. Used dry parsley instead of fresh. It tastes good.
Review_2: I think it was very good almost luke noodles and company!!
Review_3: I made for 2; more fresh parsley than called for. Other than that and topped with bacon bits (Hubby request) and fresh basil sprinkled on top is PERFECT as written, will make this again and again!
Review_4: Yes, this may just be ‚Äúbuttered noodles‚Äù - which I too have been making since I was 13, but I never followed this cooking method or added/saut√©d fresh garlic, cayenne and parsley. I also, back then, only used green bottle Parmesan and not fresh grated Parmesan like I did tonight. I thought this was really nice - especially when in a time pinch. I could also see this make an appearance on my table as a complimentary side dish. Will make again. Thanks Vampyrelady!
Review_5: I didn't have any pasta sauce so this was perfect! I didn't use the parsley but I added one chopped roma tomato that I sauteed. It was really good! The cayenne papper gives it a good taste üëç
Review_6: Made it for two and was fantastic. I guess if you wish you can give it a kick by adding a bit of lemon juice and grated lemon rind for a lemon twist. Will make it again; however, next time, I will use the best salted butter I can find.
Review_7: Add fresh squeezed lemon for some tang. Yummy.
Review_8: this was really good! my entire family loved it!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 5 mins', 'Total Time: 10 mins', 'Servings: 4']
Ingredients: ['¬Ω cup white sugar', '‚Öì cup unsweetened cocoa powder', '3 tablespoons cornstarch', '2 cups milk', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract']
Directions: ['Whisk together sugar, cocoa, and cornstarch in a microwave-safe bowl. Whisk in milk, a little at a time, until no dry lumps remain.', 'Cook in the microwave on high for 3 minutes. Stir well. Continue cooking and stirring at 1-minute intervals until shiny and thick, 2 to 4 minutes. Mix in vanilla.', 'Press a piece of plastic wrap directly on surface of pudding to prevent skin from forming. Place in the refrigerator to chill. Serve cold.']
MHPR_Review: We have made a correction to this recipe. It should be 3 tablespoons cornstarch, not 3 teaspoons.
Review_0: Tastes great. My kids dip there cookies into it.
Review_1: Super easy. Easier than instant from a box. Great quick treat.
Review_2: I made this on the stove in a nonstick pan whisking continuously on medium high heat until it boiled and thickened. I covered it and served it warm after 40 minutes in the fridge. We loved it and I will definitely make it again. It would be great served warm (or cold) over vanilla ice cream. BEL
Review_3: Cooking this pudding simply made a mess and the pudding itself became lumpy. I only cooked for the first 3 minutes and it got overcooked. I'm assuming it's because my microwave is too powerful, but the recipe itself lacks information on the cooking process.
Review_4: Tastes great! Add some fresh fruit and that will balance it out
Review_5: This is the second time I make this pudding. It is so easy to make and deliciously chocolate. My kids and friends all loved it. I did not use the microwave, instead cooked it on the stove. Thank you!
Review_6: This recipe delivers what it promises: quick dessert that you don't need a stove top to make. Following this recipe to the letter, you will get a 3 or 4 star result for taste and texture. For silkier texture, mix in 1 or 2 tablespoons of butter. For a more intense chocolaty taste, stir in a small handful of Ghiradelli bittersweet chocolate chips.
Review_7: How could this recipe not be a 5? I, a mediocre cook (giving myself the benefit of the doubt) have made it at least 4 times now and it has always, without any stress, performed & turned out exactly as described. One time I added bananas as suggested. Fine. One time I forgot the vanilla extract. Fine. This is not the greatest chocolate pudding In the world, but in terms of delivering on promise (time involved, ease of handling, taste) this recipe can not be topped. (And talking about topped, you can do that too, with a little cream poured over.)
Review_8: I've made this off and on for years. Very good. Very easy. Good warm or cold.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 10 mins', 'Total Time: 25 mins', 'Servings: 16', 'Yield: 16 servings']
Ingredients: ['4 slices bacon', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '1 cup mayonnaise', '8 ounces Swiss cheese, shredded', '2 green onions, finely chopped', '4 buttery round crackers, crushed']
Directions: ['Place bacon in a large skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Drain, crumble, and set aside.', 'In a small bowl, mix the cream cheese with mayonnaise until smooth. Stir in Swiss cheese, onions, and bacon. Place bowl in microwave, and cook 2 minutes. Remove, and stir well. Return to microwave, and cook 2 to 4 minutes more. Sprinkle crushed crackers on top. Serve warm with crackers.']
MHPR_Review: This dip is excellent with a few additions: I used 8oz of shredded cheddar (instead of the swiss), 1 cup of shredded Parmesan cheese, 1/3 cup of mayo, 1tsp of garlic powder, 1tsp of onion and doubled the bacon. I kept the cream cheese, green onions and cracker amont the same. I then baked the dip for 20 minutes at 350. In the last 5 minutes I stirred the mixture and added the Ritz cracker topping. The dip was not oily at all (I think cutting down the mayo and adding the absorptive Parmesan cheese helped) and was delicious!
Review_0: This was very good. I will make it again.
Review_1: We made this for a family Christmas party and it was a major hit!! We put it in a small crock pot and served with bacon flavored Ritz crackers and it was the first thing gone out of all of the dished that were brought by everyone. I am pretty sure that if we had made more it would've been gone too. The recipe itself was simple to make and the directions were perfect. The only thing I did differently was I added an extra 3 pieces of bacon (only because I really love bacon) and one more stock of green onion. We will 100% be making this one again and again,
Review_2: I use this as the base to my Beer Bacon Cheddar dip. I use 3 blend cheddar cheese and I use half cup mayo, half cup sour creame, garlic and onion powder, double the bacon, add a quarter more of cheddar. And Instead of baking it, I make it on a pot on the stove and add a Lagunitas IPA to taste
Review_3: Bacon is always a winner. Mix in cream Cheese, mayo and Swiss and you have something better. Recently, we subbed in Blue Cheese for the Swiss - may have been even better .
Review_4: After reading the reviews I decided to modify the recipe and I used smartina's tips. I made this for a superbowl party and everyone loved it. It was the hit of the party, and gone is ten minutes. I'll definatly make this again.
Review_5: I used the recipes as a base and checked out reviews. Used 1/2 cup mayo and 1/2 cup sour cream. Remnants from fridge: a little gouda, a little swiss, a little cheddar and some cracked black pepper white cheddar. I also added shredded parmesan. I added a little hot sauce, a little garlic, and onion powder. I increased the green onion and added a few artichoke hearts. Doubled the buttery crackers and bacon on top. I also added some pepper jelly on top before the cracker/bacon mixture for some sweetness. I felt I couldn't give it a 5 star because I made so many changes but it was a creamy, taste sensation. Best served on Ritz (bacon flavored) Crisp & Thins.
Review_6: As written 3 stars? I didn't like the idea of so much mayo and there were no spices, we like punchy flavour. Modified for us 5 stars! After reading other reviews I changed the recipe to suit my family's taste. 6 slices of bacon, 1/2c mayo, 1/2 c sour cream, 4 green onions, "old" cheddar cheese, garlic powder, hot sauce, fresh black pepper and some milk to thin it out to the desired consistency. This was DELICIOUS! I think it's a good base recipe but like a lot of recipes, just needs some tweaks to make it perfect for you.
Review_7: Found it to be missing something, rather tasteless. Will try again with additional spicing
Review_8: Used spicy jalape√±o bacon and cheddar cheese as I didn't have Swiss on hand. Guests loved it! This is definitely a keeper! Deb

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 1 mins', 'Cook Time: 2 mins', 'Total Time: 3 mins', 'Servings: 1', 'Yield: 1 serving']
Ingredients: ['1 cup milk', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '¬º teaspoon ground nutmeg']
Directions: ['In a large mug, stir together the milk, vanilla and sugar. Heat in the microwave on full power for 1 minute and 30 seconds. Stir in nutmeg, and serve hot.']
MHPR_Review: Wanted to add that you can tweak the recipe to suit your own taste. I have since started using fat free milk and artificial sweetener. My son made me one with brown sugar and it tasted heavenly. So please feel free to experiment with this to make it your own. Enjoy! I have to give this 5 stars. The combination of flavors is so calm and relaxing. Over the years I have made substitutions like with a sugar substitutes and it is still good. I have been making this for 14+ years and our boys continually ask for it. I know that it seems like a lot of sugar. But it really does work with the combination of flavors. When I made it it was by sheer coincidence that the boys became sleepy after drinking it. I did not have any hot chocolate or tea bags on hand as they had been outside playing in the snow and I just made it for them. They went to bed by themselves after having this. I thought surely not. But yes it does put you in a calm state of mind. I have made it with honey when I did not have sugar on hand. It really is good and it is so relaxing. I hope this will be a family favorite for you as it has become one of our's.
Review_0: This stuff is awesome morning, noon or night. Is great with cinnamon or nutmeg. Our son loves it with ginger for when he has a "yucky" tummy. Thank you, thank you for this great recipe. Have made this many times over.
Review_1: I made 2 cups of this, the first with nutmeg and the second without. I personally prefer the one without, but that may be because I added to much nutmeg
Review_2: It was delicious. I used cinnamon instead of nutmeg and added less sugar. Felt sleepy almost immediately.
Review_3: Made it for my son and I to help my son wind down for the night. I added cinnamon with the nutmeg and I love the taste so does my son. I hope it calms this little ball of energy down soon. Momma wants some her time haha
Review_4: This helped one of my toddlers that had trouble sleeping, get to sleep! They slept well. So delicious that I found myself making some for myself!!!! lol.
Review_5: Absolutely LOVE IT it‚Äôs perfect for me, not too sweet but not bland.
Review_6: No sugar, sugar is Evil. Especially if you are using this as a sleep aid. Works great, but loose the sugar!
Review_7: so delicious. you should definitely try this recipe!! I rate it 5 stars.
Review_8: Daughter loved the taste of it.

Recipe_Name: Grilled Peanut Butter and Banana Sandwich
Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 5 mins', 'Total Time: 10 mins', 'Servings: 1']
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons peanut butter', '2 slices whole wheat bread', '1 medium banana, sliced', 'cooking spray']
Directions: ['Spread 1 tablespoon peanut butter onto one piece of bread and arrange banana slices over top. Spread remaining peanut butter onto second piece of bread, then invert and place over bananas; press firmly.', 'Spray a skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium heat. Place sandwich onto the hot skillet and cook until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes per side.']
MHPR_Review: I made two different types of grilled sandwiches, one with chunky peanut butter and bananas and one with dark chocolate-peanut butter and bananas. I melted a bit of butter in the pan to cook the sandwiches in, which made it easier for me. The kids loved this combo and devoured the sandwiches. Will make this again, but I think next time I might try cream cheese and strawberry preserves, with sliced strawberries for myself.
Review_0: I have added this great sandwich to one my mom made me over 65 years ago. I still make peanut butter and jelly grilled sandwiches.Now it will be tasty to serve both at the same time for lunches. Adding the bananas to the peanut butter is a great idea and so yummy and messy!
Review_1: This is a childhood favorite of mine. I gave this recipe to my sister. No changes to this recipe. I still love it grilled!
Review_2: I lOVE IT
Review_3: Pretty awesome! When putting butter in the pan for grilling, I added some cinnamon. That was the cherry on top! Will try again in the future. God bless!
Review_4: Ive always adored pb&b sandwiches, so the thought of grilling it exited me. I put honey on it, which id reccomend to anyone else, and the 2 min cooking time ended up slightly overcooking the bread, but it wasn't even noticeable. Im not a great cook, but i loved this even when i messed it up, so im looking forward to making it again.
Review_5: The only thing I did different was add mayo, my mother gave this ALOT. It gives the sandwich a little sweeter taste, enjoy
Review_6: Delicious simple and unique
Review_7: Omg this was so good!! I used raisin bread a little but of peanut butter only on one slice half a banana and drizzled some honey on it. I also used butter which just upped it to a whole other level!! Is super amazing and will try it with cream cheese also!
Review_8: Hubby had never had this sandwich so I made one for him today and he was pleasantly surprised at how good it tasted. I made mine with the hazelnut spread, and I would recommend the peanut butter one instead. I'm sure this would appeal to kids.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 5 mins', 'Cook Time: 15 mins', 'Total Time: 20 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 2/3 cup']
Ingredients: ['2 to 3 tablespoons mixed peppercorns', '1/4 cup butter', '1 shallot minced', '1/3 cup brandy or cognac', '3/4 cup beef stock', '1/4 cup heavy cream']
Directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Crush peppercorns slightly using a mortar and pestle or a rolling pin.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Melt butter in a saucepan over medium high heat. Add shallot and saut√© until soft, about 3 minutes.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Add crushed peppercorns and brandy; bring to a boil and simmer rapidly until brandy is almost completely reduced, 2 to 3 minutes.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Add beef stock; bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and simmer until reduced by half, 3 to 4 minutes.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Reduce heat to medium-low; stir in cream and simmer until sauce coats the back of a spoon, or to desired consistency, without letting sauce boil too rapidly, 3 to 4 minutes. Season to taste and serve hot with your favorite steak.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'If your sauce breaks, add a splash of stock and whisk vigorously.', 'If you pan-fry your steak, you can remove the steak from the pan, let it rest, and then make the peppercorn sauce in the same pan. \xa0Just add shallots and butter after removing your steaks, stirring frequently to prevent burning. After adding brandy, stir frequently, scraping up the bits from cooking the steaks. This will add a lot of rich flavor to the peppercorn sauce.', 'If you need to reheat your sauce, add a splash of cream and heat over medium heat, stirring constantly. If kept overnight in the fridge, the sauce may separate and not come back together.']
MHPR_Review: I made this for my husband on Valentine's as this is exactly what he would order in a steakhouse! I did what was suggested in the notes - I cooked the steaks, then made the sauce in the same pan while the steaks rested. So yummy and easy to make! Thanks for this recipe
Review_0: I made this for my husband on Valentine's as this is exactly what he would order in a steakhouse! I did what was suggested in the notes - I cooked the steaks, then made the sauce in the same pan while the steaks rested. So yummy and easy to make! Thanks for this recipe

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 45 mins', 'Cook Time: 15 mins', 'Additional Time: 5 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr 5 mins', 'Servings: 12', 'Yield: 3 balls']
Ingredients: ['¬æ cup cool water, divided', '1/4 teaspoon liquid rennet', '1 ¬Ω teaspoons citric acid', '1 gallon raw milk', '1 teaspoon salt (Optional)']
Directions: ['Combine 1/4 cup water and rennet in a small bowl; mix well.', 'Combine remaining 1/2 cup water and citric acid in another small bowl; mix until dissolved.', 'Pour milk into a large pot set over medium heat. Stir in citric acid mixture.', 'Heat milk, stirring occasionally, until it registers 90 degrees F (32 degrees C) on an instant-read thermometer, about 5 minutes.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Remove milk from heat and stir in rennet mixture in a figure-8 motion for 30 seconds. Stir counterclockwise for 30 seconds to still the milk. Let stand, covered, until milk sets into curd, 5 to 10 minutes. Press edge of curd gently with a palette knife or the back of a spoon to check for firmness.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Slice vertically into the pot to cut curd into 3/4-inch cubes with a palette knife. Stir curds gently, but leave cubes mostly intact.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Return pot to the heat; cook over medium heat, stirring curds gently, until temperature reaches 109 degrees F (43 degrees C), about 5 minutes. Remove from heat.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Ladle curds into a colander set over a large bowl using a slotted spoon. Press curds gently to extract liquid whey. Pour drained whey back into the pot.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Heat whey to 185 degrees F (85 degrees C), about 5 minutes. Wearing gloves, tear off a piece of curd and place on a slotted spoon. Dip curd into hot whey for 5 to 10 seconds. Stretch, fold, and knead curd. Repeat until mozzarella is smooth and elastic. Knead in salt and form curd into a ball. Repeat dipping and kneading process with remaining curd.', 'Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Allow mozzarella to cool. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap and transfer to the refrigerator.', 'Enjoy!', 'DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS', 'Do not use ultra-high temperature processed (UHT) milk. Regular pasteurized milk will work, but raw milk is best.', 'At the end of Step 8, you can place your curds into a plastic bag and store both the curds and the whey in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 days before continuing the process.', "If you want a moist mozzarella with a softer texture, don't let the curd get as firm and work less when stretching and kneading. You can speed up the cooling process in Step 10 by placing mozzarella balls into an ice water bath."]
MHPR_Review: I am giving this four stars because the ingredients and procedure are very similar to how I usually make mozzarella. The problems with the recipe are that there is no measurement for the rennet and it fails to mention when to add the citric acid.
Review_0: Super simple to make. Made with a 4 year old. Taste great.
Review_1: I made no changes. Taste great!
Review_2: Really did not set up. Maybe 1 ball out of it. Followed directions. Why would that be. Mainly cottage cheese
Review_3: I finally did it!!! The curds were a little loose but I worked them and woohoo, Mozarrella Cheese!
Review_4: very good
Review_5: This is easier to make than buying at the grocery store and so much cheaper too
Review_6: I've tried other mozzarella recipes in the past and never been happy with the results. This one came out perfect first try. The process was really fascinating, especially the last step where you work the curds into mozzarella. I did find that for me, it was slightly easier to work the cheese if I raised the temp of the whey to the 190 to 195 degree range. We also had a lot of fun working different seasonings, like haba√±ero salt, into the cheese just before setting it. I'm looking forward to making this again. Thanks for posting it!
Review_7: Interesting fun
Review_8: Good recipe. This was my 2nd mozzarella recipe to try. The first one was a disaster! Not only was this recipe easy to follow , but it was really fun to make. I was ready to make make another batch as soon as I finished the first. - I used the mozzarella in a cabrese salad, I took the leftover whey to make ricotta cheese.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 20 mins', 'Cook Time: 1 hr', 'Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins', 'Servings: 6', 'Yield: 1 1/2 pounds asparagus']
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '4 cloves garlic, sliced thin', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', 'salt to taste', '¬º teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 onion, thinly sliced', '1 ¬Ω pounds asparagus, trimmed']
Directions: ['Place the charcoal into the bottom pan of the smoker. Light the coals and wait for the temperature of the smoker to come to 240 degrees F (115 degrees C).', 'Melt the butter in a small saucepan, stir in the garlic and cook over low heat until just tender. Remove from the heat and mix in the lemon juice, salt, and black pepper.', 'Arrange the onions in the bottom of a large cast iron skillet or heat-resistant glass container. Spread asparagus spears over the onions. Drizzle the butter and garlic mixture over the asparagus. Place the uncovered skillet or baking dish on the top grate of the preheated smoker.', 'Close the smoker and cook the asparagus until tender, about 1 hour.']
MHPR_Review: I tried this and it is the most delicious asparagus ever. Thank you.
Review_0: An hour was the perfect amount to get a nice smoke in the asparagus and onions without overpowering. I do recommend using large asparagus as some of the smaller ones got overcooked.

We gave it about 10 more minutes and it was perfect. The smoke was subtle and it was delicious. Will make it again anytime we are using the smoker. It is worth the hour.
Review_2: Did not like this at all. Neither did my wife. We tossed the whole pan in the trash. Smoke overpowered all flavors. Oh well.
Review_3: tried it and loved it! I added mushrooms to the mix. #great
Review_4: I love being able to cook an entire meal on the grill and smoker...this is a GReaT side dish that can be smoked while you are smoking your meats. I followed the directions exactly as written and it came out wonderful! This is a keeper!
Review_5: I loved the smoked asparagus
Review_6: Great the way it is everyone needs to try this.Took a little longer to cook but well worth it !!!!!!!!!!
Review_7: I fixed this in the smoker and everyone wanted to know what was in it. It was a huge hit. Am fixing it again on Monday with a smoked briskett.

I thought I followed everything to a T but the result was asparagus that not many people really wanted to eat. Sorry, as I said it was probably my fault.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 30 mins', 'Additional Time: 20 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr 5 mins', 'Servings: 6', 'Yield: 6 servings']
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 lemon, juiced', '¬Ω teaspoon grated fresh ginger root', '2 tablespoons honey', '‚Öì cup chopped fresh basil leaves', '1 tablespoon finely chopped shallots', '1 (3 pound) salmon fillet, with skin']
Directions: ['Make a pan out of aluminum foil by doubling up layers of foil large enough to hold your fillet. Place the foil onto a cookie sheet. Lay the fillet onto the foil with the skin side down. In a small bowl, stir together the oil, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, ginger, honey, basil and shallots. Pour over the salmon and let it marinate while you preheat the grill, about 20 minutes.', 'Preheat a grill for medium-low heat. Slide the foil with the salmon off of the cookie sheet and onto the grill. Cover with the lid and grill the fillet for 10 minutes per inch of thickness, about 20 minutes. Salmon should be able to flake with a fork, but not be too dry. When you serve the salmon, the skin will stick to the foil and your grill will remain clean. Simply slice and use a spatula to scoop the fillet off of the skin to serve.']
MHPR_Review: This was excellent. I'm not a big fish eater but it came out great. Changes: more honey, marinate longer than 20 min!, reserved the marinade boiled it and served it as a sauce. Would definitely make again.
Review_0: Family liked it. So I guess it was good!
Review_1: Only Grilled Salmon Recipe we ever use!!!Love love Love!
Review_2: Made Anne's wonderful salmon, that was purchased in the Pike Street Market. Delicious, moist and loved the taste of the BBQ grill. I added wood chips on the grill for smoke. Asparagus as side
Review_3: Love the marinade, added cilantro
Review_4: I made some substantial changes for this dish. Namely I did not grill the salmon or put the sauce on the salmon. I actually used the sauce on the vegetables I sauteed and thickened it with a roux. 1. Pre-Heat oven to 425¬∞ F. 2. Follow the above recipe for the sauce. 3. Placing Salmon on wire racks over a baking sheet, season to taste with salt, pepper and dill weed. Then place in oven. Depending on the size of the salmon you may need 10-15 min per side. 4. Cook rice as instructed on the package you use. 6. In the saut√© pan, heat up 2 tbsp oil then add the firmer veggies (I used shredded carrots, celery, onion, zucchini, mushroom and bell pepper - season with a little salt, pepper and ground ginger) cook about 5 minutes or until the onions are translucent. Add the zucchini (watery veggies like squash, zucchini, etc. tend to get too soft when sauteed for too long). Add in the 2 tbsp butter and let it melt. Then add 2 tbsp corn starch to create the roux before adding in the sauce from step two. Mix until sauce has thickened and coated vegetables.
Review_5: This was tasty. I took suggestions and let the salmon marinate for a few hours and also left the skin on out of preference.
Review_6: Amazing! Best Salmon recipe I have ever had! TY

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 20 mins', 'Total Time: 30 mins', 'Servings: 4', 'Yield: 4 servings']
Ingredients: ['¬º cup butter', '1 Walla Walla or other sweet onion, thinly sliced', '1 (4 ounce) package cream cheese', '4 hot dogs, or your favorite sausages', '4 hot dog buns', 'brown mustard', '1 cup sauerkraut']

Recipe_Name: Shrimp Pasta Salad with Fresh Dill
Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 10 mins', 'Cook Time: 10 mins', 'Additional Time: 2 hrs', 'Total Time: 2 hrs 20 mins', 'Servings: 12', 'Yield: 6 cups']
Ingredients: ['1 (8 ounce) package seashell pasta', '1 cup mayonnaise', '¬º cup sour cream', '1 ¬Ω tablespoons lemon juice', '1 ¬Ω tablespoons Dijon mustard', '¬º cup chopped fresh dill weed', '¬º teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 (4 ounce) cans small shrimp, drained', '¬Ω cup chopped celery', '¬Ω cup chopped seeded cucumber', '2 tomatoes, diced', '3 tablespoons minced shallot', 'salt to taste']
Directions: ['Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook until tender, about 8 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold running water to cool.', 'Combine mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, mustard, dill, and black pepper in a serving bowl. Gently stir in cooled pasta, shrimp, celery, cucumber, tomatoes, and shallots. Mix in salt to taste and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.']
MHPR_Review: This is good recipe but use frozen shrimp not canned! If possible, AVOID shrimp that has been peeled and deveined before freezing. It may cause a loss of flavor and texture (the shells help to protect the meat of the shrimp). I used an entire bag of U36/40 sized shrimp b/c I like a bigger shrimp in my salads. I adjusted the quantities of the veggies in the recipe to 1 c. of celery, 1 c. of cucumber, 4 small tomatoes (which I seeded) and 5 TBS of shallots. I would recommend Farfalle (bow tie) pasta instead of shells and I used more like 12 oz. Shells just seems to trap dressing which can be good or bad depending on your sensibilities. I adjusted the dressing too by adding a TBS of Worchestershire sauce and more dill but quantity wise there was plenty of dressing even with the increases in veggies and pasta. This salad needs generous amounts of salt and pepper but all in all it's very tasty.
Review_0: Slightly modified the recipe: used frozen salad shrimp (never used canned) and frozen peas because I could. Used a different shaped pasta as it was on hand. Didn't have celery and will be sure to have it next time as I was missing the little crunch it adds. Left out the tomatoes as I don't like them mixed in salads. Seems too saucy at first but the pasta absorbs it over time. Like most pasta salads, tastes better the next day when the flavors have time to blend.
Review_1: Easy to make and very tasty!
Review_2: This was perfect salad for a light lunch. My sister loved it. Confession, I did use frozen cooked salad shrimp instead of canned.
Review_3: This is delicious! I used fresh shrimp and boiled it in Zatarains Crab and Shrimp Boil....it‚Äôs a favorite in our house. Everything else I followed as directed.
Review_4: I always follow a recipe exactly as written when I make it for the first time. That being said, this dish was absolutely delicious and everyone enjoyed the dish. This recipe was a ‚Äú10‚Äù in my family. Everyone simply enjoyed this dish and a lucky few were able to get ‚Äúseconds.‚Äù Which means the next time I make it I will double the ingredients. This dish will definitely be in the monthly family rotation of meals in the future.
Review_5: Only change was I substituted a large can of solid albacore tunable for the shrimp. Excellent side dish for a cookout!
Review_6: The first time I made it exactly as written. Delicious. I've made it two more times for family functions adding crab meat and yellow bell pepper. I use grape tomatoes. Will make this every summer! Thanks for sharing!

Review_8: This a wonderful summer salad. Thank you!

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 15 mins', 'Cook Time: 45 mins', 'Total Time: 1 hr', 'Servings: 8', 'Yield: 8 servings']

Review_6: came out awesome!
Review_7: This has been a favorite for years. I do cut the sugar in half. I make it every time I cook a ham, and everyone loves it.

Basic_Info: ['Prep Time: 25 mins', 'Cook Time: 15 mins', 'Total Time: 40 mins', 'Servings: 8', 'Yield: 8 hamburgers']
Ingredients: ['2 pounds lean ground beef', '¬Ω pound bulk Italian sausage', '¬Ω large red onion, chopped', '2 Anaheim chile peppers, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '¬æ pound Muenster cheese, shredded', '1 egg', '1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 teaspoon chili powder', 'salt and pepper to taste']
Directions: ['Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, and lightly oil the grate.', 'Mix the ground beef, sausage, onion, chile pepper, garlic, Muenster cheese, egg, Worcestershire sauce, and chili powder in a mixing bowl until evenly combined. MHPR_Review: I have to admit, I give these 5 stars because this is my recipe! My original recipe calls for cubing the cheese, not shredding it, so it's your call. Enjoy:-) UPDATE: Ramon wanted to know how I serve these--I like ranch dressing on mine, my husband prefers Cholula hot sauce on his, and the kids put ketchup on theirs--I have also made these with cooked, crumbled bacon inside, but you can do whatever you want! I usually do use more garlic in mine, too, but most people don't like a lot of garlic, so I toned it down for this recipe.

These shrunk considerably so if I were to make again, I'd only make 6 patties.

Review_5: My husband and I made them and loved them! I think if you put too much egg in there it could taste a little bit like meatloaf. Maybe more worcestershire sauce and less egg but we loved them just as it was and didn‚Äôt have a bun nor did we put anything on top. We ate it with a salad.

I used pork tenderloin and marinated for about 8 hours. I often find that marinades with soy sauce end up with the meat tasting just like soy sauce, but that wasn‚Äôt the case here. I used pork tenderloin, and the pork flavor was the star. My pork cubes were about 1-1/2‚Äù to 2‚Äù, they were grilled for a total of 6 minutes, and they ended up slightly overdone.
